loans.name: Leonardo De Jesus

texts.es:
Leonardo es un hombre de 55 años de edad, un agricultor humilde y trabajador ubicado en el municipio de Yarumal. Es casado y fruto de su matrimonio nacieron 5 hijos por los cuales ha dejado hasta la última gota de sudor en cada día para llevar el alimento a su hogar. 


Leonardo se especializa en el cultivo de verduras como lo son papa criolla, pimentón y fríjol, estos bastos terrenos que aprecian en la foto, los heredo de su padre y madre y espera que uno de los hijos se haga cargo de dichos campos que han significado el progreso de su familia. 

Desea solicitar un préstamo para la compra de semillas de las verduras anteriormente descritas, busca ampliar sus cultivos y reemplazar algunos que debido a las inclemencias del clima quedaron destrozados. 

Su principal sueño es tener salud para trabajar en ese terreno del cual se siente tan orgulloso y seguir generando productos de calidad para los consumidores.
texts.en:
Leonardo is a 55-year-old man, a humble and hardworking farmer located in the municipality Yarumal. He is married, and from his marriage, 5 children were born for whom he has given even his last drop of sweat each day in order to support them. 

Leonardo specializes in the cultivation of vegetables like the "papa criolla" (Colombian yellow potato), bell pepper and beans. 

The vast plots that are pictured in the photo he inherited from his father and mother, and he hopes that one of his children will take charge of these fields, which have been the progress of his family. 

He is requesting a loan for the purchase of the previously described vegetable seeds. He wants to broaden his crop and replace some that, due to inclement weather, were ruined.

His main dream is to be healthy so he can work the land of which he feels so proud, and to continue generating quality products for the consumers.

loans.use: to buy seeds to plant bell pepper, "papa criolla" (Colombian yellow potato) and beans.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 41 years old and has five children. She is married and has four children who are presently in school.

Lilibeth is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vaccines, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Lilibeth has been in this business for five years now and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Niaguis Douma Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois a été inauguré le 10 Mai 2001. Ce groupe est composé de vingt femmes qui exercent le commerce, se soutiennent solidairement et prennent des prêts qu'elles remboursent à temps. Madame Saly qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 39 ans et mère de six enfants dont trois filles. Elle s'active dans la vente de légumes depuis plus de cinq ans. Avec le prêt sollicité elle compte acheter des légume en quantité. Elle n'a pas de problèmes majeurs car elle arrive à écouler sa marchandise. Les bénéfices vont servir à participer à la prise en charge de la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en: This banc villageois was founded on May 10, 2001. This group is made up of 20 women who run businesses, standing in solidarity with one another and taking loans that they repay on time. Mrs. Saly, who is at right in the photo with her hand raised, is the group's representative. She is married, 39 years old, and the mother six children, three of them girls. She has been selling vegetables for more than five years. With the loan requested, Mrs. Saly plans to purchase a number of vegetables. She has no serious problems since she is able to sell her merchandise. The profits will go toward contributing to paying her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables.

loans.name: San Juan De Dios Group

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer de 35 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 1 hijo de 8 años, y su negocio es la elaboración de pan tradicional. 
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, sensible, sincera, comprensiva, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad ‘Cotoca’ que se encuentra al este de la ciudad y es reconocido, por su tradicional producción de jalea y melao (derivados de la caña de azúcar), como también de horneados de maíz y yuca, como el sonso, roscas, arepas, cuñapés y bizcochos. . De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Luz es de tez trigueña, ojos marrones, cabello castaño largo lo usa amarrado por detrás de la cabeza, baja estatura, su lengua materna es el guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica al transporte y con su hijo que estudia en la escuela, viven en casa de sus padres, construida de madera con techo de calamina y piso de tierra cuenta con el servicio de energía eléctrica, agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba y no cuenta con alcantarillado (al centro de pie, viste blusa roja con flores blancas). Debido a su necesidad por mejorar su situación económica formó una banca de personas con negocios como; instalación de paneles solares, venta de semillas para siembra, artesanía en cerámica, elaboración de sombreros de sao, venta de ropa de segunda mano, venta de medicina natural, venta de comida, confección de tejidos, peluquería y venta de queso, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la elaboración y venta de pan casero tradicional, como; Cuñapé (Pequeño bollo hecho de harina de yuca con queso), Empanada de arroz (Horneado de arroz y queso), Zonzo (Puré de yuca mezclado con queso y formado en un palito), Bizcochos de trigo (Bollitos duros de harina de trigo), y otros, actividad que realiza de forma independiente en un cuarto habilitado como cocina para hornear en su casa. "inicié mi panadería rápidamente, con un pequeño horno casero y prestándome harina, huevos y manteca de mis vecinos, porque mi hijo ya nacía y necesitaba trabajar…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que sus ventas son diarias, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de un horno industrial para reponer su horno casero. Su sueño es abrir una panadería completa dentro de un mercado, ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de un horno industrial para cambiar su horno casero y continuar con su negocio. Esta es la 4 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 8 años que viene realizando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Luz solicita un préstamo para la compra de un horno industrial para cambiar su horno casero y continuar trabajando con su panadería tradicional.
texts.en:
Luz is a 35-year-old woman. She lives with her partner and has one son aged 8 years. Her business is making traditional bread. She is a good mother and is enterprising, sensitive, sincere, understanding, responsible and very hard-working. She runs her business in the 'Cotoca' area which is to the east of the city and is renowned for its traditional production of jelly and molasses (both made from cane sugar) as well as baked products made of corn and cassava, such as 'sonso', 'roscas' [ring doughnuts], 'arepas' [corn tortillas], cuñapés and 'bizcochos'. The area has a warm sub-tropical climate with a temperature which varies between 21 and 35 degrees centigrade during the day. 

Luz is olive-skinned with brown eyes and long chestnut-coloured hair which she wears tied behind her head. She is of short stature. Her mother tongue is Guaraní which she speaks among the family and she speaks Spanish for general culture and for the business she does. She shares her life with her partner who makes a living from transport, and with her son who goes to school. They live in her parents' house, built of wood with a sheet metal roof and earth floor. It has electricity and water from a well, extracted by pump. It does not have a sewer connection. (She is in the centre of the photo wearing a red blouse with white flowers.) 

Due to her need to improve her financial situation she set up a communal bank of people with businesses such as installing solar panels, selling seed for sowing, ceramic handicrafts, making 'sao' straw hats, selling second hand clothing, selling natural medicines, selling food, making fabric, hairdressing and selling cheese, in order to ask for a loan and improve their businesses. Her business is making and selling traditional home-made bread such as 'Cuñapé' (small rolls made of cassava flour with cheese), rice empanadas (baked from rice and cheese), 'Zonzo' (cassava puree mixed with cheese and shaped on a stick), wheat 'bizcochos' (little hard rolls made from wheat flour) and other items. She does her work independently in a room set up as a kitchen to bake in her home. "I set my business up quickly, with a small domestic oven and borrowing flour, eggs and lard from my neighbours, because my son had already been born and I needed to work" she says. 

The advantage of her business is that she has daily sales; the disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy an industrial oven to replace her domestic oven. Her dream is to open a complete bakery inside a market. She wants to expand her business by buying an industrial oven to change her domestic oven and continue with her business. This is the fourth loan cycle with the institution in the 8 years she has been doing this work. 

These are the reasons why Luz is asking for a loan to change her domestic oven and continue working with her traditional bakery.

loans.use: to buy an industrial oven to change her domestic oven and continue working with her traditional bakery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to service his motorcycle and do some repairs

loans.name: Minerva

texts.en:
Minerva works hard to support her family. Minerva is married and has a pillow making business in the Philippines.

Minerva requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to purchase more materials for her business.

Minerva has been in this business for 30 years now.

Minerva would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her pillow making business

loans.name: Teodesia

texts.en:
Teodesia works hard to support her family. Teodesia is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Teodesia requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Teodesia has been in this business for 3 years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Teodesia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jaquiline

texts.en:
Jaquiline is 38 years old and has one child. She is married and her child is in school. Jaquiline is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Now, Jaquiline has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to help raise her pigs.

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.en:
Vanessa is 33 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Vanessa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, coffee, sugar, cooking oil, soft-drinks, beers, noodles, etc. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Vanessa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is 37 years old, married, and he supports a family of four children. He has been practicing farming for the last ten years, earning KES 12,000 per month. 

He has applied for KES 25,000 loan from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply, to increase his income. He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children. 

Nelson's future hope and dream is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply.

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is 28 years old, single, and supports one child. He has been in a shop business for the last one and a half years. He sells sugar, salt, bar soaps, rice and maize flour and earns a monthly income of KES.8,000.


He has applied for a loan of KES.15,000, and this being his first loan from Visionfund, he plans to expand his business.

Titus plans to use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his younger brother. His future dreams are to own a supermarket and be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is a 37-year-old married woman with four children, all of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Joy has a food vending business in the Philippines, which she has been involved in for four years. 

Joy has requested a 13,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase more packs of food to sell to her customers. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more packs of food to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Renita

texts.en:
Renita is widowed and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now and works hard to support her family. 

Renita has requested an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional varieties of fish to sell. In the future, Renita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional varieties of fish to sell.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 63 years old and married, with one child.

Marina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more stocks to sell in her general store.

Marina has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from raising livestock and electronic mobile load retailing.

Marina aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Maria Fe

texts.en:
Maria Fe is 35 years old and married. Maria Fe works very hard to provide for her family.

Maria Fe runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like sanitary pads, diapers, canned goods, detergent and soap, biscuits, etc. to sell.

Maria Fe has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items. In the future, Maria Fe would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like sanitary pads, diapers, canned goods, detergent and soap, biscuits, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Jose Raul

texts.es:
José, vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida que es ama de casa y un hijo que no estudia, aprendió de sus padres a trabajar en la agricultura, lo hace de forma independiente desde hace cuatro años, normalmente cultiva maíz en dos manzanas de tierra.
Se acerca a Padecomsm en busca de apoyo con un crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas y pagar el acondicionamiento del terreno en que cultiva maíz, espera contar con lo que le hace falta para que su negocio continúe funcionando.
Desea tener resultados positivos con su cosecha, cancelar su deuda y tener alimento almacenado para su familia.
texts.en:
José lives in his own house with his life partner, who is a housewife, and a son who is not in school. He learned to farm from his parents. He has been farming independently for four years; he normally grows corn on two manzanas (a total of about 3.5 acres) of land.

He is coming to PADECOMSM for support with a loan to buy fertilizer and pay for preparation of the site on which he grows corn; he hopes to count on what he needs for his business to continue running. 

He wishes to have positive results with his harvest, pay his debt and have food stored for his family.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and pay for preparation of the site on which he grows corn.

loans.name: Sveta

texts.ru: Света, 45 лет, есть 3 детей. У нее среднее образование, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 1995 году, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Светы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 6 коров, 20 овец. На 2,40 га земли она выращивает картофель и люцерну для реализации. Ежемесячный доход Светы составляет 18,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для увеличения поголовья. Света хочет приумножить скот, чтобы иметь возможность накопить средства на покупку нового холодильника.
texts.en: Sveta is 45 years old and has three children. She has a secondary education. She rears animals and grows crops for additional income for her family, having started in 1995 with the purchase of livestock to the sum of 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Sveta's hard work, today she has six cows and 20 sheep. She grows potatoes and alfalfa for sale on 2.4 hectares of land. Sveta's monthly income is 18,000 som (KGS). In order to develop her business further, she has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy some livestock in order to increase her herd. Sveta wants to increase her livestock in order to be able to save up funds to buy a new refrigerator.

loans.use: to buy some livestock in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production.

loans.name: Irenia

texts.en:
Irenia is 54 years old, married, and has seven children. She is engaged in a piggery business. She raises pigs and sells them at the market. She needs to increase her income to provide for her children's daily needs, specially their educational needs, so she borrowed a loan to buy feed for the pigs so that she can produce good quality pigs and can deliver more pigs to the market that will generate more income.

Irenia's plan for the future to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase feed  for the pigs.

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah is 50 years old, married to Martha, and blessed with four children between the ages of seven and 14 years. He has been into dairy farming for the last four years, earning a profit of KES 25,000 per month.

Jonah has applied for a loan of KES 30,000 from VisionFund Kenya to help him purchase dairy feed. He plans to use the anticipated profits from his business to educate his children.

His future dream is to establish a zero grazing unit on his farm in order to attain financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase dairy feed.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Evangeline requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase ingredients for her food-vending business.

Evangeline has been in this business for five years now. In the future, Evangeline would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food-vending business.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a candle-making business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy materials like wax, wicks, etc. for her candle making business.

Marina has been in this business for 20 years. She earns more income from selling ready-to-wear.

Marina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials like wax, wicks, etc. for her business

loans.name: Ma. Fatima

texts.en:
Ma. Fatima is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Ma. Fatima is 38 years old, and her four children are all currently in school.

Ma. Fatima has a buy-and-sell personal collection business in the Philippines. Ma. Fatima requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional products like body lotion, perfume, bags, beauty soap, and other personal care products.

Ma. Fatima has been in this business for eight years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional personal collection products like body lotion, perfume, bags, beauty soap and other personal care products.

loans.name: Tazhikan

texts.ru: Тажикан, 54 года, замужем, 2 детей. У нее среднее образование. Она ответственна, целеустремленна, оптимистичная и доброжелательна. Дети активно помогают по хозяйству. Семья очень дружная, отношения в семье очень хорошие. Тажикан в качестве дохода для своей семьи, 30 лет назад начала заниматься сельским хозяйством. Благодаря упорному труду Тажикан, она смогла добиться хороших результатов в своей деятельности, ее прибыль в месяц составляет в среднем 7,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 13 овец, 2 лошади. Доходы от бизнеса позволили Тажикан вырастить и обучить детей. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 10 овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Она намерена накопить на приобретение земельного участка.
texts.en: Tazhikan is 54 years old, married, and has two children. She has a secondary education. She is responsible, ambitious, optimistic and kind-hearted. Her children actively help her on the farm. Her family is very tight-knit and relations in the family are very good. 30 years ago Tazhikan began farming to get income for her family. Thanks to Tazhikan's hard work, she was able to achieve good results in her business, and her profit per month is on average 7,000 som (KGS). She has two cows, 13 sheep and two horses. The income from the business has enabled Tazhikan to raise and educate her children. In order to develop her business further, she has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 60,000 som (KGS) to buy ten sheep to increase the size of her flock. She intends to save up to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy ten sheep for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Jorgie

texts.en:
Jorgie is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jorgie is 34 years old and has four children who are currently in school.

Jorgie has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Jorgie has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Lyndiane 2Nd Pont Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois a été inauguré le 09 Mai 2001. Ce groupe est constitué de sept membres. Ces femmes s'activent toutes dans le petit commerce et elles remboursent toutes leurs prêts avec succès. Madame Fatoumata qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 50 ans et mère de sept enfants dont quatre garçons. Elle s'active dans la vente de légumes depuis plus de cinq ans. Elle va acheter avec le prêt sollicité des sacs d'oignons, de pommes de terre et de carotte. Les bénéfices vont servir à épargner et à aider son mari sur la prise en charge de l'éducation des enfants.
texts.en: This banc villageois was founded on May 9, 2001. This group is made up of seven members. These women all run small businesses and repay all their loans successfully. Mrs. Fatoumata, who is at right in the photo with her hand raised, is the group's representative. She is married, 50 years old, and the mother of seven children, four of them boys. Mrs. Fatoumata has been selling vegetables for more than five years. With the loan requested, she is going to purchase sacks of onions, potatoes, and carrots. The profits will go toward her savings and toward helping her husband with the costs of the children's education.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 30 years old, married, and she supports a family of five children. She has been operating her retail business for the last ten years, earning KES 10,000 per month. 

Gladys has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply, to increase her income. She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and to produce enough food for the family. 

Her future hope and dream is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply.

loans.name: Walter Alcides

texts.es:
Walter, necesita de un nuevo préstamo para continuar con su actividad económica, comprara nacazcol, arcilla, barro crudo y leña para aumentar la producción de ollas, sartenes, cantaros y otras piezas de loza, su objetivo es cubrir las demandas que le han hecho sus clientes.
Agradece la ayuda que recibió con el crédito anterior, ya que pudo entregar sus pedidos a tiempo y con mayor calidad, comenta que posee nuevos clientes, su vida familiar está mejorando poco a poco y todos poseen buena salud.
texts.en: Walter needs a new loan to continue with his activity. He will buy nacazcol (black dye), clay, unprocessed clay and firewood to increase production of pots, bowls, jugs and other kitchen pieces.  His goal is to cover the orders already made by customers.  He is grateful for the help he got through the previous loan as it helped him deliver products on time and with better quality. He indicates that he has new customers and his family life is improving slowly, they are all in good health.

loans.use: to buy nacazcol (black dye), clay, unprocessed clay and firewood to increase production of pots, bowls, jugs and other kitchen pieces

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is aged 37 years, married to Conslata, and he supports six children. He has been a farmer for the last 14 years and the business earns him KES 6,000 per month.

He has applied for his first loan of KES. 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer for top dressing his crops to get a better harvest and meet both client and family needs.

He plans to purchase a dairy cow for milk production to sell milk to clients and expand his agricultural projects.

His hope is to be financially stable and expand his agricultural sector.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer for top dressing his crops to get a better harvest and meet both client and family needs.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
According to Belinda, 48, she wants to live a peaceful life and see herself worthy in the sight of God. She tries to be honest in all undertakings, including the management of her business.

Belinda runs a variety store in Davao City. Just like other business owners, she also experiences stiff competition and lack of capital. Besides, she has many debtors who just fled and left behind their debts. Sometimes her honesty and consideration for others doesn’t always come back to her. This faith-testing situation hampers the continuous operation of her business and consequently affects her income.

Now she is the one who needs additional capital of PhP 50,000, which she can use to buy added items to sell in her variety store.

Her profit can supplement her husband’s income and sustain their daily expenditures. They are both working hard to support their children, who are still studying in college. Later on she plans to add another business such as PISO Net (a coin-operated internet café) or a motorcycle for rent.

She regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy added items to sell in her variety store.

loans.name: Zhanyl

texts.ru: Жаныл, 45 лет, замужем, 3 детей. У нее среднее образование. На сегодняшний день занимается сельским хозяйством. В активах есть 6 коров, 25 овец. На 2,10 Га земли выращивает картофель и люцерну. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). Жаныл обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для увеличения поголовья. Свои доходы она и дальше планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса и хочет накопить на проведение ремонта в доме в следующем году.
texts.en: Zhanyl is 45 years old, married, and has three children. She has a secondary education. Today she engages in agriculture. Her assets include six cows and 25 sheep. She grows potatoes and alfalfa on 2.1 hectares of land. Her monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). Zhanyl has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy some livestock to increase the size of her herd. She plans to keep investing her profits in the development of the business, and she wants to save up to carry out renovations of her house next year.

loans.use: to buy some livestock in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Orozgul

texts.ru: Орозгул, 56 лет, замужем, вместе с мужем воспитали 5 детей. По хозяйству помогает супруг. У Орозгул- высшее образование, в качестве дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав около 20 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Орозгул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: корова и 6 овец. На 2,0 Га земли она выращивает кукурузу и пшеницу. Ежемесячный доход составляет до 31,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Орозгул обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) коров для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Orozgul is 56 years old, married, and she and her husband have raised five children. Her husband helps her on the farm. Orozgul has a higher education. She rears animals and grows crops for income for her family, having started about 20 years ago. Thanks to Orozgul's hard work, today she has a cow and six sheep. She grows corn and wheat on 2.0 hectares of land. Her monthly income is up to 31,000 som (KGS). In order to develop her business further, Orozgul has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 120,000 som (KGS) to buy some cows to increase her herd. She plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in the further increase of her number of domestic livestock.

loans.use: to buy some cattle in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma is a 35-year-old married woman. The man shown in the photo is her husband, who is a van driver by profession. He drives in the main city and makes enough income to cover all the expenses of his family.

He wants to change the van's engine, as it is causing a lot of pollution and is consuming too much oil for its work. That is why Najma has availed a loan of 45,000 PKR for her husband to buy a new engine for his vehicle to provide better facilities to his customers.

Najma is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for the van to provide better facilities to his customers

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a married woman and wants to support her husband financially. The man shown in the photo is Nasreen’s husband.

They have been running a shoe-making business for many years and have a good client list. Nasreen needs to increase sales to fulfill the basic needs of the family.

Currently she has requested a 40,000 PKR loan to buy raw materials such as leather, plastic leather, polishes, etc to increase production.

In this way they would be able to increase their sales and earn more income.

She intends to utilize part of the profits on her family's betterment and well-being.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as leather, plastic leather, polishes, etc to increase production.

loans.name: Jertrudes

texts.en:
As an enthusiastic member of CCT Credit Cooperative, Jertrudes gains inspiration from her co-fellowship* members who regularly meet once a week to study the Word of God and share stories about their lives and businesses. She herself has also encouraged her group, her family and her community in Davao City by being a good model entrepreneur.

Jertrudes is a loving wife to her husband Panfilo, a carpenter, and a caring mother to their children. She gives all out support to her husband’s carpentry skills and maximizes it through her furniture business. This has been their source of income for so many years and they have employed two carpenter-helpers.

Jertrudes considers her business as a good foundation that will expand in due time with the grace of God. She hopes that her shop will be well-known in their city, so she can bestow a stable business to their children in the future.

As of now, she needs additional capital to buy a volume of materials like wood, nails, glue and extra carpentry tools. She knows that she can purchase materials at a lower cost if she gets it in volume.

She is requesting a PhP 20,000 loan to address this need, and she is knocking at your generous heart. She won't have any problem in paying the loan because she has gained the virtue of a responsible entrepreneur.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy a volume of materials like wood, nails, glue and extra carpentry tools.

loans.name: Aneela

texts.en:
Aneela is a married woman. She deals in a business selling spices, which are commonly used in food for taste. She purchases spices in bulk from wholesale markets and then sells them in packs of various sizes to the people of her community. She has become famous by providing good quality spices in her locality, and earns enough to support a decent life.

She is a responsible mother and needs to earn more to cover the daily expenditures of her family members.

For this reason, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to buy a stock of salt, red chilies, black pepper and turmeric in large quantities. It will help her to increase her sales and profits alongside meeting her household expenses.

loans.use: to buy a stock of salt, red chilies, black pepper and turmeric in large quantities

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia has been selling dried fish for 26 years. She is a 42-year-old married woman and has seven children. The oldest child is 21 years old and the youngest child is 9 years old. Her husband is a fisherman and work hard for their family.

Ofelia is asking a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy dried fish and milled rice for their daily consumption, gasoline for their boat (used by her husband for fishing), piglets (swine) and feed.

loans.use: to buy dried fish, gasoline, piglets (swine), feed and rice.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
This is Juanita, 55, from General Santos City, South Cotabato. She’s living with Jerry, an inter-island seaman.

Juanita operates a “sari-sari” store, a type of small convenience store in the Philippines. There she sells fresh, dry and packaged commodities, with almost all of her products being essential household items and food. She buys these goods at wholesale prices, then sells them by the piece to her neighbors and the local community. This type of store is very common in the Philippines, and expectedly, the competition is stiff. Fortunately, she has an alternative source of income, a hog-raising venture. It is a promising enterprise but the return of investment takes several months. She has to advance considerable amount of capital before she earns her profit.

As of now, she appeals for PhP 25,000 in supplementary capital to buy additional piglets and feed for her hog-raising business, and more products for her variety store. This will boost her profit and will help sustain their everyday needs. In due time, she plans to buy her own car as a personal reward for all her undertakings.

All CCT community clients such as Juanita are organized into fellowship groups of 15 to 30 members who meet on a weekly basis. There they share stories of their work, repay microfinance loans and draw strength and inspiration from their study of the Word of God.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and feed for her hog raising business.

loans.name: Nisrine

texts.en:
Nisrine is a 30-year-old married mother of one child who has been working in a bookshop since 2004. She is working hard to develop her career so that one day she can establish her own business. Until she makes her dream come true, Nisrine is working hard to provide her child with the best education.

Thus, since her limited monthly salary combined with her husband's are barely enough to cover their increasing living needs, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for her child's school tuition fees.

Education is very important for her, and where she puts so much effort in making sure her child will acquire special university degrees.

loans.use: To pay for her child's school tuition fees

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.es: Jasmin es residente en una urbanización ubicada en Cartagena de Indias y desde la comodidad de su hogar, adecuó un espacio en su vivienda para instalar equipos de cómputo e inaugurar un café internet.  Esta idea de negoció la sugirió de su hija,  quien estudió programación de computadores y le recomendó a su madre invertir en equipos de cómputo bajo su orientación.  Su éxito no se hizo esperar, los vecinos del barrio realizan sus tareas, trabajos o simplemente acceden al servicio de navegación por horas, así mismo realizar sus impresiones y fotocopias de documentos.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el que comprará una impresora y papelería para impresiones.  Su meta a largo plazo es adquirir nuevos equipos y adecuar una habitación de su casa para el negocio.  Su meta familiar es ver a sus hijos graduados como profesionales.
texts.en:
Jasmin is a resident of an urban development located in Cartagena de Indias. From the comfort of her house she has adapted a space to install computer equipment and opened an internet cafe. The idea was suggested to her by her daughter who studied computer programming. She recommended her mother to invest in computers under her guidance. Success was not long in coming, her neighbors do their tasks, work and simply use the internet for hours as well as download and photocopy documents.

Jasmin is currently applying for a loan from Kiva, her first financing through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy a printer and printer paper. Her long term goal is to acquire new equipment and modify a room in her house for the business.Her family goal is to see her children graduate as professionals.

loans.use: to buy a printer and paper for the printer.

loans.name: Los Girasoles De Compone Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS GIRASOLES DE COMPONE”; Este banco se ubica en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Evarista; ella es casada, tiene 54 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de ventas de leche , la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar leche entre otros.
La socia que sale en la foto adjunta pidio permiso para llegar tarde a la reunion por motivos de trabajo.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “LOS GIRASOLES DE COMPONE” communal bank. This bank is located in Anta district of Anta province, Cusco department. The member's name is Evarista. She is married, 54 years old, and has two children. She alternates her daily chores with her business selling milk. She has had this business for quite some time and it is going well thanks to the hard work she does every day. She is responsible and diligent. She wishes to continue working and thus supporting her family. Evarista seeks a loan to buy milk and other items.

The member inserted in the photo asked for permission to arrive to the meeting late because of work.

Evarista is thankful to those who become part of her dream through this loan and she promises to make the loan payments on the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy milk and other items.

loans.name: Edilberto

texts.es:
Edilberto, gracias al crédito anterior tuvo los recursos económicos para solventar los costos de sus trabajos agrícolas y cubrir rápidamente las demandas de sus clientes, cuenta con estabilidad económica y un estilo de vida más confortable.
Requiere de más capital para  comprar un silo metálico para almacenar granos y con el resto adquirirá insumos agrícolas para sembrar granos básicos, espera tener todo listo para la nueva temporada de siembra.
texts.en:
Thanks to his prior loan, Edilberto had the resources to pay his farming expenses and rapidly meet his customers' demands. He has reliable income and a more comfortable quality of life.

He needs more capital in order to buy a metal silo to store the grain and with the remaining funds buy farming supplies to plant basic grains. He hopes to have everything ready in time for the new planting season.

loans.use: to buy a metal silo to store the grain and with the remaining funds buy farming supplies to plant basic grains.

loans.name: Leopoldo

texts.es:
Leopoldo es un agricultor de 43 años de edad, está casado y tiene 8 hijos a su cargo, el ha sido productor de café desde que tenía 15 años de edad y el café es la principal fuente de subsistencia de su familia, Las metas de Leopoldo es que sus hijos tengan acceso a educación y a una mejor calidad de vida.
Leopoldo cultiva el café bajo la certificación de Comercio Justo y Rain Forest y como premio obtiene mejores mercados para su café, actualmente Leopoldo quiere certificar sus cafetales como producción orgánica lo que le permitirá hacer su cultivo de café más sostenible, más rentable y amigable con las montañas que rodean sus fincas.  
En la actualidad Leopoldo solicita un crédito para certificar orgánico 3.5 hectáreas de cafetal y aprovechando que los cafetales están muy afectados por las plagas y la edad Leopoldo los replantara e iniciara la certificación con la plantación totalmente nueva, esto hará los cafetales más productivos y sostenibles, con las ganancias de su café orgánico Leopoldo mejorara la calidad de vida de toda su familia y sus hijos tendrán la oportunidad de tener una educación de calidad.
texts.en:
Leopoldo is a 43 year-old farmer; he is married and has 8 children to support. He has been a coffee producer since he was 15 years old and coffee is his family’s principal source of subsistence. Leopoldo’s goals are that his children have access to education and a better quality of life.  

Leopoldo grows coffee under Fair Trade and Rain Forest certification and as a reward gets better markets for his coffee. Currently Leopoldo wants to certify his coffee plantations as organic production, which will permit him to make his coffee crop more sustainable, more profitable and 
more in harmony with the mountains surrounding his farms. 

Currently Leopoldo is applying for a loan to certify as organic 3.5 hectares of coffee plantation. Taking advantage of the fact that the coffee plantations are heavily affected by pests and age, Leopoldo will replant them and he will initiate the certification process with a totally new plantation; this will make the coffee plantations more productive and sustainable. With the profits from his organic coffee, Leopoldo will improve the quality of life for his entire family and his children will have the opportunity to have a quality education.

loans.use: buy organic fertilizers, organic coffee plants, organic pesticides and other materials necessary for the conversion of his coffee plantation to organic.

loans.name: Purisima De Cotoca Group

texts.es:
Celsa es una mujer de 56 años de edad, soltera, tiene 6 hijos todos mayores de edad, y su negocio es la venta de comida típica.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, constante, activa, paciente, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en el barrio ‘equipetrillo’ ubicado a 20 kilómetros de la ciudad, se caracteriza por su riqueza artesanal en arcilla y produce principalmente; vasijas, macetas para plantas y otros artículos que son para uso del lugar. De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Celsa es de tez trigueña, ojos marrones, cabello negro con tintes rubios lo usa corto, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (sentada al centro, viste de negro). Su vida la comparte con su hijo menor que trabaja, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de madera con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba, energía eléctrica y no cuenta con alcantarillado. Sus deseos de superación la obligaron a formar una banca de personas con negocios como;  venta de frutas, venta de artesanía, venta de medicina natural, venta de ropa de segunda mano, venta de cosméticos por catálogo, confección de tejidos, pintura en tela, horneado de masas tradicionales y venta de productos lácteos, para solicitar un crédito y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de comida típica, como; Chicharrón (Chanchitos de monte frito), Cogote relleno (cuello de gallina criolla, relleno de papa y plátano),  majao (charque molido, plátanos hervidos y arroz), sopa de maní (sopa a base de maní), y otros, actividad que realiza de lunes a viernes en horarios de oficina y los fines de semana improvisa un puesto de venta para vender comida durante todo el día en las ferias, “mi negocio es nuevo, sin embargo cocino casi toda mi vida, y es por eso que cuento con clientes exigentes con la buena comida…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas duran los 7 días de la semana, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de una vitrina mostrador para mantener los alimentos calientes. Su sueño es mejorar su negocio para tener más clientela, ella desea realizar la compra de una vitrina mostrador para mantener los alimentos calientes. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Celsa solicita un préstamo para la compra de una vitrina mostrador para mantener los alimentos calientes para atraer más clientes.
texts.en:
Celsa is a 56 year old, single, has 6 children, all adults, and her business is selling traditional food. She is enterprising, independent, constant, active, patient, responsible and hardworking. Her business is located in the Equipetrillo neighborhood located 20 kilometers from the city. The area is known for its rich craftsmanship of clay products and produces mainly vases, flower pots and other items that are for useful for the home. The area enjoys a warm subtropical climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 21-35 degrees celsius.

Celsa is of dark complexion, brown eyes, black hair with blond highlights; she is short and of robust physique. Her first language, Guarani, is spoken in the home and she generally speaks Spanish in the community and while doing business. In the photo she is sitting in the center, dressed in black. She lives with her younger son who works; they live in a house owned by the family. It is built of wood and has a tin roof, cement floor, well water extracted by an electric pump power but no sewerage.

Her desire to suecceed drove her to form a communal bank. The businesses the members have include selling fruit, selling crafts, selling natural medicine, selling secondhand clothes, selling cosmetics by catalog, weaving, fabric painting, baking traditional breads and selling dairy products. The seek a loan to improve each of their businesses.

Celsa's business is selling traditional food such as: cracklings (fried pork skin), stuffed cogote (creole chicken neck, stuffed potato and banana), majao (ground jerky, boiled rice and bananas), peanut soup (soup made with peanuts), and others. She works Monday to Friday during office hours and on weekends she sets up a booth to sell food throughout the day at markets. "My business is new, however I have been cooking most of my life, and that is why I have many demanding customers who enjoy good food ... " she says. The advantage of her business is she has sales 7 days a week; the disadvantage is the lack of capital to purchase a display counter to keep food warm.

Her dream is to improve her business to have more customers, she wants to purchase of a display counter for hot foods. This is the 1 cycle of loans with this institution in the one year she has had this business. It is for these reasons that Celsa is applying for a loan for the purchase of a display counter for hot food to attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy a display counter to keep the food hot in order to attract more customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand and re-bar to construct a wall.

loans.name: Jardan Shg-D Group

texts.en:
The lady standing in the middle in the photo is Sabina, a 47-year-old villager and a married mother of three sons. Sabina is a hardworking entrepreneur from Koraput district. She is married, and her husband is a farmer. She sells fresh fish to provide for the everyday needs and expenditures of the family.

Sabina buys different kinds of fish at wholesale prices and sells them by the kilo. She buys fish at the local fish port early in the morning. There are many patrons who prefer her products, since they are assured of freshness and cleanliness. Her store is located in a temporary fish market. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.

Sabina, along with her group members, is requesting a loan amount of 54,000 INR. Sabina does not have a toilet facility in her home, so she will use her portion of the loan amount to build a toilet and lead a disease-free, healthy life.

In the future, she wants her business to continue to flourish, and she desires for her children to get established in their lives.

loans.use: to build a toilet.

loans.name: Alicia Esperanza

texts.es:
Alicia, está solicitando un nuevo crédito para comprar variedad de frutas y verduras frescas con las que piensa atender las demandas diarias de sus clientes.
Con el préstamo anterior Alicia tuvo la facilidad de abastecer su negocio con mercadería de calidad, sus nuevos ingresos le permiten ir disminuyendo sus deudas y mejorar el estilo de vida familiar. Actualmente goza de muy buena salud y no ha tenido dificultades en realizar sus actividades.
texts.en:
Alicia is applying for a new loan to buy a variety of fresh fruits and vegetables with which she plans to meet the daily demands of her customers.

With the previous loan, Alicia was able to supply her business with quality merchandise. Her new revenue lets her continue to reduce her debts and improve the family’s lifestyle. She currently enjoys very good health and has not had any difficulties in carrying out her activities.

loans.use: buy a variety of fresh fruits and vegetables with which she plans to meet the daily demands of her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy Duralita, cement, sand, gravel, and other materials to pave with concrete and roof a portion of his garden.

loans.name: Maa Narayani Shg-E Group

texts.en:
Astama is 49 years old, married, and has two children who are her top priority. Astama is standing in the middle in the photo in a white saree. She is the featured borrower of Maa Narayani SHG-E Group and is from a small village of Koraput district. She is a farmer with banana plantations in her ancestral land. Her husband also helps her in this farming activity. Her two daughters are engaged in a sewing business.

Astama, along with her other group members, has requested a loan amount of 54,000 INR. Astama will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase sanitary fittings, steel pipes, taps, and a commode for her toilet. The loan will help her in fulfilling her prerequisite requirements, and she will be able to lead a healthy and hygienic life with her family.

Astama is very motivated by this plan because it could be the tipping point for a bright future for her family. Triumph in her efforts to elevate the family’s life will do her proud.

loans.use: to purchase sanitary fittings, steel pipes, taps, and a commode for her toilet.

loans.name: Nighat

texts.en:
Nighat is a 42-year-old married woman. The man shown in the photo is her husband, who has been doing a business of crockery sales for many years. He offers various crockery items such as glasses, dinner sets, bowls, etc. He makes a sufficient amount of income to contribute to the family income.

For the improvement of her husband's business, Nighat contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. In this way, he would be able to purchase more variety of crockery such as tea sets, bowls, and glasses in various sizes and designs. He is expecting a boost in his earnings and dreams of expanding his business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of crockery such as tea sets, bowls, and glasses in various sizes and designs.

loans.name: El Esfuerzo Es Grande Group

texts.es: NOYMI de 50 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 02 hijos. Ella Pertenece a la Alcancía Comunal “el esfuerzo es grande” la cual lo conforman 11 socios que trabajan honradamente y con ganas de progresar. Ella hace más de 9 años que puso una bodega de abarrotes el cual le va bien. Gracias a su constante dedicación logro sacar adelante a  su familia. Su mayor deseo es ampliar su negocio y así mejorar su calidad de vida Solicitó el crédito para la compra de arroz azúcar leche y aceite. La Alcancía “el esfuerzo es grande” agradece a los Inversionistas de Kiva por el apoyo brindado. Noymi se encuentra de pie y es la tercera del lado derecho  viste casaca color negro.
texts.en:
Noymi, who is 50 years old, has a live-in partner and two children. She belongs to the communal bank "El esfuerzo es grande" [The Effort Is Great], which is composed of 11 members who work honestly and with the aim of progressing.  

More than nine years ago she started a small grocery store, which is going well.  Thanks to her constant dedication, she managed to get her family ahead. Her greatest wish is to grow her business and in this way improve her quality of life. She requested the loan to buy rice, sugar, milk, and oil.  

The communal bank "El esfuerzo es grande" [The Effort Is Great] thanks the Kiva investors for the support given. Noymi is seen standing and is the third from the right side, dressed in the black jacket.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, and oil.

loans.name: Ganjina

texts.ru: Ganjina is a challenged woman. She was born in southern part of Tajikistan in 1989. She is living in remote district with her family. She is divorced and has one four year child. She is experienced and challenged woman. In order to feed and ensure her family she started to work at catering as a waiter. Then she found a better work at fabric as a sewer. Recently, she is working at fabric and likes her activity. Her child is ill. She is depressed because she has not money to pay the treatment of her child. She appealed to IMON to get a loan to treat her child at hospital. She hopes to be supported and awaits your kindness.
texts.en:
Ganjina was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1989 and is now living in a remote district with her family. She is divorced and has one four year child. She is experienced and challenged woman. In order to feed and ensure her family she started to work in catering as a waiter. Recently, she has been working at fabrics and likes her activity. 

Her child is ill. She is depressed because she has no money to pay for the treatment of her child. She appealed to IMON to get a loan to treat her child at the hospital. She hopes to be supported and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to treat her child at hospital

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca runs a variety store located in one of the public markets in General Santos City, South Cotabato. It has significantly progressed in her fifteen years of operation. She started by selling basic commodities like sachets of shampoo and biscuits, and now she offers rice and feeds. Aside from this, she was able to put up a bakery adjacent to her house. She’s paying two workers to help her in these enterprises.

But, Francisca doesn’t stop dreaming. She still aspires to expand, not only to boost her income and savings, but also to help her neighbors earn a living. She chooses to employ those who are hardworking, but have no chance to land a stable job.

To develop her business further, she is requesting additional capital of PHP 40,000. She plans to buy additional stock for her store and necessary ingredients for her bakery. This will further strengthen her business and uphold the salaries of her workers.

Francisca is married to Edilberto, a driver. Both of them wish that their children will continue developing the business someday.

Francisca is a dutiful member of CCT Credit Cooperative and meets with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

loans.use: to buy additional stock for her store.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia, 64, wakes up very early in the morning and goes to sleep late at night because she has to look after her “sari-sari” (variety) store located in General Santos City, South Cotabato. Some customers buy as early as 4:30 a.m. or as late as 10:30 p.m., and she has to meet their needs or else her business will fail due to competition within the area. Her husband, Eddie, takes turns in looking after her variety store.

Virginia also sells rice and retails cellphone load for additional income. Rice is a staple food and is always in demand, while load retailing meets the needs of prepaid cellphone holders. She has to be creative and resourceful in order to save for hers and her husband’s urgent needs and medical insurance. She knows that she has to prepare for the future. She plans to expand her business by buying additional supplies for her inventory, and she asks for a PHP 30,000 loan for this purpose. She hopes you are willing to help her so she can increase her profit, sustain their everyday needs, and boost her savings.

She is a faithful member of CCT Credit Cooperative and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies for her inventory.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is 46 year old vigorous, married woman. She has had a business of hand-embroidery for many years.  She knows the art of making beautiful embroidery patterns with beads and pearls. She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong.  But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. 

Her husband does not earn enough to support his family well alone. Robina ’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best earning resource in her household. She is a mother of 6 children. 

She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 40000 PKR,  to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand time after time. She hopes to gain more profits for fulfilling her dream of opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand time after time

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 24 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene 6 años de experiencia en el negocio e inicio con capital propio, sus clientes son sus vecinos y con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra salir adelante, la joven es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su madre y su hijo, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, pan dulce, huevos, aceite, etc. y así poder ene mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
The young woman whose face has been blurred due to being 24 years old and living in a high-risk area, has a shop located in her place of residence.  She has six years of experience in the business and began with her own money. Her customers are her neighbors and with what she obtains from her earnings she is able to get ahead. The young woman is a single mother living in her own house with her mother and child.

She is requesting a loan to buy rice, beans, sugar, sweet breads, eggs, oil, etc., and in this way be able to have improved economic earnings.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, sweet bread, eggs, oil, etc.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat  is 61 years old, married woman. She has been running a food stall selling fresh juices for many years. She makes enough money to run her household activities. 

She is eager to provide her family with a better standard of living. In order to improve her business, so she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 45000 PKR. This will be used  to purchase another juicer machine with the packs of sugar and flavors. It would help her to cater to more customers. She dreams of expanding her business and desires to use part of the profits on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase another juicer machine with packs of sugar and flavors

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is aged 29 years, married to Samwel and she supports three children.She has been offering M-Pesa services to clients for the last three years and the business earns her KES 2,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase ATM machines and mobile phone so as to offer better and faster M-Pesa money transaction services to clients. 

She plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as to enable her supply milk daily to clients and educate her children.Her hope is to expand her business sector and improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase ATM machines and mobile phone so as to offer better and faster M-Pesa money transaction services to clients.

loans.name: Buenaventura

texts.es:
Buenaventura, hace la solicitud de un nuevo crédito para comprar un silo metálico para almacenar granos y una bomba de mochila para fumigar sus cultivos, el resto le será de utilidad para pagar el alquiler de una parcela de tierra para sembrar granos básicos.
Agradece la ayuda que se le brindo con el capital que anteriormente se le presto, ha tenido resultados positivos, fortaleció la porqueriza y concluyo sus trabajos agrícolas, manifiesta que gracias a Dios no ha tenido problemas para seguir trabajando y que cada día lucha para salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Buenaventura is applying for a new loan in order to buy a metal silo for storing grains, and a backpack pump for spraying her crops. The rest will be useful for the paying the rent on a parcel of land for growing staple grains.

She is grateful for the help she was offered with the capital that was lent to her previously and has had postive results. She has built up her pig-raising operation and carried out her farm work, She says that thanks to God she has not had problems in continuing her work, and that each day she strives to move forward in life along with her family.

loans.use: to buy a metal silo for storing grains and a backpack pump for spraying her crops.

loans.name: Jebb

texts.en:
Jebb from General Santos City, South Cotabato, is working really hard to improve his buy and sell business. He buys sacks of charcoal and repacks it per kilo, then sells it along sidewalks of the city. He also sells charcoal stoves to match his original product. Later on he added in plastic products to his inventory. He has expandsed his business little by little towards his goal of owning a grocery store someday.  

For now his wife, Louvella, runs a simple variety store while taking care of their children at their residence. As a further step towards realizing his dream, he applied for PhP 35,000 additional capital to purchase more sacks of charcoal and supplies for his variety store. His income will sufficiently meet his family’s daily needs since his children are still young.  

He draws encouragement from his co-fellowship* members who meet every week to share life stories and Bible reflections. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida  has successfully established her business manufacturing artificial flowers. She is noted in her town for her good work and makes sufficient amount of income to contribute to the family income. The immense experience in the art of flower making has lent her great versatility in making flowers to meet her client’s needs.

 For the improvement of her business she has applied a loan of 45000 PKR  to buy the needed materials, such as tissue paper, wire, floral tape, paints along with glittering materials for increasing her sales and profits.

loans.use: to buy the additional materials for making artificial flowers,such as tissue paper, wire, floral tape, paints with glittering material for increasing her sales and profits

loans.name: Blema Tesaa Group

texts.en:
Robert is a group consists of three members and Robert is a 43-year-old man, marriage to Rose, a 36 year-old-woman.

Every morning Robert buys soft drinks from the wholesalers and at a lower price and sell them to his customers. Robert usually operates the business from 7am to 7pm every day. In order to make more income he has planned to buy more soft drinks and sell to customers. 

To make his plan come true, he needs more money to do so, that is why he together with his friends needs a loan from ID-Ghana. They are requesting for a loan total GHS 2,400.  As Robert, the two other women would like to use their parts of the loan for their own businesses. 

They hope Kiva – ID-Ghana will support them to better their business

loans.use: To buy more soft drinks and for selling to customers.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward, aged 24, is single. He lives in a rural area with his family and deals in cattle keeping as well as farming. Edward has been in business since 2000, working 7 days a week and 14 hours per day. He started the business to improve the family's income.

Edward acquired a loan to purchase veterinary drugs for his cattle and herbicides for his crops to help improve their quality and output. His hope for the future is to be the leading supplier of cows and food crops in his home village. Edward's main challenge is poor weather conditions, leading to poor pastures. He describes himself as an honest and hardworking man encouraging lenders to reduce the interest rates.

loans.use: To purchase veterinary drugs for his cattle

loans.name: Luis

texts.pt:
Nasceu em Namaacha província de Maputo tem 29 anos de idade, vive maritalmente pai de 2 filhos menores de idade, todos frequentam a escola, responsabiliza-se pela sua mãe que vive em sua casa.
Começou a trabalhar com a Hluvuku em 2010, este é o seu 7º empréstimo com o qual pretende aumentar o volume do seu negócio de venda de produtos da 1ª necessidade como: amendoim, feijão e açúcar para satisfazer os seus clientes. 
Futuramente pretende concluir a sua obra de residência e fazer mestrado.
texts.en:
Luis was born in Namaacha province of Maputo. He is 29, and he is married with 2 small children who both go to school. He is also responsible for his mother who lives with him.
He began working with Hluvuku in 2010. This is his 7th loan which he wants to use to increase stock in his business where he sells basic products such as peanuts, beans an sugar to meet his customers' needs. 
In the future, he would like to finish building his home and get his master's degree.

loans.use: to buy peanuts, Compra de  amendoim, beans and sugar

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 27 years old single and blessed with two children.She has been making bricks for the last two years and earns a monthly profit of KES.12000. 
She has applied for a loan of KES.10,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy firewood to make bricks and sell to her customers who are growing in number.


She also operates a cereals kiosk and  she plans to use the profits to increase/expand her business and dreams of educating her children to higher standards.

loans.use: to buy firewood and pay workers

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 41 years old, married with five children.Marilou works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, bread, shampoo, beauty soap and other groceries.

She has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Marilou aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, bread, shampoo, beauty soap and other groceries.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Louella is 18 years old and is 7th of the twelve children in the family. Her mother Marilyn supports the family through her raising livestock business in the Philippines.

Louella is studying bachelor of science in information technology and is currently on her 1st of this 4-year course.

Marilyn is borrowing PHP 5000 to pay tuition fees of her daughter Louella for the first semester of the school year 2015-16.

When she graduates, Louella plans to be gainfully employed so she could help to improve the quality of life of her family in the future.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's tuition fees for a B.Sc. in IT

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George, aged 32 years, is married. He lives in a trading center with his family of three children, all attending school. George deals in a mobile money business and agriculture. He has many customers; however, he is challenged by a limited float as he, at times, runs out of cash to serve them. George will use the loan to increase the float.

George works 7 days a week and 13 hours per day. He acquired this loan to increase his mobile money business as he has hopes of expanding into a large business with many branches. George's main challenges are the system breakdown for service providers and competition from others. He encourages fellow business people to be innovative and hardworking and to use the opportunity of getting loans to boost their businesses.

loans.use: to increase his mobile money float

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen  has successfully established her business manufacturing carpets with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva.  Now she has attained many customers and makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income.

Previously with the help of Kiva she was able to expand her business. Now she has applied a loan of 55000 PKR  to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester, and polypropylene fibers to increase her sales and generating more income for meeting her daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy good quality wool, nylon, polyester fibers for weaving to increase her sales and generating more income for meeting her daily expenses

loans.name: God Is Great Group

texts.en:
God is Great, which consists of seven members who live near one another, is one of ID-Ghana's group loans from the Korkor branch. The members deal in general goods, hair products, mobile phone credit, groceries, wigs, tea, bread and noodles.

Constance, a 36-year-old woman, is the group representative. She is married to Henry, 44 years old, and they have three children who are attending school. In order to support her husband, Constance runs mobile phone credit at her residence. To increase her business income, Constance realizes that she needs extra capital to add a variety of of phone credit cards to sell to customers. Unfortunately, she does not have cash to do so. 

Constance's colleagues in this group are also facing the same problem as her, so they decided to join ID-Ghana for financial help and applied for a loan of GHS 13,400. This loan will go a long way to improve their businesses. The members love to invest in their businesses because they will make good profit in a few days. This is a sixth loan cycle and the members promise to repay promptly.

loans.use: To add a variety of phone credit cards to sell to customers.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 32 years old, married and supports a family of five children. He has had a posho mill for the last 12 years earning KES.10,000 per month.

He has applied for KES25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production and surplus for gain. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children. His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and surplus for gain.

loans.name: Hebisiba

texts.en:
Hebisiba is 59 years old, married and supports a family of 4 children.  She has been practicing farm supplies for the last 3 years earning KES 15,000 per month. 

Hebisiba has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply in the area for more income gain. She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children. 

Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply in the area for more income gain.

loans.name: Mellen

texts.en:
Mellen is aged 42 years, married to Hiram and she supports four children. She has been practicing dairy farming  for the last 6 years and the business earns her KES 36,000 per month. 

Mellen has applied for her first loan of KES25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for more milk production and supply her clients, for more income gain. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and to advance family projects. Her hope is to be financially stable and expand her business sector.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for more milk production and supply her clients for more income gain.

loans.name: Melania

texts.en:
Melania is 50 years old and has two children.  Melania is married and has one child still in school.

Melania is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Melania requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Melania has been in this business for 6 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Mustiola

texts.en:
Mustiola is 41 years old, married with two children. Mustiola works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like shampoo, fabric conditioners, cooking oil, eggs, cereals, etc. to sell.

Mustiola has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from selling frozen foods.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Mustiola aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like shampoo, fabric conditioners, cooking oil, eggs, cereals, etc. to sell

loans.name: Sandra Beatriz

texts.es:
Sandra mantiene la continuidad de su negocio, mismo que está creciendo con la ayuda de créditos, lo ha fortalecido con nuevos productos que sus clientes consumen, su familia se mantiene y las condiciones de vida son más confortables.
Necesita de un nuevo crédito para comprar frutas, pasta de chocolate, golosinas, boquitas, bebidas, etc., estos productos serán de ayuda para cubrir las demandas de sus clientes, sus esfuerzos son enfocados en seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Sandra maintains the continuity of her business, which is growing with the help of loans. She has strengthened it with new products that her customers consume. Her family is supported and living conditions are more comfortable.

She needs a new loan to buy fruit, chocolate sauce, candy, snacks, drinks, etc.; these products will help meet the demands of her customers. Her efforts are focused on continuing to progress.

loans.use: buy fruit, chocolate sauce, candy, snacks, drinks, etc.; these products will help meet the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar has successfully built her business of general store with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. By the time she has attained good number of customers and makes good amount of income to contribute in the family income. Previously with the help of Kiva she was able to expand her business.
