The Women’s Committee Group named “Kuña Kyrey” is participating in the poverty elimination program. Its 19 members are below the poverty line, which means they are in an extreme poverty situation. All of them want to improve their living conditions so that they can help their families.

One of the members is Sra. Carmen, who sells clothing. Through her efforts and all of her hard work, she strives to grow and improve each day. As a result of her sales, Carmen has been able to help her family with her income by providing them everything that they need. She is known in her group for being enthusiastic, determined, and self-sacrificing.

Sra. Carmen is requesting a loan in order to buy various articles of clothing to sell such as T-shirts, jeans, shirts, trousers, and other items so that she can continue making sales just as before. She and the rest of her group appreciate the opportunity they have received so that they can improve.

loans.use: to buy T-shirts, jeans, shirts, trousers, and other articles of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Hermanos Dom Group

texts.es: Marcos, tiene 39 años de edad, esta soltero vive con sus padres y 4 hermanos en una aldea del municipio de Intibucá.  Marcos siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura cultivando maíz, frijol y papas. La mayor producción es de papas y la vende en la misma zona. Esta solicitando otro préstamo en forma grupal, este préstamo es el tercer ciclo con ODEF y lo va invertir en la compra de semillas de papa, abono, foliar e insecticida para el cultivo de papa. Su objetivo es darle buen mantenimiento y obtener más ganancias para poder comprar un terreno. El grupo se llama Hermanos Dom y lo integran 5 miembros, que viven en la misma comunidad y se dedican a la agricultura, quienes solicitan un préstamo grupal por 64,000 lempiras para comprar semillas y abonos para el cultivo de papas. En la foto se identifican a la izquierda está Jesús, y Marcos a la derecha y sentados están Santos, Pedro y Gilberto a la derecha.
texts.en:
Marcos is 39 years old, single, and lives with his parents and four siblings in a neighborhood in the town of Intibucá. He has always worked in agriculture, cultivating crops such as corn, beans, and potatoes. What he produces most is potatoes and he sells this crop in the same region. Marcos is requesting another loan with his group, which is his third one with ODEF. He will invest in the purchase of seed potatoes, compost, foliar fertilizers, and insecticides for his potato crop. His goal is to maintain a good crop and generate more income so that he can buy a plot of land.

The group is called “Hermanos Dom” and consists of five members who live in the same community and work in agriculture. They are requesting a group loan in the amount of 64,000 HNL in order to buy seeds and compost for their potato crops. In the photo, Jesús is standing on the left and Marcos is on the right. The row that is seated consists of Santos, Pedro, and Gilberto who is on the right.

loans.use: to buy seed potatoes, compost, foliar fertilizers, and insecticides.

loans.name: Lyndiane 2Nd Pont Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois a été inauguré le 09 Mai 2001. Ce groupe est constitué de huit membres qui font tous le petit commerce. Des femmes engagées et qui remboursent toutes leurs prêts sans difficultés. Madame Mariama qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 34 ans et mère de trois enfants dont deux filles. Elle s'active dans la vente de jus depuis plusieurs années avec beaucoup de réussite. Elle va acheter avec le prêt sollicité des sacs de pain de singe, des sacs de bissap et des sacs de sucre. Les bénéfices vont servir à aider son mari à la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
This "banc villageois" loan group was inaugurated on May 9, 2001. The group consists of eight members who are all small retail merchants. They are committed women who repay their loans without difficulties.

Mrs. Mariama, who is on the right of the photo raising her hand is the group's representative. She is a 34-year-old married mother of three children, including two girls. 

She has been successfully selling juice for the past several years. She will use the requested loan to buy bags of monkey bread (fruit of the baobab), bags of bissap (hibiscus) and bags of sugar. The profits will serve in helping her husband support the family.

loans.use: buy monkey bread (fruit of the baobab), bissap (hibiscus) and sugar

loans.name: Flor

texts.en:
Flor is 53 years old, married and had two children. His wife works overseas. He is managing a rice farming business for income. 

He wanted to improve his crop production; that is why he is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming. This will help nourish his crop so it will bear a fruitful harvest someday. He hopes to achieve economic stability so that someday his wife will not work overseas anymore.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides to use in farming

loans.name: Villa 23 Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Villa 23” está en su 1º ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 2  de las 17  señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir en una pobreza extrema.
Una persona que se destaca por ser una mujer muy trabajadora es la Sra. Sabina, quien se dedica a la venta de comidas, que ella misma hace y luego sale a vender de manera ambulante. Ella es una persona muy Buena en lo que hace, es por ello que pone todo de si para poder crecer y mejorar. 
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus comidas, como ser: verduras, carnes, condimentos, y otros productos, y así seguir deleitando a sus clientes con las delicias que hace.
texts.en:
The group named “Villa 23” is in its first loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. All of the members have taken the poverty elimination survey and the results indicated that two of the 17 women are below the poverty line. This means that they are in extreme poverty.

One person who stands out as a hardworking woman is Sra. Sabina, who sells food that she prepares herself. She conducts her sales as a street vendor. Sabina is very good at what she does, so she does everything that she can to grow and improve.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies so that can continue preparing food. These items include vegetables, meats, condiments, and other products. Sabina will be able to continue delighting her customers with the delicious food that she prepares.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meats, condiments, and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy biscuits, candies, chips, chocolate drink, coffee, powdered milk, canned goods, sugar, and laundry soap

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: Maria de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hija, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, sandalias y también vende cócteles, se dedica a la actividad de las ventas desde hace mas de 4 años, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado municipal en una zona muy transitada por esa razón posee muchos clientes, Maria esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa y sandalias por mayor y así poder obtener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Maria is 34 years old and lives in her own home along with her life companion and her daughter. She sells clothing and sandals, but she also sells seafood cocktails. Maria has been in the retail trade for more than four years. Her business is located at the municipal market in a very busy area, which explains why she has many customers.

Maria is requesting a loan in order to buy clothes and sandals in bulk. This will allow her to generate a better income.

loans.use: to buy clothes and sandals in bulk.

loans.name: Ngien

texts.en:
Ngien is 57 years old and married with an only grownup child in her care. She lives in Takeo province in Cambodia. Both Ngien and her husband have cultivated rice since 1984, and her only child works in a bakery shop. Together, the family makes USD $13 a day. 

Ngien is now applying for a Kiva loan through Kredit MFI because she needs funds to buy construction materials to build a bathroom and buy some planks to renovate her house. With this loan, she and her family will live in hygienic conditions and have a nicer house to live in. In the future, she wants to run a small grocery store at home and build a ground-floor room.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a bathroom and buy some planks to renovate her house

loans.name: Lyndiane 2Nd Pont Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois a été inauguré le 09 Mai 2001. Ce groupe est constitué de sept membres. Elles sont des femmes qui s'exercent dans le commerce et remboursent leurs prêts toujours avec succès. Madame Hermine qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentant du groupe. Elle est célibataire sans enfant et âgée de 42 ans. Elle s'active dans la vente de balais, de l'huile de palme, de citron et des légumes depuis plusieurs années. Avec le prêt sollicité elle compte acheter du citron, de l'huile de palme et des légume en quantité et en qualité. Les bénéfices vont servir à épargner et à aider ses parents à la prise en charge de la scolarité de ses frères et sœurs.
texts.en:
This "banc villageois" loan group was inaugurated on May 9, 2001. The group consists of seven women members. They are all retail merchants and always repay their loans successfully.

Mrs. Hermine who is on the right of the photo raising her hand is the group's representative. She is 42, and single without children. She has been active at selling brooms, palm oil, lemon and vegetables for several years.

With the requested loan she intends to buy lemons, palm oil and vegetables in quantity and quality. The profits will be put into savings and used to help her parents support  her brothers' and sisters' education.

loans.use: buy brooms, lemons, palm oil and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish and pay for school fees

loans.name: Hat's Group

texts.en:
Hat’s group lives in a rural village in Kampong Thom province in Cambodia. Hat makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a farmer to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Josué B Group

texts.fr: Kahongya est commerçante, membre du groupe de crédits «Josué B», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 40 ans, mariée, mère de 6 enfants dont 3 scolarisés et 3 n’étudient pas. Elle est vendeuse divers habillements dans le centre commercial depuis 10 ans. Elle commença son business avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Elle va acheter  des chemises, boubous, pantalons, robes, souliers, singlets, ect. Elle  souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Kahongya is a trader and member of the loan group 'Josué B' which works with the field partner, Hekima.  She is forty years old, married and mother to six children.  Three of her children currently attend school.

Kahongya has been selling various clothing in a commercial centre for ten years.  She began her business with funds provided by her husband.  Her loan will buy shirts, trousers, dresses, shoes and boubous (traditional clothing).  Kahongya wants to increase her working capital and educate and feed her children.

Kahongya is very grateful to Hekima for the support they offer to non-bankable entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy shirts, trousers, dresses, shoes and boubous (traditional clothing) for resale.

loans.name: Tito

texts.es:
Tito es un hombre de 55 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y se dedica a la cría de patos.
Él es independiente, emprendedor, constante, activo, responsable y muy trabajador. Su trabajo lo realiza en la localidad de ‘Sacaba’  área beneficiada por la naturaleza del valle, posee características que cautivan por su clima y atractivos turísticos. Situada a 13 kilómetros de la ciudad, a una altura que varía entre los 2600 y 4500 metros sobre el nivel del mar.
Tito es de tez trigueña, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Quechua que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el trabajo que realiza. Su vida la realiza solo, vive en una casa propia construida de ladrillo sin cemento con techo de calamina y piso de tierra que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba, no cuenta con alcantarillado. Él se dedica a la cría de patos domésticos, estos producen huevos de buen tamaño y sabor,  y limpian constantemente el área de babosas y caracoles, son relativamente fáciles de cuidar. La zona dónde vive nunca contó con agua potable por ser un área alejada y rural, hace un tiempo atrás el gobierno nacional decidió llevar agua potable hasta el lugar, “es un sueño hecho realidad, sufrimos durante toda nuestras vidas de esta carencia y utilizamos agua proveniente de todo lugar…” comenta. La ventaja de su zona es que ya cuenta con agua potable, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la instalación de agua potable en su cocina baño y lavandería. Su sueño es cocinar, comer, beber con agua potable, el desea realizar la instalación de agua potable en su cocina, baño y lavandería para cumplir su sueño de usar agua potable. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que construye su casa.
Es por esos motivos que Tito solicita un préstamo para la instalación de agua potable en su cocina, baño y lavandería para cumplir su sueño de usar agua potable.
texts.en:
Tito is a 55 year old, childless, single man and he works raising ducks.

He is independent, enterprising, tenacious, active, responsible and very hard working. He works in the town of 'Sacaba' in an area which enjoys the benefits of the nature of the valley. It has captivating characteristics such as weather and tourist attractions. It is located 13 kilometers from the city at an elevation which varies from 2600 to 4500 meters above sea level.

Tito is olive skinned with brown eyes and short black hair. He is short and thin. His mother tongue is Quechua which is spoken locally and he speaks Spanish because of the general culture and due to his work. He lives alone in his own house made of uncemented bricks with a corrugated metal roof and earthen floor. The house has electricity and well water drawn by a pump. It has no sewage drain.

He raises domesticated ducks which produce eggs of a good size and flavor, and they constantly clean the area of slugs and snails and are relatively easy to care for. The area where he lives never had potable water because of being remote and rural. Some time back the national government decided to bring potable water to the area. "It's a dream come true, we suffered all our lives from this lack and we used water from just anywhere," he comments.

The advantage of his area is that it already has potable water; the disadvantage is the lack of capital for the installation of potable water in his kitchen, bathroom and laundry. His dream is to eat, drink, and cook with potable water. He wants to install potable water in his kitchen, bath and laundry to fulfill his dream. Those are the reasons that Tito is requesting a loan to install potable water in his kitchen, bath and laundry to realize his dream of using potable water.

loans.use: to install potable water in his kitchen, bathroom and laundry in order to fulfill his dream of using potable water.

loans.name: Twizerimana Group

texts.fr:
Twizerimane est un groupe composé de femmes. Sur la photo, Suavis a été représentée par son mari Parfait. La représentante du groupe s’appelle Eliane.  Elle  habite à Gitega. Elle  a 40 ans et est mariée à Rodrigue, un enseignant. Ensemble ils ont 6 enfants âgés de 3  à 20 ans tous  étudient.

Elle fait le commerce du  riz, du savon, de l’huile de palme,... dans sa boutique depuis  5 ans. 

Elle est à son troisième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de  savons, de kilos de riz, et de litres d’huile de palme   à revendre dans sa boutique, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les années prochaines, elle voudrait  voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Twizerimane is a group made up of women.  In the photo, Suavis is represented by her husband, Parfait.  

The group representative is Eliane, she lives in Gitega.  She is forty years old and married to Rodrigue, a teacher.  Together they have six children, aged between three and twenty years old.  All her children attend school.  Eliane has been selling rice, soap, palm oil, etc in her shop for five years.  This will be her third loan with the field partner, Turame.  It will increase her working capital and buy soap, several kilos of rice and several litres of palm oil to sell in her shop and increase her earnings.

In the coming years, Eliane would like to see her children continue to study.

loans.use: to increase her working capital and buy soap, rice and palm oil for sale in her shop.

loans.name: Aida's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 18 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été crée le 24 octobre 2007. Il regroupe des femmes du même quartier qui ont de bonnes relations qui s'activent dans le commerce.
MAME  debout à droite de la photo et levant la main gauche est âgée de 31 ans. Elle est mariée et mère 5 enfants dont 2 garçons et 3 filles.
Avec le prêt reçu, elle va acheter des bols, des bassines et des tasses. Elle achète les 4 bols en gros à 25 000 FCFA et les revend en détail à 11 000 FCFA l’un. Elle achète la bassine à 1300 FCFA et la cède à 1500 FCFA. Elle achète enfin les tasses en gros à 200 FCFA et les revend en détail l’une à 250 FCFA
Les bénéfices  serviront à s’occuper de sa famille, en achetant de la nourriture, s’occuper de la santé de ses enfants et d’elle-même.
texts.en:
This group is made up of eighteen women and is part of the 'Banc Villageois' created on 24 October 2007.  The women all live in the same neighbourhood and are all small retailers.

Mame (standing on the right in the photo with her left hand raised) is thirty-one years old, married and mother to five children (two boys and three girls).  She plans to use her loan to buy bowls, basins and cups.  She will buy four bowls for 25,000 francs CFA and sell them for 11,000 francs CFA each.  She will buy basins for 1,300 francs CFA each and sell them for 1,500 francs CFA.  Finally, she will buy cups for 200 francs CFA each and sell them for 250 francs CFA.  

Mame's profits will allow her to take care of her family by paying for food and healthcare for herself and her children.

loans.use: to buy bowls, basins and cups for resale.

loans.name: Khey's Group

In her village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.name: Gamou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 24 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été crée le 22 décembre 2009. Il regroupe des femmes du même quartier qui ont de bonnes relations qui s'activent dans le commerce, l'embouche, et la transformation.
NDEYE  debout à droite de la photo et levant la main gauche est âgée de 27 ans. Elle est mariée et mère 5 enfants dont 1 garçon et 4 filles.
Avec le prêt reçu, elle va acheter des produits maraichers, choux, tomate, et du tamarin. Elle mène aussi parallèlement une activité d'embouche. Pour les produits maraichers, elle achète 5 sacs de choux le sac à 10 000 FCFA et le cède à 15 000 FCFA. Elle achète également 1 pot de tomate à 2500 FCFA et le cède à 3000 FCFA. Elle achète enfin 2 kilos de tamarin à 600 FCFA le kilo et le cède à 850 FCFA. Pour l'embouche elle va acheter 3 moutons l'unité à 30 000 FCFA et le revend après élevage à 50 000 FCFA. Elle achète de l'aliment de bétail pour un montant de 30 000 FCFA.
Les bénéfices   vont servir d'une part à satisfaire les besoins quotidiens de la famille,d'autre part à épargner et rembourser son prêt.
texts.en:
This group is made up of twenty-four women and is part of the 'Banc Villageois' created on 22 December 2009.  The women all live in the same neighbourhood and work in small retailing, animal rearing and food preparation.

Ndeye (standing on the right in the photo with her left hand raised) is twenty-seven years old, married and mother to five children (one boy and four girls).  Her loan will be used to buy vegetables - cabbages, tomatoes and tamarind.  Parallel to this activity, Ndeye also raises livestock.  She plans to buy five sacks of cabbages (at 10,000 francs CFA a sack, and sell them for 15,000 francs CFA), one pot of tomatoes (for 2,500 francs CFA, and sell it for 3,000 francs CFA) and two kilos of tamarind (for 600 francs CFA a kilo, and sell them for 850 francs CFA).  She plans also to buy three sheep for 30,000 francs CFA each and sell them later for 50,000 francs CFA.  30,000 francs CFA will be spent on animal feed.

Ndeye will use her profits to repay her loan, provide for the day-to-day needs of her family and increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy products for growing vegetables and buy sheep.

loans.name: Johnna

texts.en:
Johnna is 32 years old, married and has three children to provide for. She is engaged in a sari sari store business to earn an income. She needs to boost her stock in her store so that she can increase her income. So she decided to buy more good items to sell so that she can increase her store inventory and sell more goods that will generate more income.

Johnna plans for the future to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more good items to sell.

loans.name: Lin's Group

texts.en: Lin’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Lin makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a farmer to support her family. In her village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.	.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.ru: Элиза, 33 года, замужем, мать 4 детей. У нее - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Элиза занимается животноводством, стартовав 13 лет назад, с покупки скота на 18,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Элизы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 40 овец, 2 лошади и 2 коровы. Продает экологически чистое молоко. Ежемесячный доход составляет в среднем 8,900 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Элиза обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на покупку корма для скота. Доходы от кредита Элиза планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и сделать дома ремонт.
texts.en:
Eliza is 33 years old, married, and the mother of 4 children. Eliza has a secondary school education, and she raises livestock as the primary source of income for her family. She began raising livestock 13 years ago, with the purchase of livestock for 18,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Eliza's very hard work, her farm now has 40 sheep, 2 horses, and 2 cows. She sells organic milk. Her monthly profit averages 8,900 som (KGS).

In order to further develop her farm, Eliza has approached Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 20,000 som (KGS) to buy feed for her livestock. Eliza plans to invest the proceeds from her loan in further increasing her quantity of livestock, and in repairing her house.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her livestock.

loans.name: Tujiendeleze Group

texts.fr: Ancien vendeur d'articles d'habillement et divers, l'activité de Bukeni est tombé en faillite lors de la crise économique qui a secoué le pays vers les années 90 suite à la démonétisation. Après 3 ans de réflexion, il se décida de pratiquer la riziculture avec le petit moyen de bord. 22 ans d'expérience maintenant, sa famille vit de cette activité; il a pu en acquérir une parcelle. Bukeni a besoin de beaucoup de fonds pour soutenir son activité; dans le souci de maximiser ses revenus, il projette dans l'avenir de cultiver 3 hectares. Il préside le groupe TUJIENDELEZE; sur photo, il tient un carnet rose.
texts.en:
Bukeni used to sell clothing and various other items until the demonetization economic crisis in the country caused the failure of his business in the 1990's.  After three years consideration, he decided to use his funds to start growing rice.  He now has twenty-two years' experience in this business, has bought a plot of land and provides for his family thanks to it.

Bukeni needs a lot of funds to support his business and maximise his earnings.  In the future, he would like to cultivate three hectares of land.

Bukeni is the leader of the 'Tujiendeleze' Group and is seen in the photo holding a pink booklet.

loans.use: to pay for harrowing, weeding, tending and harvesting, and to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Flor De Isla Umbu Group

texts.es:
El grupo Flor de Isla Umbu integrado  por  17 mujeres, quienes están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, ellas se pusieron como meta ayudarse las unas a las otras para poder dar a sus seres queridos todo.
Una de las integrantes es la Señora Vilma quien tiene una despensa que monto con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo, y es por medio de su negocio que trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano, y tiene los medios necesarios para poder ayudar a su familia. Vilma es muy sacrificada, y siempre demostró su entusiasmo y ganas de poder salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder surtir su negocio con una buena variedad de productos para su despensa, como ser: bebidas, carnes, panificados, verduras, frutas y otros.  Todas están contentas por la oportunidad que reciben de progresar.
texts.en:
The group named “Flor de Isla Umbu” consists of 17 women who are participating in the poverty elimination program. They have established a goal of helping one another so that they can provide for all of their loved ones.

One of the members is Sra. Vilma, who has a store that she opened after great sacrifice and effort. Her business allows her to work every day, starting in the early morning hours. It has given her the means to help her family. Vilma is extremely self-sacrificing, yet she always demonstrates her enthusiasm and her ability to move forward.

She is requesting a loan in order to restock her business with a wide variety of products for her store, such as beverages, meats, baked goods, vegetables, fruits, and other items. All of the members are pleased with the opportunity they have received so that they can make progress.

loans.use: to buy beverages, meats, baked goods, vegetables, fruits, and other items.

loans.name: Houy's Group

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.name: Chateau D Eau Bignona 2 Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois a été inauguré le 04 Décembre 2009. Ce groupe est composé de dix huit femmes qui exercent le commerce, se soutiennent solidairement et prennent des prêts qu'elles remboursent à temps. Madame Mame Diarra qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est divorcée, âgée de 29 ans et mère de trois enfants dont deux garçons. Elle s'active dans la vente de chaussures, habits et sacs depuis plus de plusieurs années. Elle compte renforcer son capital avec le prêt sollicité. Les bénéfices vont servir à assurer la prise en charge de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This "banc villageois" loan group was inaugurated on December 4, 2009. The group consists of eighteen women who are active in commerce, support each other and take on loans they repay on time.

Ms. Mame Diarra (on the right of the photo raising her hand) is the group's representative. She is a 29-year-old divorcee, and the mother of three children, including two boys. 

She has been active at selling shoes, clothes and bags for several years. She intends to bolster her working capital with the requested loan. The profits will be used to ensure the care of her children.

loans.use: buy shoes, clothing and bags

loans.name: Sokei's Group

texts.en: Sokei’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Sokei makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In her village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Chateau D'eau Bignona 2 Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois a été inauguré le 04 Décembre 2009. Ce groupe est composé de dix huit femmes qui exercent le commerce, se soutiennent solidairement et prennent des prêts qu'elles remboursent à temps. Madame Assietou qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est marée, âgée de 36 ans et mère se quatre enfants dont trois garçons. Elle s'active dans la vente de légumes depuis plus de cinq années. Elle compte acheter avec le montant sollicité 04 sacs de 48 kg de choux, 04 sacs de 100 kg de carotte et 100 kg de poivrons. Elle a une clientèle potentielle pour l'écoulement de sa marchandise. Les bénéfices vont servir à participer à la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
This "banc villageois" loan group was inaugurated on December 4, 2009. The group consists of eighteen women who are active in commerce, support each other and take on loans they repay on time.

Mrs. Assietou (on the right of the photo raising her hand) is the group's representative. She is 36 years old, and the married mother of four children, including three boys.

She has been active at selling vegetables for more than five years. She intends to use the requested amount to buy four 48-kilo bags of cabbages, four 100-kilo bags of carrots, and 100 kilos of bell peppers.

She has a potential customer base in marketing her merchandise. The profits will be used to participate in caring for the family.

loans.use: buy vegetables

loans.name: Chateau D Eau Bignona 2 Group

texts.fr: Le banc villageois a été inauguré le 04 Décembre 2009. Ce groupe est composé de deux femmes qui exercent le commerce, se soutiennent solidairement et prennent des prêts qu'elles remboursent à temps. Madame Aminata qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 51 ans et mère de quatre enfants dont trois garçons. Elle s'active dans la vente de poissons frais depuis plus de huit ans. Elle va acheter avec le montant sollicité cinq casiers de 30 à 60 kg de poissons. Elle n'est pas la seule qui mène cette activité dans sa localité mais elle a une clientèle fidèle. Les bénéfices vont servir à aider son mari à assurer la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
This "banc villageois" loan group was inaugurated on December 4, 2009. The group consists of two women who are active in commerce, support each other and take on loans they repay on time.

Aminata (on the right of the photo raising her hand) is the group's representative. She is 51 years old, and is the married mother of four children, including three boys.

She has been active at selling fresh fish for over eight years. She'll use the requested amount to buy five crates containing 30 to 60 kilos of fish.

She is not the only one leading this activity in her area but she has a loyal customer base. The profits will be used to help her husband provide support to the family.

loans.use: buy fish

loans.name: Tha's Group

texts.en: Tha’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Tha makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a farmer to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Yorn's Group

texts.en: Yorn’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Yorn makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a farmer to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.es:
El Sr. Gabriel es una persona muy sacrificada, a  la vez que estudia también está trabajando para poder cumplir sus metas de ser un profesional exitoso.
Gabriel está estudiando la carrera de ingeniería civil, en el tercer año, por medio de su carrera quiere abrirse camino y ser alguien en la vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y así seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Sr. Gabriel is a very self-sacrificing person; while he is studying he is also working in order to be able to fulfil his goal of becoming a successful professional.

Gabriel is studying a degree in civil engineering and is in his third year. By doing this degree he hopes to open doors and become someone in life.

He is applying for this loan in order to be able to pay his tuition fees so he can continue with his studies.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Ayuba

texts.en:
Ayuba is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Tawakiri Village. Ayuba joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children.  In the past, Ayuba suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay his children's school fees. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Ayuba has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. With ambitious goals of harvesting 40 bags of maize this year, Ayuba can now ensure that his children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Savern's Group

texts.en:
Savern’s group live in a rural village in Prey Veng province in Cambodia. Savern makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family.

 In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Shadrack

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Meet Shadrack. He is 39 years old. He comes from Kitale, which is a town in the Rift valley region of Kenya. Shadrack is a smallholder farmer who keeps dairy cattle and poultry. He is also an entrepreneur engaged in other small personal businesses(motorcycle business). For the past ten years that Shadrack has been doing farming, he finds milking to be the most enjoyable activity. However, he doesn't enjoy cleaning the dairy unit as much. There is no doubting his deep connection to farm animals, as he names and occasionally talks to his animals. 

Shadrack is seeking a loan to purchase farm implements. Farming tools are very crucial to all farmers regardless of the nature of the agribusiness they are involved in. With your loan, Shadrack will acquire farm implements that will make him work in the field much easier and efficient. These benefits will translate to efficiency, improved quality and profits. Additional income as a result will help Shadrack to foot the high farming costs that keep rising by the day. 

When asked, "How will this loan benefit your family?", Shadrack replied "More income will help me buy more assets and be able to pay school fees for my school going children.”

loans.use: To buy new and up to date farm implements

loans.name: Phy's Group

texts.en:
Phy’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Phy makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farmer to support her family.

 In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Karem

texts.en:
Karem is a seamstress and she is the mother of one kid.  She needs a loan to buy a sewing machine.   Karem is living with her parents, but they can give her only a place to live and she is the responsible for her food and the care of her child.

 Karem parents are retired so she is the one who brings money to the house.  She hopes you can help her - she is healthy and she works hard

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, to help support herself and her parents

loans.name: Jose Concepcion

texts.en:
Jose is in the public transportation business, dirves a van and owns 2 (he drives one of those). He is 37 years old, he is single and lives with his mother on a house of his own. He works 6 days per week and dedicates the resting day to fixing and clean his vans.

He is asking for $20,000.00 (twenty thousand pesos) to fix one of his vans and try to buy a new van as soon as possible.

loans.use: to fix some of his vans

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is an artisan from Ghana who specializes in hand-carved masks and drums. He would like to invest in a purchase of raw materials, including leather, wood, beads, and wood stain. Daniel has been selling through NOVICA since 2007. This is his story: "I'm married and I have four children, but I also look after five other children. I had already worked in carpentry when my brother-in-law Samuel, taught me the art of carving. I specialize in traditional masks and African drums, and I usually get a good response from people. However, due to financial constraints I'm not able to produce more work to meet the demand. I love to create new designs, so I constantly work to diversify my collection. I have taught more than ten people how to carve and they are also well-established in this trade." "Those of you who help to fund my loan should receive God's blessings. Your assistance has helped me grow my business and thereby cover my children's school fees, and I am very grateful." Use the link below to view Daniel's hand-carved masks and drums on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/6552

loans.use: to invest in a purchase of raw materials, including leather, wood, beads, and wood stain

loans.name: Lizza

texts.es:
Lizza continua con sus estudios en la carrera de administración agropecuaria, por medio de sus conocimientos quiere abrirse camino y ayudar a sus seres queridos. Comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma cubrir ese gasto que tiene.
Ella pide nuevamente este préstamo para poder volver a pagar sus cuotas, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la nueva oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar.
texts.en:
Lizza continues to study Agricultural Management. Through her knowledge she wants to build a career and help her loved ones. 

She says, she used her previous loan to pay for her education fees, and this way she has been able to cover the costs.

She is requesting for a new loan to be able to pay her fees and thus to continue her studies.

She is very thankful for the new opportunity she gets to grow further.

loans.use: to pay for university fees.

loans.name: Lizzie

texts.es:
Lizzie es de la ciudad de Ybycuí, ella comenta que proviene de una familia humilde y luchadora, que con esfuerzo y capacitación logro terminar la carrera de ciencias de la educación.
Hoy está estudiando una nueva carrera que es la de contabilidad, ya que quiere seguir creciendo en conocimiento para poder tener una mejor vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y poder estudiar con ello para seguir luchando por sus metas.
texts.en:
Lizzie comes from the city of Ybycuí. She says is from a humble and hard-working family. With great effort and capability, she successfully finished her studies of Educational Sciences.

Now she is studying a new course, Accounting, because she wants to continue to grow her knowledge to have a better life.

She is requesting this loan to be able to pay her tuition fees and study to continue to fight for her goals.

loans.use: to pay for university fees.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis esta estudiando arduamente para poder convertirse en una persona profesional que pueda ayudar a las demás personas por medio de sus estudios, el quiere crecer y abrirse camino en el mundo profesional. El Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y continuar con sus estudios.
Luis se define como una persona luchadora y emprendedora.
texts.en:
Luis is studying hard to be able to become a professional person who can help other people through his education. He wants to grow and build a career in the professional world. 

He is requesting this loan to be able to pay for his course fees and continue studying.

Luis defines himself as a hard-working and enterprising person.

loans.use: to pay for university fees.

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es:
Mariela está estudiando para ser contadora, comenta que pone todo su esfuerzo para ser una persona profesional que pueda ayudarse, no solo a sí misma, sino también a los demás.
Mariela quiere ser contadora, es por ello que está estudiando mucho para poder cumplir con sus metas.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus gastos de titulación, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe.
texts.en:
Mariela is studying to be an accountant. She is putting all of her effort into being a professional. This will not only benefit her, but other people too.  

Mariela wants to be an accountant, which is why she is studying so hard to accomplish her goals. 

She is asking for this loan so that she can pay her degree costs and be able to continue with her studies as she has been doing. She is grateful for this opportunity that she has been given.

loans.use: to cover her degree costs

loans.name: Judith

texts.es:
Judith esta esforzándose para poder ser una profesional universitaria, útil a las demás personas, no solo a si misma, sino también a su familia.
Ella está estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas, y por medio de sus conocimientos quiere crecer y salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y continuar con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Judith is making an effort to become a professional academic, to be useful to other people, not only herself, but also her family.

She is studying Business Administration, and by means of her knowledge intends to grow and improve her financial situation.

She is requesting this loan to be able to pay for her course fees and continue to study the way she does.

loans.use: to pay for university fees.

loans.name: Sunilda

texts.es:
sunilda esta luchando para poder ser una buena abogada, y por medio de su carrera poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos, pone todo de si y esta luchando para poder alcanzar sus metas, comenta que uso su préstamo anterior lo uso para poder pagar sus cuotas, y seguir con sus estudios.
Hoy pide nuevamente este préstamo para poder cubrir de vuelta sus cuotas, lo cual le será de ayuda para continuar con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Sunilda is fighting to be a good lawyer, and through her career to be able to help her family and her loved ones. She gives her all and is fighting to achieve her goals.

She says that she is using her previous loan to pay her fees, and to continue with her studies.

Today she again requests a loan in order to be able to cover her fees, which will be of help in continuing with her studies.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
Liz  proviene de una familia muy sacrificada, se desempeña como auxiliar en un estudio contable. Su meta es ser una profesional exitosa, abrir su propia oficina y brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia a través de su futura profesión que es la de contadora.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Liz comes from a sacrificing family. She is taking a correspondence course in Accounting.

Her goal is to be a successful professional, open her own office, and offer her family a better quality of life through her profession as Accountant.

She is requesting this loan to be able to pay her university fees and thus be able to keep studying the way she does.

loans.use: to pay for university fees.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana está trabajando y esforzándose para poder ser una profesional exitosa y ayudar a las demás personas.
Está estudiando para ser una buena diseñadora, y aplicar ello a sus propios negocios.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir el gasto de sus cuotas, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Susana is working and striving to be able to be a successful professional and help others. 
She is studying to be a good designer and apply her studies to her own businesses. 
She is requesting this loan to cover the expense of her fees, so she can continue her studies as she's been doing up until now.

loans.use: To pay fees for college

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria esta esforzándose y luchando por poder ser una buena profesional, y con sus esfuerzos también poder ayudar a su hijo, ya que ella es mama soltera y depende de ella. Es una mujer muy sacrificada y luchadora, y comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso para poder cubrir parte de sus gastos de titulacion.
Hoy pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y continuar con sus estudios de esa forma.
texts.en:
Maria is making an effort and works hard to become a great professional and also to support her son with her work because she is a single mother and he depends on her.

She is a self-sacrificing and hard-working woman and says she used her previous loan to be able to cover part of her degree's costs.

Now she is requesting this loan to be able to pay her course fees and thus keep on studying the way she does.

loans.use: to pay for university fees.

loans.name: Erdenetsogt

texts.en:
Mr. Erdenetsogt, 54 years old, lives with his wife, daughter, son and granddaughter in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He has been transporting goods between districts since 2005. His wife teaches elementary class at school. Their daughter is physical education teacher at high school. 

The borrower's 77 years old father has severe illness and needs urgent surgery. So he is requesting a loan of 2500000 MNT to pay for medical expenses. He truly wishes his father to be healthy and strong.

loans.use: to pay for his father's surgery

loans.name: Syinat

texts.ru: Сыйнат, 54 года, замужем, образование- высшее, воспитывает 5 детей. Сыйнат работает учителем младших классов, также с 2002 года занимается сельским хозяйством. На участке мерою 2,59  Га она выращивает фасоль. Ежемесячная прибыль Сыйнат составляет около 26,900 сом (KGS), с учетом заработной платы в размере 20,000 сом (KGS). Накопленные средства она старается вкладывать в развитие бизнеса и улучшение жилищных условий семьи. Сыйнат обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку строительных материалов для проведения ремонта в доме. Свои доходы Сыйнат планирует и дальше вкладывать в улучшение благосостояния семьи.
texts.en:
Syinat is 54 and married with a higher education and five children. She works as a schoolteacher for younger classes, and in addition has been working in farming since 2002. She grows beans on 2.59 hectares of land with a monthly income of about 26,900 KGS, including her salary of 20,000 KGS. She tries to put money into developing her business and improving her family's living conditions.

Syinat has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 30,000 KGS to purchase building materials to do home renovations. She plans to put her income into further improving her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to make some improvements to her house

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda es una persona que lucha por poder crecer y salir adelante, sigue con el estudio de su carrera de ciencias contables, y comenta que con su préstamo anterior ha podido cubrir parte de los gastos de su titulacion.
Hoy yolanda pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas y derechos de examen, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a person who works hard to be able to grow and get ahead. 

She continues to study Accounting Sciences. She says with her previous loan she has been able to cover part of her tuition fees.

Now, Yolanda is requesting this loan to be able to pay her tuition and examination fees, and thus keep on studying the way she does.

loans.use: to pay for university fees and examination fees.

loans.name: Artimiza

texts.pt:
A  senhora Artimiza de 28 anos de idade, é casada, mãe de  03 filhos  destes  1 frequenta o ensino primário 2 ainda menores vive na casa própria.
Diz  que com o valor pretende comprar  arroz, óleo, cerveja, açúcar, feijão, amendoim, atum para reforçar o seu negocio .
O seu maior sonho é terminar a sua casa em construção, crescer no negocio e fazer um salão de cabelereiro na sua casa como forma de reforçar a renda familiar.
Diz que tem como desafios insuficiência de fundos  para supera-los conta com o apoio de seu esposo que e motorista e que irá solicitar mais créditos para concretizar o seu plano.
texts.en:
Ms Artimiza is 28 years old, married and the mother of 03 children, 1 of whom goes to primary school and 2 others who are still too young to go to school. She lives in a house she owns.

She says that with this loan she plans to buy rice, oil, beer, sugar, beans, peanuts and tuna to reinforce her business.

Her biggest dream is to finish building her house which is under construction, grow her business and build a hair salon at her home so as to reinforce her family's income.

She says that her challenge is a lack of funds and to overcome this she counts on her husband's support (he is a driver) and will solicit further loans in order to carry out her plans.

loans.use: buy rice, oil, beer, sugar, beans, peanuts and tuna to reinforce her business.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina wishes that her variety store will progress someday, and thus she exerts her best effort to make it stable. She adds fruits and vegetables in her inventory and cooks pork barbeque occasionally.

She lives in Butuan City, Agusan Del Norte together with her husband Remegio, a driver, and their children.

They are living in a community where people are quite familiar with each other. Therefore, Gina finds it difficult to refuse her neighbors who pay late for the goods they get from her store. This practice shakes the stability of her business.

To continue with her business, she requests additional capital of PHP 8,000 to buy more items for her inventory. It will improve her profit and will help sustain their everyday needs. It will also contribute some steps towards her dream of finishing her children’s studies and building a house on her amortized lot.

She’s also planning to invest in hog raising and continue nurturing their farm.

Gina is committed to CCT Credit Cooperative’s vision to alleviate poverty and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and her religion. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study religion, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more items for her inventory

loans.name: Matias

texts.es:
Matias trabaja y estudia al mismo tiempo, es una persona que está poniendo todo de sí para poder mejorar su vida.
Él está estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas, y por medio de sus estudios quiere abrirse camino.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Matias works and studies at the same time. He is someone who does everything he can to be able to improve his life.

He is studying Business Administration and by means of his education wants to build a career.

He is requesting this loan to be able to pay his course fees and thus be able to keep on studying.

loans.use: to pay for university fees.

loans.name: Gulsunay

texts.ru: Гулсунай успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. Она по-прежнему занимается торговлей одеждой. В обороте есть товар на сумму 200,000 сом (KGS). Ее ежемесячная прибыль - 19,000 сомов (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулсунай обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку одежды для увеличения товара в обороте. Доходы от кредита Гулсунай планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Gulnusay successfully paid off her previous loan, which she used as intended. She is thankful to Kiva and to everyone who gave her financial support. As before, she is working in retail selling clothing. She has 200,000 KGS in inventory and a monthly income of 19,000 KGS. 

With the goal of further developing her business, Gulnusay has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 KGS to purchase clothing to increase her inventory of product. She plans to put profits from the loan into further developing her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for sale in her shop

loans.name: Anar

texts.ru: Анар успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто откликнулся и помог ей в финансировании.  В хозяйстве Анар  на сегодняшний день есть 2 коровы и 10 овец. На 1,60 Га земли выращивает картофель, зерновые культуры и эспарцет для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Анар вновь обратилась в Банк «Бай - Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы для увеличения удоя экологически чистого молока. Доходы от кредита Анар будет вкладывать в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и постройку сараев.
texts.en:
Anar successfully paid off her previous loan, which she used as intended. She is thankful to Kiva and to everyone who responded and helped her financially. She currently has two cows and 10 sheep on her farm as well as 1.6 hectares of land where she grows potatoes, grains and alfalfa for her own use and for sale. 

Anar has again approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 40,000 KGS to purchase a dairy cow to increase her sales of organic milk. She will put profits from the loan into further increasing her quantity of livestock and into building sheds.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow in order to increase her volume of organic milk sales

loans.name: Kulumbu

texts.ru: Кулумбу успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании.  В хозяйстве на сегодняшний день есть 4 коровы, 13 овец, 14 коз, 18 ягнят, лошадь. На 0,32 Га земли она выращивает картофель и кукурузу. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет 32,000 сом (KGS). Кулумбу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS). На полученные средства она приобретет телят и ягнят для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита накопит на постройку дома для ее семьи.
texts.en:
Kulumbu successfully paid off her previous loan, which she used as intended. She is thankful to Kiva and to everyone who gave her financial support. She currently has four cows, 13 sheep, 14 goats, 18 lambs and a horse on her farm as well as 0.32 hectares of land where she grows potatoes and corn. Her monthly income is 32,000 KGS.

Kulumbu has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 KGS. She plans to use the loan amount to purchase calves and lambs for fattening and resale. She will save profits from the loan toward building a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy calves and lambs for fattening and resale

loans.name: Vasilca

texts.en:
Vasilca is social worker from Parlita village in the Ungheni region of Moldova. She is a married. Her husband, Lev, periodically works in construction in Russia. The couple also have a small farm where they are raising about 150 chickens, 150 ducks and one pig. 
Vasilca wants to develop her farm and sell hen eggs and meat. She is applying for a 40,000 MDL loan through Kiva's field partner Smart Credit to build a new hen house. She wants to be able to meet her family’s needs and be self-reliant.

loans.use: to build a new hen house

loans.name: Fatima

texts.es:
Fatima esta estudiando para ser enfermera, ella es una mujer muy sacrificada, que pone todo de si para poder crecer y mejorar, como persona y como profesional. Comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma pudo cubrir ese gasto.
Pide este préstamo hoy para poder comprar los útiles que necesita para su universidad. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar.
texts.en:
Fatima studies to become a nurse. She is a very self-sacrificing woman, who does everything she can to be able to grow and to improve - personally and professionally. 

She says she used the previous loan to pay her course fees and thus was able to cover the costs.

Now, she is requesting this loan to be able to buy the materials she needs for university. She is thankful for the opportunity she's given to improve herself.

loans.use: to buy university materials.

loans.name: Jimve

texts.en:
Hollow block or concrete block is the primary building material in construction of walls of houses and buildings. The raw materials needed in making concrete blocks are cement, sand, gravel, and water. It undergoes mixing, molding, curing or hardening, then cubing.

Jimve’s residence in Butuan City, Agusan Del Norte has a wide yard that serves as manufacturing place for concrete blocks. The residents in their community are using concrete to fortify their houses in preparation for unexpected calamities. Jimve is expecting a higher demand for concrete blocks, but she has no means to increase her production due to lack of capital.

She prays for PHP 10,000 additional capital to buy more bags of cement and loads of sand and gravel. Gradually, she wants to improve her business to ensure the college education of her three children with Mario, a driver.

She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and her religion. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study religion, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more bags of cement and loads of sand and gravel for concrete block making

loans.name: Carlita

texts.en:
A “sari-sari” or variety store appeals to customers if it has wide variety of selections. This is the reason why Carlita wants to avail a PHP 8,000 loan to buy volume of supplies like grocery items and dry goods. These additional stocks will enhance the competitiveness of her store within their community in Butuan City, Agusan Del Norte.

If her sari-sari will grow into a big profitable store according to her plan, its income can really help sustain their basic needs and school expenses of her six children, who are studying in high school and elementary.

She is lovingly supported by her husband Edwin, a laborer. They both work diligently to enrich their lives and prepare for the future.

Carlita meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week. It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from her religion. * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study religion, build social capital, and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy supplies like grocery items and dry goods in volume.

loans.name: Buaisha

texts.ru: Буайша, 61 год, мать 3 детей. У нее высшее образование, более 30 лет проработала бухгалтером, сейчас на пенсии. В поиске дополнительного источника доходов для своей семьи, она 20 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря ее непосильному труду и емкой работе, Буайша достигла хороших успехов и стала получать ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве имеется 4 коровы. Буайша обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS), который она направит на покупку скота для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Буайша планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса  и свадьбу дочери.
texts.en:
Buaisha is 61 and has three children. She has a higher education and worked as an accountant for more than 30 years, but is now retired. As an additional source of income for her family, she has been working in agriculture and animal husbandry for 20 years. Thanks to her constant effort and hard work, she achieved great success and now receives a monthly income of 15,000 KGS. She currently has four cows on her farm.

Buaisha has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS, which she will use to purchase livestock for fattening and resale. She plans to put profits from the loan into further developing her business and toward her daughter's wedding.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock for fattening and resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Guljahon

texts.ru:
Гулчахон  молодая и трудолюбивая  женщина. Ей 32 года. Она замужем и имеет 4 детей. Она работает официанткой в ресторане. Её мужа зовут Зафар. Её муж работает мастером по строительству  и ремонту зданий. Он получает хорошую заработную плату. 
 Гулчахон и её муж хотят провести мероприятия по обрезанию своего сына. Но так как мероприятие требует больших расходов, у них не хватает своих денежных средств. Поэтому Гулчахон обратились в Арванд за кредитом. Она заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Guljahon is a young and hardworking woman of 32. She is married and has four children. She works as a restaurant waitress. Her husband is called Zafar and he works as a tradesman, building and renovating buildings. He receives a good salary.

Guljahon and her husband want to throw a party for their son's circumcision. But since these events are expensive, they don't have the money. Therefore Guljahon has approached Arvand for a loan. She thanks them in advance for the support.

loans.use: to have a party to celebrate her son's circumcision

loans.name: Burioy

texts.ru:
Буриой жизнерадостная и ответственная женщина. Она замужем и имеет семерых детей. Вместе со своей семьёй Буриой живёт в сельской местности. Сама Буриой работает социальным работником. А муж Буриой работает сварщиком. Они очень любят своих детей, и стараются обучать их от всего своего сердца, потому что они желают видеть образованных детей. Но зарплата, которую они получают, недостаточна для покрытия всех имеющихся нужд в семье. 
В данное время Буриой вместе со своим мужем хотят отремонтировать дом, где они живут, чтобы улучшить условия для проживания. Но собственных средств у них недостаточно. Для этого Буриой обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку строительных материалов для ремонта дома. Она надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Burioy is a cheerful and responsible woman. She is married and has seven children. She and her family live in a rural area and she works as a social worker. Her husband is a welder. They love their children very much and try to teach them with their whole hearts, as they want to have educated children. But their earnings aren't enough to cover all their family's needs.

Burioy and her husband want to renovate the house they live in so they can improve their living conditions, but they don't have enough money of their own. For this reason Burioy has approached Arvand for a loan to purchase building materials to do renovations. She hopes for a positive result and thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy building materials to do home renovations

loans.name: Zirekan

texts.ru: Зирекан, 53 года, вдова, мать 4 детей. У нее среднее образование, занимается сельским хозяйством, стартовав в 1987 году, благодаря упорному труду Зирекан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы, 25 овец. На 0,86 Га земли выращивает хлопок для реализации. Ее прибыль составляет около 13,000 сом (KGS), этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства и улучшения благосостояния, Зирекан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров и овец для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в улучшение материального благосостояния и увеличение площади земельного надела.
texts.en:
Zirekan is 53 and a widow with four children. She has a high school education and works in agriculture, a business she started in 1987. Thanks to her hard work, she currently has two cows and 25 sheep on her farm as well as 0.86 hectares of land where she grows cotton for sale. Her income is about 13,000 KGS, which isn't enough to cover her living expenses.

With the goal of further developing her farm and improving her living conditions, Zirekan has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 KGS to purchase cows and sheep for fattening and resale. She plans to put profits from the loan into further improving her living conditions and buying more farmland.

loans.use: to buy cows and sheep for fattening and resale in order to increase her income

loans.name: Pilar

texts.en:
“With the grace of God, we will be able to put up a big piggery, a profitable grocery store, and a viable water refilling station. We will finish our dream house and our children will live a better life.”

Pilar, 69, from Tigbauan, Iloilo, speaks this phrase with faith as she shares her aspirations with her co-fellowship* members at CCT. She has been a dedicated member of the organization for almost 13 years, where she continually gains inspiration from Bible reflections and sharing of life experiences.

Pilar is married to Juan, a laborer, and they have two children who are already working. The couple is now relieved of their children’s huge educational expenses. Pilar is now working towards full progress of her business. She raises hogs in their backyard, operates a variety store that offers usual commodities, and distributes mineral water in their community.

It’s her chance to save some money for her and her husband as they age. Self-employed workers like them have no pension or medical benefits when they retire; hence they just rely on their own savings or any help from their children.

As of now, she needs to buy additional piglets and feeds. That is why she is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan. She will also add supplies to her store inventory and buy more gallons of mineral water. With these, she can increase her income and boost her savings. She would really appreciate your kind support to her. She prays that more blessings would come your way.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study religion, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and feeds

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
After Typhoon Haiyan in November, 2013, variety stores located in devastated areas like Iloilo had a significant decline in profits. It is, of course, expected because almost all businesses in those areas dwindled. Entrepreneurs worked hard in the past one and one-half years to “build back better” their enterprises.

Sheila, 55, is one of those who was able to rise above the situation and regain her variety store operation. She is a widow who is very anxious to have a grandchild. Her business not only supplies her everyday needs, but it also takes away her menopausal troubles and soothes her longing for a grandchild.

As of now, she continues to develop her variety store. She plans to purchase more canned goods, grocery items, and cases of soft drinks. She implores your generous assistance to enable her to buy all these through a loan worth PHP 20,000. May you be God’s blessing to her as she aspires to improve her business.

Sheila is a devoted member of CCT Credit Cooperative and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and her religion. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study religion, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more canned goods, grocery items, and cases of soft drinks for her variety store.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
You can be an instrument to help Francisco reach his dreams!

Here is Francisco, a 61-year-old widower from Tigbauan, Iloilo. He has run a “sari-sari” (variety) store for five years now. The proliferation of these businesses makes the competition stiff; hence store owners like Francisco try many techniques to make it stable and competitive.

He combines his variety store with fruit and vegetable vending to encourage more buyers. He needs to strive harder because one of his children is still studying in college. At the same time, he wants to save for his retirement. This is the reason why he yearns to increase his income from his business.

One way to attain this is to acquire supplementary capital of PHP 8,000 that he will use to buy more fruits and vegetables and added supplies like canned goods, groceries and drinks. He knocks at your generous hearts for your kind support. You can be assured that it will go a long, long way.

Francisco gains inspiration from his co-fellowship* members who meet every week to share stories about their life and businesses and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and religion.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study religion, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables and added supplies like canned goods, groceries and drinks.

loans.name: Sainagul

texts.ru: Сайнагул, 51 год, замужем, 5 детей. У нее средне-специальное образование, она целеустремленна, трудолюбивая, знает конкретно чего хочет и добивается всего своими силами. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она на протяжении 30 лет занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Сайнагул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 лошади, 2 коровы, 23 овцы. На 4,0 Га выращивает люцерну и ячмень. Для содержания скота имеются все условия. Ежемесячный доход составляет 17,000 сомов (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Сайнагул обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 4 бычков для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Сайнагул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Sainagul is 51 and married with five children. She has a specialist high school education and is a purposeful, hardworking person who knows exactly what she wants and works toward it with all her strength. She has been working in animal husbandry and agriculture for 30 years as the primary source of income for her family. Thanks to her hard work, she currently has two horses, two cows and 23 sheep on her farm as well as 4.0 hectares of land where she grows alfalfa and barley. She also has everything necessary to care for livestock. Her monthly income is 17,000 KGS.

With the goal of further developing her farm, Sainagul has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 KGS to purchase four steers for fattening and resale. She plans to put profits from the loan into further increasing her quantity of livestock.

loans.use: to buy four steers for fattening and resale

loans.name: Mahira

texts.ru: Махира, 48 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей, но они все взрослые, самостоятельные. У нее высшее образование, работает в телеком главным бухгалтером, также уже 25 лет занимается разведением скота и полеводством, начав этот бизнес с 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря неустанному труду и выдержке Махиры, в хозяйстве у нее имеется: корова, лошадь, 10 овец. На 1,20 Га земли выращивает перец и клевер для реализации. В целях увеличения ее бизнеса Махира обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота и на обработку почвы. На доходы от кредита Махира планирует увеличить поголовье скота, а также отремонтировать дом.
texts.en:
Mahira is 48 and married with two children who are all grown up and independent. She has a higher education and works as head accountant at a TV company. She has also been working in animal husbandry and agriculture for 25 years, a business she started with 10,000 KGS. Thanks to her constant effort and endurance, she currently has one cow, one horse and 10 sheep on her farm as well as 1.2 hectares of land where she grows peppers and clover for sale.

With the goal of improving her business, Mahira has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 80,000 KGS to purchase livestock and to cultivate her land. She plans to put profits from the loan into further increasing her head count of livestock, and also wants to do home renovations.

loans.use: to purchase some livestock and to cultivate her land in order to invest in her business

loans.name: Sokhy's Group

texts.en:
Sokhy’s Group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Sokhy makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a farmer and seller to support her family. She has two sons in her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es:
Lorena es de la ciudad de Encarnación, estudia y a la vez trabaja con  su mama en una joyería que es propia de la familia.
Ella está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad para poder abrirse camino al  mundo laboral, y por medio de sus estudios poder ser una buena profesional.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de a carrera y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo. Ella agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir sus sueños y ser alguien en la vida para ayudar a sus seres queridos.
texts.en: Lorena is from the city of Encarnacion. She studies and, at the same time, works with her mother in a jewelry store that is owned by the family. She is taking an accounting course to be able to open the path to the working world and, through her studies, be able to be a good professional. She is requesting this loan to be able to pay her course fees and thus be able to continue with her education as she has been doing. She is thankful for this opportunity that she is receiving to follow her dreams and be someone in life who can help her loved ones.

loans.use: to pay for university fees.

loans.name: Leng's Group

texts.en:
Leng’s Group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Leng does work as farm laborer and construction worker to support her family. She has one son in her family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria esta trabajando para poder salir adelante y ayudar a sus seres queridos por medio de sus estudios. Está estudiando la carrera de derecho, y comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en poder pagar una parte de sus gastos de titulacion, lo cual le fue de mucha ayuda.
Pide este nuevo préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar la totalidad de sus gastos de titulacion, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Maria is working to be able to succeed and help her loved ones through her education. She is studying law and says that her previous loan was used to pay a part of her education expenses, which was a great help.

She is requesting this new loan to be able to invest it in paying her whole school expenses and thus be able to continue with her studies as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Diamante Group

texts.es:
20 son las mujeres que integran este grupo llamado Diamante, formado en la ciudad de concepción, una ciudad alejada de la capital que se dedica a actividades eminentemente rurales, todas luchan por mejorar sus vidas.
