La Sra.  Martina es una de las integrantes, ella es de una zona alejada del centro mismo de la ciudad donde sale a vender sus ropas, artículos para el hogar,  y otros, comenta que con sacrificio viene mejorando y que está orgullosa de eso.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas varias para la venta, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradecen por esta oportunidad que reciben de mejorar.
texts.en:
20 are the women who joined this group name "Diamante" (diamond), formed in the city of Concepcion, a city far from the capital that is dedicated to rural activities. All work hard to improve their lives.

Martina is one of the members. She is from an area that is a distance from the center of the city where she sells her clothing, household goods and other items. She says that, with sacrifice, she is improving and she is proud of this.

She is requesting this loan to be able to buy various clothing to sell and thus be able to continue with her sales as she has been doing. They are thankful for this opportunity that they are receiving to improve.

loans.use: to buy various clothing to sell.

loans.name: Alcides

texts.es:
El señor Alcides tiene 32 años, es comerciante y su esposa la señora Nancy de 33 años de edad se encarga del cuidado de sus dos hijos uno de 9 años y la otra de 5 años.
Alcides empezó desde muy joven a trabajar con su padre, no llego a terminar sus estudios Universitarios por lo cual tuvo que trabajar ya que formo su familia y es el sostén del mismo pero no deja de soñar con ser un gran profesional. El vende celulares, accesorios, billeteras, perfumes, relojes etc.
Pide el préstamo para compra de artículos de más demanda como cargador portátil, teléfonos celulares, memory cards y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: Alcides is 32 years old and works in commerce. His wife Nancy is 33 years old and takes care of their two children, a 9 year old boy and a 5 year old girl. Alcides started to work with his father since very young. He was not able to finish college, because he started a family and needed to work. He is his family's support, but dreams of being a great professional. He sells cell phones, accessories, wallets, perfumes, watches, etc.  He is requesting the loan to buy high demand items such as portable chargers, cell phones, memory cards, and other things. This way, he will be able to continue with his sales as he has been doing so far.

loans.use: to buy portable chargers, cell phones, memory cards, and other things.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Blanca esta estudiando la carrera de veterinaria, esta poniendo todo lo mejor de si para poder crecer y ser una buena profesional que ayude a sus seres queridos por medio de su profesión, comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso para poder comprar una computadora que le fue de mucha ayuda.
Hoy pide un nuevo préstamo para poder comprar unos libros de su universidad para poder seguir con sus estudios como lo hace.
texts.en:
Blanca is studying for a veterinary career. She is giving it her best in order to grow and to be a good professional who can help her loved ones through her career.

She says that her previous loan she used to purchase a computer that was very helpful.

Today she requests a new loan to buy books from her university in order to be able to continue with her studies as she is doing.

loans.use: to buy books from the faculty.

loans.name: San Luis Group

texts.es:
Marina es una mujer de 50 años casada, tiene un hijo de 9 años, y su negocio es el servicio de videojuegos.
Ella es buena madre, constante, amable, generosa, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad ‘El torno’ caracterizado por el acopio y comercio de productos agrícolas como, frutas, verduras, carne, etc., donde acuden los distribuidores mayoristas a comprar por camionada las frutas y verduras que después repartirán por toda la ciudad. De clima sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Marina es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo ondulado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (sentada a la izquierda, viste pantalón verde). Su vida la comparte con su esposo que atiende una tienda de barrio y con su hijo que estudia en la escuela. Viven en una casa propia construida de madera con techo de calamina y piso de cemento que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba, no cuenta con alcantarillado. Debido a la necesidad de mejorar su negocio por la exigencia de sus clientes, lidera en esta oportunidad la banca de emprendimiento, los negocios de los clientes son; venta de verduras, elaboración de queso artesanal, agricultura, venta de comida, venta de ropa de segunda mano, confección de tejidos y venta de refrescos, para solicita un crédito y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es el servicio de video juegos; en una habitación de su casa con puerta a la calle, ella instaló varias consolas de juegos de video, los clientes son jóvenes que generalmente usan el servicio por las mañanas y a media tarde, “inicié mi negocio por la ayuda de un familiar que conocía sobre los video juegos, el servicio es barato, limpio y sano, la mayoría de mis clientes son jóvenes…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son diarias, la desventaja es la falta de capital para aumentar el número de consolas que exige la demanda. Su sueño es contribuir con el bien de la sociedad ayudando a los jóvenes a buscar actividades que los alejen del alcohol y las drogas, ella desea realizar la compra de una consola de video juegos para instalarla en su negocio y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Marina solicita un préstamo para la compra de una consola de video juegos para instalarla en su negocio y ayudar a los jóvenes.
texts.en:
Marina is a 50 year old woman. She is married and has a nine year old child and her business is video games service.

She is a good mother... constant, friendly, generous, responsible and very hard working. Her business is in the area of "El Torno", known for the collection and trade of farm products like fruits, vegetables, meat, etc. where wholesale distributors come to buy fruits and vegetables by the truckload and later distribute throughout the city. It is a city with subtropical climate and temperatures that vary during the day between 21-35 degrees centigrade.

Marina has dark complexion, brown eyes, long black wavy hair, she is of small stature, robust physique, and her mother tongue is Guaraní and she speaks Spanish due to general culture and for the business she performs (seated on the left, wearing green pants). She shares her life with her husband who attends a store in the neighborhood and with her son who studies at school. They live in their own house constructed of wood with a calamine roof and cement floor that has has electricity and well water extracted through a pump. She does not have a sewer system. 

Due to the need to improve her business for her customer's requirements, at this time she is led to the bank of enterprise. The businesses of the customers are: selling vegetables, make artisanal cheese, farming, selling food, selling second-hand clothes, weaving, and selling refreshments. They are requesting a loan to improve their work.

Her business is video game service. In a room in her house that has a door to the street, she installed various video game consoles. The customers are young people who generally use the service in the mornings and afternoons. "I began my business with the help of a family member who knew about video games. The service is cheap, clean and healthy. The majority of my customers are young people, " she says. The advantage of her business is that sales are daily. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to expand the number of consoles that demand requires. Her dream is to contribute to the well being of society helping young people find activities that keep them away from alcohol and drugs. She wishes to buy a video game console to install in her business and satisfy her customers' demand. This is the second sequence of loans with the institution in three years that she has been doing this work. It is for those reasons that Marina is requesting a loan to buy a video game console to install in her business and help young people.

loans.use: to buy a video game console to install in her business and to help young people.

loans.name: Vat's Group

texts.en: Vat’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Vat works as a farmer. He also does extra work as a seller to support his family. He has one young daughter in his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and men to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Nith's Group

texts.en: Nith’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Nith makes a living cultivating rice. She also does extra work as a farmer and seller to support her family. She has two children in her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Jose Roberto

texts.es: jose de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos, el se dedica a la venta y compra de tela reclidada, se dedica a esta actividada desde hace 12 años, vende su productos a vendedrores informales y costureras, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra salir adelente, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas tela reciclada por mayor para continuar con su trabajo y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Jose is 35 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and their two children. He makes a living in the sale and purchase of recycled fabric, and he has been doing this activity for 12 years. He sells his products to informal venders and seamstresses, and what he obtains from his income allows him to succeed. He is requesting a loan for the purchase of more recycled fabric wholesale to continue with his work and so have greater income.

loans.use: to buy more recycled fabric wholesale.

loans.name: Shim's Group

texts.en: Shim’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Shim makes a living cultivating rice. She also does extra work as a farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en: Maribel, 44 years old, is married and has four children. She is able to help her husband, a driver, in providing for their children's needs. She aims for a better income so that she can give her family good lives. Maribel decided to borrow a loan to purchase fertilizer for the banana farm to produce a good quality of banana and to supply bananas for the customers. Maribel's plan for the future is to buy a new vehicle to deliver the bananas.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for the banana farm.

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.es: La señora Felicidad,  tiene 36 años de edad de estado civil casada, alcanzo a estudiar hasta la primaria en la actualidad cuenta con tres hijos dependientes de su ingreso, los cuales son hijos pequeños, vive en su propio domicilio el mismo que es condición rustica construido con material local (adobe) y revocado con barro, que esta situado en la comunidad de Cotani Bajo de la provincia de Tiraque, su actividad económica es la agrícola, en tal sentido produce los siguientes productos agrícolas como ser papa, haba en vaina verde, oca, toda la producción mencionada anteriormente es producida en un superficie  de 2.5 hectáreas los cuales cuentan con riego misma que fue cosechada por las inundaciones de la época,  es por tal motivo que la señora Felicidad necesita un préstamo para poder comprar abono orgánico (gallinaza) y semilla de papa para una producción a futuro y de esta manera se pueda mejorar sus ingresos y al mismo tiempo mejorar la vida para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Felicidad is 36 years old and is married. She completed primary school education and currently has three children, which are young, who are dependent on her income. She lives in her own home which is in rustic conditions, built with local material (adobe) and plastered with clay. It is located in the community Cotani Bajo in the Tiraque province. 

She works in agriculture, in which she produces the following agricultural products: potatoes, green beans, oca tubers. All of this is produced in 2.5 hectares of land which count on irrigation that was harvested from the flooding of the season. It is for this reason that Mrs. Felicidad needs a loan to be able to buy organic fertilizer (hen droppings) and potato seeds for future production. This way, she can increase her income and at the same time, improve the lives of herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer (hen droppings) and potato seeds for an adequate production, so that this way, she can help increase her income for herself and her family.

loans.name: Maria Norma

texts.es: La señora María tiene 20 años de edad y vive en la casa de sus padres junto a su pareja ubicada en la comunidad de Saladillo. la señora María no tiene hijos. Desde hace más de 2 años que se dedica a la producción agrícola, en especial la producción vitivinícola, teniendo media hectárea de cultivo de la misma, nos indica que quiere tener mejores ingresos económicos para salir adelante, para ello la señora Maria está requiriendo la compra de malla antigranizo para así poder con esto mejorar la calidad de su viñedo, año a año incrementara su producción y así también incrementara sus ingresos, teniendo ya la experiencia en el rubro, por eso la señora Maria necesita el préstamo. la señora desea mejorar el nivel de vida, así como el bienestar de su pareja que ya que son una pareja joven y desean salir adelante, como así también abrirse más campo en la producción agrícola.
texts.en: Ms. María is 20 years old and lives in her parents home with her husband, located in the community of Saladillo. María does not have children. For more than 2 years she has made a living in the production of agriculture, particularly the production of wine. She has a half hectare of cultivating the same, and tells us that she wants to have better economic income to get by. For María it is required to purchase anti-hail mesh to be able to improve the quality of her vineyard. Year after year she has increased her production and thus also increased her income, already having the experience in the field, and it is for this that María needs a loan. She wants to improve the standard of living, as well as the wellbeing of her husband as they are a young couple and they want to succeed, as well as open more fields for agricultural production.

loans.use: to purchase hail mesh to improve the quality of her vineyard and improve her family's quality of life.

loans.name: Jose Virgilio

texts.es: jose de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, el se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y a la agricultura desde hace 10 años, vende sus prodcutos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en el hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para mejorar el lugar donde mantiene a sus cerdos que es el que muestra en la fotografia y tambien comprar insumos agricolas y asi continuar con su trabajo para tener una mejora calidad de vida.
texts.en: 40-year-old Jose lives with his wife in their own home. He has reared pigs and worked in agriculture for 10 years. He sells his products close to where he lives and, with what he earns, he manages to cover the household costs. He is applying for a loan to improve the lighting where he keeps his pigs (shown in the photo) and to buy some agricultural supplies so he can continue working and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: have better lighting where he keeps his pigs and buy some agricultural supplies

loans.name: Euong's Group

texts.en: Euong’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province, Cambodia. Euong makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a farmer to support her family. In her village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of the members of this lending group to safeguard their families' health, to save money on medical expenses and to save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Chhit's Group

texts.en: Chhit’s group lives in a rural village in Kompong Thom province, Cambodia. Chhit makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a farmer to support her family. In her village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help both members of this lending group to safeguard their families' health, to save money on medical expenses and to save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Fermin

texts.es: Fermín tiene 43 años vive en Olanchito, Honduras  y  es un hombre muy emprendedor  que se dedica a cultivar la tierra y a la   cría de cerdos desde hace 5 años; además también trabaja en una bodega de granos básicos lo cual le permite tener un ingreso extra para el sostenimiento de su familia, compuesta por su esposa y cinco hijos, dos de los cuales asisten a la escuela. Uno de sus mayores sueños es que algún día el y su esposa  Maria puedan ser propietarios de  un negocio  en el centro de la ciudad. Actualmente Fermín desea obtener un sistema solar que le ayude a su familia a tener una vida diferente a la que han tenido hasta ahora, ya que deben alumbrarse con velas y lámparas de kerosén por no contar con servicio de energía eléctrica y sabe que esto perjudica su salud por lo cual solicita financiamiento a SOLUZ HONDURAS para la compra de  este sistema, que le  ayudara a sus hijos con las tareas por la noche, ya que tendrían mejor iluminación, también ayudaría a que  su esposa pueda realizar con mayor facilidad las tareas del hogar  muy temprano por la mañana a la hora  que Fermín y los niños salen al trabajo y la escuela.
texts.en: 43-year-old Fermín lives in Olanchito in Honduras. He is a very enterprising man who has worked in farming and pig-rearing for 5 years. He also works in a basic grains warehouse, which gives him additional income with which to support his family: his wife and five children, two of whom are still at school. One of his greatest dreams is that, one day, he and his wife Maria will own their own business in the city centre. At he moment, Fermín would like to obtain a solar power system, which would help his family to have a different life from the one they have had up to now, as they have to light their home with candles and kerosene lamps because they have no electricity. Fermín knows that this is damaging their health and so he is applying to SOLUZ HONDURAS for a loan to buy the system which will enable his children to do things in the evening, as they will have better lighting. It will also help his wife as she will be able to do the housework more easily early in the morning when Fermín and the children leave for work and school.

loans.use: to buy a solar power system for his home which will improve his family's living conditions.

loans.name: Deisy Noemi

texts.es: Deisy de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica desde hace un año a la venta de tortillas y pupusas, su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes especialmente sus vencinos, Deisy quiere mejorar su vivienda construyendo un cuarto en el lugar que muestra la fotografia pero como no posee de suficiente capital para realizarlo solicita a INTEGRAL  un credito para la compra de materiales de construccion y asi poder tener vivienda digan.
texts.en: 36-year-old Deisy lives with her husband and two children in their own home. She has sold tortillas and papusas (filled tortillas) for a year. She runs her business form her home and has many customers, many of whom are her neighbours. Deisy wants to improve he home by building a room in the area shown on the photo, but she lacks the capital to do this and so she is applying to INTEGRAL for a loan to buy building materials which will allow her to have a decent home.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Marta Guadalupe

texts.es: marta de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hija, ella se dedica a la siembra de maiz y tambien trabaja como jornal, cliente tiene 15 años de dedicarse a esa actividad, vende sus prodcutos en el mercado municipal que se encuentra cerca de su casa, gracias  sus ventas es como logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de insumos agricolas semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografia para poder continuar con su trabajo.
texts.en: 37-year-old Marta lives with her husband and daughter in their own home. She has grown corn and worked as a labourer for 15 years. She sells her produce in the town market which is close to where she lives and, with the money she makes from her sales, manages to cover her household costs. She is seeking a loan to buy agricultural supplies such as seeds, fertiliser, manure, pesticide, etc. and to improve her land (shown on the photo) so she can carry on with her work.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies: seeds, fertiliser, manure, pesticide, etc. and improve her land

loans.name: Macario

texts.en:
Macario is 29 years old and has a 1 year daughter. He is married and lives in a house of his own. He drives a van that transports persons (public transport).  He started as an employee and worked hard enough to get a business of his own. His wife owns another van which they rent. 

Macario has handled previous loans and payed them on time with no complications and he is looking for this new loan to fix and improve his current van. The loan is for $20,000.00 (twenty thousand pesos)

loans.use: To make improvements to his van

loans.name: Saad

texts.en:
Saad is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Zabi Village. Saad joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Saad suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to purchase better inputs to improve his yield. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Saad will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Saad now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Crusade Group

texts.en:
These people are part of the group called crusade will begin its ninth cycle with ID-Ghana. It is made up of five members and is represented by Hariet. The businesses that the group members carry out are varied; among them are: selling groundnut paste, lining, tubers, vegetables, detergents, plantain and soft drinks. The loan that they are taking out will benefit small-time micro-entrepreneurs, one of whom is Hariet. She says that she joined ID-Ghana five years ago at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the organization. Currently, she has a business selling groundnut paste and lining. She shares that she learned this business 25 years ago through her own initiative.

The loan she is now taking out is for an increase in working capital. She will get items from the wholesale market in the city of Accra and later will sell them in her sales space. This type of work allows her to generate income to support her family financially, because she is single and has three children.

When she is asked what she likes about ID-Ghana, she answers that she likes the area of health, the training and the payment meetings that the organization offers.

loans.use: To buy groundnut paste and vegetables, which she will sell to her customers.

loans.name: Norberto

texts.en: Farming has been Norberto’s business involvement. He has cultivated his one-hectare rice field and five hectares of corn for 30 years. The generated income goes towards the family's daily necessities, monthly payments for electric bills and maintenance to corn farmland. Norberto would like to increase his yield and income this next crop season. He is asking for additional capital of PHP 25,000 to buy farm supplies, such as 25 bags of fertilizer. Norberto knows that this amount of loan will enable him to obtain his goal. He hopes and prays for approval of his requested loan amount.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies, such as 25 bags of fertilizer, for his rice farming business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a box of chicks, fodder and more vegetables

loans.name: Evelina

texts.en:
Evelina is an associate requesting a special loan from Esperanza's Water Project, which gives associates and members from social groups in any community.  Esperanza serves this type of loan to help their communities. In this special loan, Evelina from Santo Domingo North, started this water project in order to provide purified water to the inhabitants of their community, delivering the service at a low price, but with high quality and proper standards.

She wants to use this loan to rebuild her local business by buying 5-gallon water bottles and labels, change system pieces, an electricity generator,  to paint the walls and other investments.  She also want to restructure its distribution point where she sterilizes gallons, fills bottles with purified water and delivers them to the neighbors that go directly to the business to buy them or sellers that distribute them. 

Evelina is in change of the water project called Agua Meta (Water Goal), with 6 employers. Approximately 15,000 people live in their neighborhood, and her plan is to distribute purified water to 3,000 families, at a cost of $0.75 US for a 5-gallon bottle of water. With this, Evelina said, she wants to impact different areas: economic, health, employees and many others. This community, like others in the Dominican Republic, is an extremely poor area in Santo Domingo with many health problems, potable water scarcity, diseases, pollution, etc. This project future plans is to serve as least 10,000 families of her community. 

Evelina thanks God, Esperanza Internacional, and all of you for this opportunity. In her name and the name of all of her co-workers, she thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: To rebuild the water purification business by purchasing an electric generator, filter systems, etc covering 3000 families

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en: Oscar is 27 years old, lives with his parents, he is single and he doesn t have children.  He works as a driver and he needs a loan to pay for another maintenance session for his vehicle, because his vehicle is old and it is the only way that allows him Oscar to make some money.  He is also supporting his parents.  He hopes you can help him again as he wants to buy another vehicle in the future

loans.use: to pay for another maintenance session for his vehicle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom at her home to improve access to water and sanitation for her family.

loans.name: Báu

texts.en:
Mrs. Báu  is 63 years old and married. She has worked in agriculture, raising poultry, for more than 10 years. Báu  lives in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village. Moreover, the market need is low in this region.
 
One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is that her latrine is not hygienic. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet.

This is Báu's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. With her business profit, Báu hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Souheila

texts.en:
Souheila, who is 52 years old, is a happily married housewife and the mother of 3 children. Souheila has owned a shop since 2013 where she produces and sells accessories, with twenty years of experience in this domain. With the progress of her work, Souheila would like to expand the production of accessories and even participate in exhibitions. In order to do that, she needs a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to buy more material so as to produce more accessories. This support will allow her to reach dream. 

Souheila is Al Majmoua borrower for three consecutive cycles, her previous loan was requested to buy electrical appliances necessary for her business development and to cover some of her home needs.
Souheila succeeded in improving the quality of her work as well as expanding her shop and equipping it with all the necessary tools.

loans.use: to buy material so as to produce more necklaces and earrings and other accessories

loans.name: Yert's Group

texts.en:
Yert’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Yert makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. 

Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is now making a fresh head start in her sari-sari (variety) store business. 

Two months ago in her resident city, Malabon, she started selling varieties of products and commodities. Suddenly her interest with regulating this kind of business loomed since she found it to be a good and reliable source of income for her family. In just a two-month span, she was able to gravitate customers to her store. Now, she has two assistants with her to accommodate clients. It has also made it easier for her to distribute SIM cards to (mobile phone) load consumers, which she started in 2007. 

Josefina is no other than a typical mother of 49 years of age, yet she is a dreamer. Because she truly wants to infuse a better future for her youngsters, she tried everything to improve her resources. Until in 2010, her business-mindedness drew her closer to CCT. Gradually, she was encouraged to be a member here. Today, she continues to learn and get inspired with CCT's guide through weekly fellowship where she studies God's word with her co-members. 

As of now, she turns to you to access a loan amounting to 40,000 pesos that she will use to add more variety of products to sell in her store. 

There is unfailing hope in Josefina. She knows that someday, her small store will turn into a convenient store and her family will then benefit for all her hard work. 

Success is all just a matter of persistence and love for service. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to add more variety of products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Las Lideres Group

texts.es:
Petrona es una mujer de 41 años de edad, soltera, tiene 4 hijos de 9, 12, 15 y 18 años, y su negocio es la venta comida tradicional.
Ella es buena madre, luchadora, constante, paciente, amable, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘plan 3000’ donde los pobladores son multilingües, en la mayoría; Aymarás, Quechuas y Guaraníes, situado al sur de la ciudad, migrantes se apropiaron del lugar y formaron un comercio en constante crecimiento, de clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Petrona es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (sentada, viste chompa negra con bordes rosados). Su vida la comparte con sus  hijos que estudian en la escuela. Viven en una casa propia construida de madera con techo de calamina y piso de tierra que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba, no cuenta con alcantarillado. Debido a la necesidad de mejorar sus ingresos formó una banca de emprendimiento con 8 socios que se dedican a; venta de fruta, venta de leche, confección de tejidos, venta de comida, venta de ropa de segunda mano, agricultura y venta de refrescos, para solicita run crédito y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de ‘Patasca’ que es una comida suculento y buscada por muchos a la hora de curar la resaca, se sirve como una sopa espesa se la puede elaborar a base de carne o puede ser en combinación de carne de res y de cerdo, acompañado con maíz, “es una comida para degustarse en la mañana, bien temprano,  incluso algunas personas consumen la patasca como un cura resaca…” comenta. Labor que realiza todos los días de la semana en su puesto de venta fijo para la hora de media mañana y la hora de cena. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes fijos  y diarios, la desventaja es la falta de capital para invertir en su negocio. Su sueño es abrir un restaurante de comida típica, Ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de mesas y sillas para atender a más clientes y mejorar las ventas. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que viene realizando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Petrona solicita un préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas para vender comida a más clientes y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en: 41-year-old Petrona, who is single and has four children aged 9, 12, 15 and 18, runs a business selling traditional food. She is good mother and is determined, perseverant, patient, friendly, responsible and very hardworking. She runs her business in the 'Plan 3000' area where most people are multilingual; Aymaras, Quechuas and Guaranís, mostly. Situated south of the city, the area was taken over by migrants who set up trade which is now flourishing. It has a warm climate with a temperature which fluctuates between 21 and 35 degrees centigrade. Petrona has a dark complexion, brown eyes and long black hair and is short and slim. Her mother tongue is Guaraní which she speaks at home. She speaks Spanish, however, for general purposes and for her business (seated and wearing a black jumper with pink edging). She lives with her children who are still all at school. They live in their own home, a wooden building with a corrugated roof and earthen floor which has electricity and water which they pump from a well, but there is no plumbing. Since she needs to boost her income, she set up an entrepreneurs' bank with 8 members (who work in selling fruit, selling milk, making textiles, selling food, selling second hand clothing, agriculture and selling soft drinks) so they could all apply for loans and improve their businesses. Her business involves selling 'Patasca' which is a succulent food, which is much sought after by people suffering from hangovers. It is a kind of thick ,which can be made from meat of can be a mixture of beef and pork, and is served with rice. In Petrona's words: "it is a meal to beaten in the morning, quite early, and some people even eat patasca as a hangover cure...". She works in her fixed premises every day of the week mid-morning and in the evening. The advantage of her business is that she has regular customers each day but the disadvantage is that she lacks capital to invest in the business. Her dream is to own her own traditional food restaurant. She would like to extend her business by buying tables and chairs so she can serve more customers and boost her sales. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 2 years she has been running her business. The reason why Petrona is seeking a loan is to buy tables and chairs to sell food to more customers and boost her income.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs to sell food to more customers and improve her income.

loans.name: Kibriyo

texts.en: Kibriyo is a strong woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1972. She is living in big district with her family. She is divorced and has two children. She is a nurse and works at a medical clinic. Her son works abroad and sends money to help her mother to feed their family. She got sick, but she does not have the money to be treated at the hospital. Her son could not send money for her treatment. She appealed to IMON and asked for financial support to be treated at the medical clinic. She hopes to be supported and awaits KIVA lenders compassion.

loans.use: to be treated at medical clinic

loans.name: Gullola

texts.en:
Gullola is a cheerful woman. She is living in northern part of Tajikistan in the family of workers. She is married and has four children. Her family is big and she tries to work and help her husband to feed their family. She worked at government agency and had a small wage. She left her job because of small salary. 

Then she decided to appeal to IMON to start doing business. She got a loan and did business of retailing clothes. She likes her activity and satisfies her income. She is bright and hardworking person. She was happy to use the service of IMON and again appealed to get a loan for the treatment of her mother and business also. She hopes to be supported and awaits Kiva lenders kindness.

loans.use: to get a loan for the treatment of her mother and business also

loans.name: Reina Dayana

texts.es: La señora Reina Dayana de 23 años de edad vive actualmente en domicilio propio, no tiene hijos que dependan de ella, tiene su esposo el cual se dedica a los trabajos como ayudante de albañil, vive en el departamento de Chuquisaca municipio Monteagudo. Su principal actividad de la señora Reina es la transformación de productos lácteos como ser dulce de leche, budín y flan, trabaja en su actividad de lunes a domingo para cubrir los gastos de alimentación, ropa, servicios básicos y otros gastos que incurren en su hogar. Es por tal motivo que requiere el préstamo mismo que será destinado para la compra  de electrodomésticos y muebles para emprender su negocio, con la compra de la misma la señora Reina complementara su actividad de transformación de productos lácteos por lo tanto podrá generar buenos ingresos y mejorar sus condiciones de vida en su hogar con su esposo y su diario vivir.
texts.en: Ms. Reina Dayana is 23 years old and currently lives in her own home. She does not have children that depend on her. She has a husband who works as a construction worker. She lives in the department of Chuquisaca, municipality of Monteagudo. The main economic activity of Ms. Reina is creating dairy products such as dulce de leche, pudding and flan. She works from Monday to Sunday in order to cover her expenses of food, clothing, basic services, and other household expenses. For this reason, she is requesting a loan which will be used to purchase electrical appliances and furniture to carry out her business. With this purchase, Ms. Reina will supplement her activities in creating dairy products so that she can generate good income and improve her household conditions with her husband and her daily life.

loans.use: to buy electrical appliances and furniture for her business selling dairy products so that she can generate more income and improve her living conditions in her home.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a 64 years old and married. She engaged in a mangosteen production to earn a living. With the help of her husband as a driver, the business helps in providing their daily needs. She wants to increase her income so that they can invest in another business as their extra income. So she decided to take a loan to buy fertilizer for the mangosteen farm. This will help produce good quality fruits to sell in the market, and increase her income. 

Editha plans in the future to expand her business and uplift their living condition.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for the mangosteen farm.

loans.name: Thearat's Group

texts.en:
Thearat’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Thearat makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as seller by selling grocery to support her family.
 In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea is 36 years old and lives in Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. Married and has two children. She is employed as a sewer in a garment factory in Cavite for three years now through the help of the CCT Covenant Community Service Cooperative.*

As a sewer she designs, makes, piece together or adjust and repair clothes for customers, she works as a member of the assembly line in a factory. Her primary duty is to cut, trim and stitch clothes or pieces of clothes together. A major concerns of factory worker is how to meet the needs of their family. With the high cost of living, sadly their minimum wage is not enough to adequately provide for their families' daily needs.

Therefore Andrea is humbly asking assistance to support her and her family's personal and household needs. She is thanking you in advance for your positive response to her request. Her family is her top priority and would like to provide her children at least with their basic needs.

Andrea meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work.  CCT staff and volunteers conduct weekly fellowship meetings for the factory workers before their work routine to do Bible readings, prayer and discipleship sessions to encourage and inspire them to do their best in life.

 * The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, quality for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

loans.use: To pay for her family's personal and household needs.

loans.name: Adam

texts.en:
Adam is a married man who is aged 34 years and living with his three children. 

He runs a retail business and an agricultural business where he grows beans, maize and matoke. He works six days in a week and 10 hours per day and started the business to develop himself, get school fees for his children and get food for the family.

Adam is acquiring the loan to add stock in the business to boost the trade. He will buy beverages, rice, corn flour, stationery items and cosmetics to sell. His clients are residents and fellow traders.

His dream for the future is to expand his business of a shop and transfer it into a major wholesale shop. The challenge he faces is many clients taking a long time to settle their debts. He describes himself as a hardworking man who encourages lenders to continue lending to the low-income earners so that they can also develop.

loans.use: to boost his retail trade with beverages, rice, corn flour, stationery items and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Carving success. This is Linda, 48, a college graduate but apparently unemployed by that time, and an undeniably selfless and passion-driven mother. She has kids with 46-year-old Rey, who supports them by working as a security guard. 

In general, Linda owns a small sari-sari store today (commonly known as a variety store). Here she sells different commodities such as toiletries, beverages, condiments and other grocery items. Customers are attracted to buy because of the low-cost price of the items. Besides this, she also has a house-renting business but it is currently inactive. 

To further improve sales, she asks for your help. She wants to sustain her family needs, and she envisions her business turning into a larger business. The realizations of this starts today as you let her borrow a loan worth PHP 15,000. She would use this to buy more grocery items to sell in her sari-sari store. If such an excess occurs, probably she would be spending that for reviving her house-rental business.  

She hopes that you would not ignore this. It means a lot to her if you respond to her request. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store and to revive her house-rental business.

loans.name: Savorn's Group

texts.en:
Savorn’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Savorn makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as seller to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sadriddin

texts.en:
Sadriddin is a careful father. He was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1972. He is living in big beautiful town with his wife and four children. He is a constructor and earns money and ensures his family does well. He is tries his best to earn money to feed his family. 

His family members are sick and need medicines. He appealed to IMON asking financial support to buy medicines to them for treatment. He hopes to be supported and awaits your compassion.

loans.use: to buy medicines for treatment of his family

loans.name: Tina

texts.en:
Tina is 43 years old and from the village Gamarjveba. She has a husband, son, daughter and daughter-in-law. Tina is temporarily unemployed, but her son and daughter-in-law have a fixed salary. 

Tina's husband works as a private driver and has a great desire to make his work more profitable. Tina decided somehow to help him for increasing the living conditions of her family and obtained credit among local financial institutions. She received the credit in the framework of joint initiative of Kiva and Credo — the Startup Program that gives people the chance to start or restart businesses.  

With the received amount of 5,000 GEL, Tina will purchase a car, and her husband will start his own business and get income from serving local people as a taxi driver. 

The new business income will become the significant source of income for the family, and they will increase their financial condition and create a better future.

Tina and her husband rely on the goodwill of Kiva lenders and will be very grateful for the help.

loans.use: to make a significant source of income for the family and purchase a car for her husband to use as a taxi

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be a risk taker. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, flour, bread and other items. She has been involved in this business for one year. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. 

She will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more stock of flour, sugar, bread and other items. Her business goal is to have improved living standards within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. 

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of flour, sugar, bread and other items

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Newfound hope and joy.

Every week, Lorna joins a group of people who study the word of God. Here, she is inspired and encouraged to go for living with hope and joy. Despite the fact that their family is not as fortunate as other families, with her husband, Juan, who is working as a laborer, they persevere and work hard for their children's lives.

As of today, she is operating a small store of variety products along the road. Through this small stand, they are able to supply the family with the basic needs. She wants to improve this so she can also develop her sales, and she asks for help from you.

She humbly wants to avail herself of financial support amounting to PHP 22,000 to buy more products to sell. She's really hoping that you'll grant her this.

This is now your chance to help in just a little way.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery products to fill her store.

loans.name: Aquinus

texts.en:
Aquinus is a divorced man. He has four children. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a retail business where he sells soft drinks. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are retailers. 

He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of soft drinks. His business goal is to have more different brands of soft drinks to sell within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of soft drinks

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
La señora Marina, es una persona humilde y respetuosa en su comunidad donde trabaja, por lo dedicado al trabajo agrícola, con lo cual saca a su familia adelante para así mantener y cubrir los gastos de estudios de sus hijos, como madre quiere lo mejor para su familia. 
La señora Marina, tiene 41 años de edad, convive con el señor Tomas tiene tres hijos dependientes de sus ingresos, vive en una comunidad rural muy alejada al área urbano. La señora Marina, se dedica a la agricultura porque es lo único que aprendió con sus progenitores.
El año 2014 sufrió una disminución en sus ingresos económicos por los bajos precios que atravesó los productos agrícolas y también por las lluvias que le echaron a perder su producción de papa, perdió parte de su cultivo de papa. La comunidad entera sufrió los daños.
Por estos motivos mencionados su estabilidad económica ha sufrido un desequilibrio, afectando directamente en la adquisición de sus insumos agrícolas que se requieren para la producción y para la alimentación de sus hijos. La señora Marina, está solicitando préstamo para comprar semilla de papa e insumos agrícolas de esta manera mejorar su economía y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marina is a humble and respectful person in her community where she works in agriculture. With this she is able to get her family ahead, where she is able to cover educational expenses for her children, just like a mother would want the best for her family.

Mrs. Marina is 41 years old and lives with Mr. Tomas. She has three children dependent on her income. She lives in a rural community very far away from the urban area. Mrs. Marina works in agriculture because it is the only thing she learned from her parents.

In 2014, she suffered a reduction in income due to low prices which affected agricultural products and also because of the rain which caused her to lose her potato production. She lost half of her potato harvest. The entire community suffered these damages.

For these reasons, her economic stability has suffered an imbalance, affecting directly, the acquisition of agricultural supplies that are required for farming and to feed her children. Mrs. Marina is requesting a loan to buy potato seeds and agricultural supplies to improve her economic well-being and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and agricultural supplies so that she can improve her economic well-being and quality of life.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman. She has eight children. She describes herself to be competent. She operates a farm where she keeps cows and poultry. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a productive area, and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. 

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy farm inputs. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable income. This is her second  loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Nidaa

texts.en:
Nidaa is a 19-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and they have no children. Her husband is the main income provider for the family. 

In 2014, Nidaa decided to start her own business; she opened a small room in her house where she provides hairdressing and beautician services. 

Today, Nidaa is asking to borrow from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to open a beauty salon in her town and to expand her work. She said that after taking the loan, she will be able to attract more customers and therefore increase her income to develop her way of living.

loans.use: to open a beauty salon and to expand her work

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina, who is 43 years old, is married and has five children. She runs a small bakery, which she has had for almost two years, and this business helps support her family financially.

As her work is progressing, Lina would like to start another business, which is an Internet café. In order to do that, she needs a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua so as to develop her work further and start her new business afterwards. Such support will allow her to reach her goals.

This is Lina’s sixth loan cycle from Al Majmoua. Her previous loans were invested in paying for her children’s school tuition fees so that she helps her husband with increasing financial responsibilities.

loans.use: to start another business, which is an Internet café.

loans.name: Mohammad Jamil

texts.en:
Mohammad Jamil, 20 years old, works in a car exhibition as a salesperson. He is currently continuing his higher education while he is working. 

In order be able to pay for his university fees and register for his second educational year in banking and finance, he needs a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua so as to be able to pay the fees. Support given to Mohammad will allow him to continue his education and will also enable him to have a better future.

loans.use: to pay for his university fees, and register for his second educational year in banking and finance

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is thanking you for the previous loan granted to her, which helped pay for the education of her children. She has fully paid her loan last month. Filipinos put a high value to education so it is usually on the top items on their budget next to food.  

Elsa still works as a sewer or seamstress in a garment factory in Cavite. The usual concern of factory workers who earn only minimum wage is how to augment their income to make ends meet for their family, so this prompt Elsa to order a side car to use for transportation service.

She is now humbly asking for assistance to lend her a PHP 15,000 loan to pay for the materials and labor of assembling a side car. Having a side car to use going to office and sending her children to school will save her a lot from their daily transportation expense. She is thanking you in advance for your positive response to her request. 

Elsa meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work. *CCT staff and volunteers conduct weekly fellowship meetings for the factory workers before their work routine to do Bible readings, prayer and discipleship sessions to encourage and inspire them to do their best in life. 

*The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, quality for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

loans.use: to pay for the materials and labor of assembling a side car.

loans.name: Liwaa

texts.en:
Liwaa, who is 20 years old, works in the construction field by supplying electric installations for construction.  

As Liwaa is still young, he aspires to develop his work by expanding it and by taking more construction-site projects. 

In order to seal better deals, Liwaa needs a Youth loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to further develop his work through buying necessary updated tools and requested machines. Such support will allow Liwaa to reach his goals and growth.

loans.use: To develop his work further through buying necessary updated tools and requested machines

loans.name: Dionicio

texts.es: Don Dionicio de 56 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, el se dedica al cultivo de granos basicos y venta de dulce de atado el cual inicio con capital propio, tiene 30 años de dedicarse a esa actividad de la cual ha podido salir adelante, vende sus productos durante todo el año, el cliente esta solicitando un credito para la compra de semillas, abonos, control de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografia para poder tener una mejor cosecha y asi tener mas granos basicos para comercializar.
texts.en:
Dionicio, age 56, lives in his own house with his wife and his daughter. He grows basic grains and sells ‘dulce de atado’ [blocks of brown sugar sold wrapped in corn husks], which he started with his own capital. He has been engaged in this business activity for 30 years, and with it he has been able to get ahead. He sells his products all year.

He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides, etc. and to improve the land that is shown in the photo. He will do this in order to be able to have a better harvest. This way he will have more basic grains to sell.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides, etc. and to improve the land.

loans.name: Gulizor

texts.en:
Gulizor is a hardworking divorced woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1971, and she lives in a remote district with her family. 

Gulizor is a teacher at a secondary school, and she teaches two beginner classes. She has 22 years of experience working in the educational sphere. She is one of the trusted clients at IMON. She makes repayments on time. 

Once more Gulizor needs money to pay for her education. At the same time she works and studies in a part-time department. She works on her self-development. She requested a loan to pay for her studies at university. She awaits Kiva lenders' kindness and wishes to be supported.

loans.use: to pay for her studies at university

loans.name: Adrian Israel

texts.es:
Adrian continúa con su negocio de venta de artículos plásticos. El crédito que obtuvo lo invirtió en la compra de una freidora de pollo la cual es atendida por su papá. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque no tuvo problemas. Su siguiente meta es fabricar pizarras de corcho y acrílicas, “estoy iniciando esta actividad y con los recursos mínimos he encontrado un mercado no satisfecho que son estudiantes, profesores, y oficinas que necesitan este producto…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que encontró un nicho de mercado, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la compra de materia prima para la fabricación de pizarras. Su sueño es lograr ser un vendedor mayorista, el desea realizar la compra de materia prima para la fabricación de pizarras para satisfacer un nicho de mercado. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que viene realizando esta labor. 
Es por esos motivos que Adrian solicita un préstamo para la compra de materia prima para la fabricación de pizarras para cubrir un nicho de mercado y vender por mayor.
texts.en:
Adrian continues his business selling plastic products. The loan he received was invested in buying a fryer for chicken which is attended by his father. The payments of his fees were punctual because he did not have any problems. 

His next goal is to make boards from cork and acrylic. "I am starting this activity and with minimal resources, I have found a market with unsatisfied students, professors and offices which need this product", he said. The advantage of his business is that he found a niche market. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy raw material to build the boards. His dream is to become a wholesale seller. He wishes to be able to buy raw material to build boards and satisfy a niche market. 

This is the second loan with the institution in the 10 years he has been working. For these reasons, Adrian is requesting a loan to buy raw material to build boards to reach a niche market through wholesale.

loans.use: to buy raw material to build boards in order to reach a niche market through wholesale.

loans.name: Rosa Melida

texts.es:
Rosa, de 60 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, debido a que sus padres ya no le pudieron seguir pagando el estudio por la crisis económica que atravesaban en ese momento, actualmente es viuda y tiene 5 hijas, todas sus hijas ya se independizaron, 2 de ellas están casadas, 2 acompañadas y una sigue soltera, Rosa, vive solo con su mamá y es la única que depende de ella. 

Rosa, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos especificamente vende lociones, shampoo, desodorantes, maquillajes etc.- Ella se dedica a este negocio desde hace 10 años, una amiga fue quien la motivo a involucrarse en este negocio y fue con ella con quien aprendió poco a poco este negocio.- Actualmente, se desplaza por toda la comunidad ofreciendo sus productos y día a día se esfuerza caminando aproximadamente 5 kilómetros.

Rosa, utilizara el préstamo para ampliar más su negocio, comprara más lociones, esmaltes, desodorantes, shampoo, maquillajes entre otros. 

Rosa, sueña con tener un negocio grande, que le genere la suficiente fuente de ingresos para poder sacar adelante a su madre, que ya está bastante mayor de edad y necesita medicinas para poder estar estable de salud.
texts.en:
Rosa, is 60 years old. She only studied until sixth grade, as her parents couldn't afford to keep paying for her studies. Nowadays Rosa is a widow with five children, all of whom are now independent. Two of Rosa's children are married and two have partners. Rosa lives with her mother who relies on her.

Rosa has made a living selling cosmetics for the past ten years, specifically lotions, nail-polish, deodorants, shampoo, make up, etc. A friend of Rosa's inspired her to get involved in this work and it was from this friend that Rosa learnt the business. 

Rosa now sells her products around the whole community, covering around five kilometres walking everyday. Rosa will use this loan to grow her business, she will buy more lotions, nail-polish, deodorants, shampoo, make up and so on. 

Rosa dreams of having a big business that would allow her to give her Mother what she deserves, as she is now quite old and needs medicine to maintain her health.

loans.use: to buy more lotions, nail-polish, deodorants, shampoo, make up, etc.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a mother of two children and aged 48. As a single mother, she wants to earn income for their living so she engaged in banana production. She plants bananas and sell to the market after harvest. 

She needs to increase her income because of increasing needs of her children so she decided to take a loan to pay labor cost in harvesting the bananas so that she can deliver more bananas to the market and can cater to all the orders of her customers and it will result in a greater income.

Teresita plan for the future to buy a vehicle for delivery use.

loans.use: To pay labor cost in harvesting bananas.

loans.name: Roseler

texts.en:
Roseler is a 40 years old, married and has 2 children to provide for. To earn a living he is engaged in a piggery business. He raised pigs and sells them to the market. He aims to have a greater income  so he decided to take a loan to buy feed for the pigs, so that he can produce a good quality of pigs and can deliver pigs to supply his customer demand and this will result a greater income.

Roseler's plan for the future is to save money to sustain the needs of their family.

loans.use: To buy feeds for the pigs.

loans.name: Fidelis

texts.en:
Fidelis is a married man. He has six children. He operates a food stall where he cooks food to sell. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a strategic place, and his primary customers are regular.

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food.

His business goal is to have a bigger hotel within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Hân

texts.en:
Mrs. Hân is 62 years old and she is married. She has worked in agriculture, raising poultry for more than 10 years.

Hân lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover, the market need is low in this region. 

Her family has a latrine but it is not hygienic. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is the latrine is not hygienic. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipments to build a toilet.

This is Hân's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

Along with her business profit, Hân hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipments to build a toilet.

loans.name: Dưỡng

texts.en:
Mrs. Dưỡng is 43 years old and she is married. She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for five years.

Dưỡng lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover, the market need is low in this region. 

Her family has a latrine but it is not hygienic. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is the latrine is not hygienic. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

This is Dưỡng's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

Along with her business profit, Dưỡng hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman, and she has three children. She describes herself to be determined. 

Mary operates a retail business where she sells clothes and also does tailoring. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a good area, and she describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

Mary will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be loyal. She operates a retail business where she sells building stones. Her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of stones. She hopes that in the future, the business will grow.

loans.use: to buy more stock of stones

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is a married man in his advanced years, with 8 children. He is involved in farming, especially coffee.

Musa is also a businessman. He solely deals in the trade of agricultural produce and has a retail shop.

Musa has acquired this loan facility in order to both buy fertilizers for his coffee shamba and also stock produce for his store.  He hopes this will increase his sales and profits. According to Musa, his main challenge is price fluctuations, which has led to the loss of capital.

Lastly, Musa applauds UGAFODE's management and Kiva's lenders for making affordable loans available to the communities to enable small entrepreneurs to grow their businesses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs in the form of fertilizers.

loans.name: Iosebi

texts.en:
Iosebi, who is 56 years old from the capital of Georgia, lives with his wife, who works as a cleaner at the local store. Iosebi was temporarily unemployed and decided to be involved in his own business, to make his family's welfare. 

He decided to start producing sunflowers for their seeds and trade at the local market. He had purchased some machinery for toasting, deployment and then distribute it to the local stores in a good prices. 

Iosebi needs financial support to purchase additional tools and also have money for working capital to make his business effective and profitable for the family. 

The startup program, that is joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables poor people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 3600 GEL. This will give Iosebi a chance to earn income and become financially independent. Regards with the Start Up program he will be able to make savings and provide better future for his family.

loans.use: To produce sunflowers for seeds to be sold for further trading

loans.name: Shahodatmo

texts.en:
Shahodatmo is a happy woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1968. She is living in big city of hospitable people which exports dried fruits. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a constructor. She is a farmer and has 20 year of experience. Years of efficient income from livestock passed away, because of wasting money on holidays and events. 

Her husband’s earnings are smaller then usual this year.  For the last two years, she often got sick. She wants to get a loan to provide her son’s wedding ceremony and to be treated at hospital after all. She appealed to IMON and Kivalenders to get financial support to be treated at hospital and give some money for the wedding ceremony of her son.

loans.use: to give some money to the wedding ceremony of her son and also have some medical help

loans.name: Darya

texts.en:
Darya is a generous woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1990. She is living in a small town with her family. She is married to Suhrob. They have a child. Her husband is an entrepreneur. She has been working at a company as an economist since 2014. 

From 2012 she is studying at a university at a part-time department. Her university is asking her to make payment for the educational year. She does not have the money to pay for it. She appealed to IMON, asking for a loan to pay her higher education costs. She hopes to be understood and awaits your compassion.

loans.use: to pay her higher education costs

loans.name: Celia

texts.es: La señora Celia vive el  trópico de Cochabamba, municipio de Entre Rios junto a su conyugue y sus dos hijos, Señora Celia se dedica a la producción de piña con la ayuda de su marido, trabajan por el bienestar de sus hijos para sacarlos adelante, porque ellos migraron de zonas altiplanos de Bolivia donde no hay mucho movimiento económico en busca de mejores condiciones de vida, actualmente cuenta con 1 hectárea de piña el cual le genera buenos ingresos a doña Celia, el producto lo comercializa a comerciantes de fruta que compran en su misma actividad económica, este producto le genera ingresos para el sustento familiar y para el crecimiento económico, para ello tambien requiere un buen manejo, por lo cual la señora Celia requiere un préstamo para realizar el mantenimiento de la fruta con la ayuda de la mano de obra, con este préstamo la señora Celia podrá realizar un buen mantenimiento de su producción lo cual va repercutir en el aumento del rendimiento y así podrá realizar buenas cosechas.
texts.en:
Celia lives with her husband and their two children in the Tropic of Cochabamba in the Entre Rios municipality. With the help of her husband, Celia is a pineapple producer. They work for their children's well-being in order to get them ahead. They migrated from the highlands of Bolivia, where there is not a lot of economic movement, to look for better living conditions.

She currently has one hectare of pineapples, which generates good earnings for Celia. She sells the products to the fruit merchants who buy the fruit. This product generates income to support the family and for financial growth. Doing so requires good management. That is why Celia needs a loan to provide maintenance to the fruit, which she will do with the help from laborers. With this loan Celia will be able to provide good maintenance to her production. This will result in an increase to her output. This way she will be able to have good harvests.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on her crops so that she is able to generate better earnings and improve her quality of life.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman. She has four children. She operates a retail business where she sells furniture. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a good area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

She will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more furniture. She hopes that in the future, she will be prosperous. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees.

loans.use: to buy more furniture

loans.name: Rosario De Maria

texts.es:
Rosario, de 48 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado, es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos, que estudian y el mayor también trabaja para ayudarle con la carga familiar.

Rosario, cuando tuvo la necesidad de comprar artículos escolares para que sus hijos asistieran a la escuela, coloco una mini-librería hace 4 años y decidió dedicarse a este negocio para mantener a sus hijos, porque se separo de su pareja: además hace pan dulce para vender en el cantón y trabaja en las fincas de café de la zona, cuando ella trabaja en las fincas que están a 2 kilómetros a pie desde el caserío, uno de sus hijos se queda para atender el negocio en sus tiempos libres.

El préstamo sera utilizado para comprar artículos escolares como libros, lapiceros, papel, etc. para la mini-librería y también para comprar materia prima para la venta de pan dulce como azúcar, manteca, etc. esto le servirá para cubrir la demanda, ya que hay artículos que le buscan y no los tiene, con esto lograra obtener mejores ganancias para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Rosario, sueña con hacer crecer su negocio y ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales algún día, este sueño lo lograra con el préstamo ya que obtendrá más ganancias para ampliar su negocio y cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Rosario, 48, stayed in school until third grade and is a single mother. She has three children who are in school. The eldest also works in order to help    her with the household costs.

Four years ago, when she needed to buy school materials for her children so that they could go to school, Rosario set up a mini-bookstore. She decided to make a living from this business in order to support her children because she had separated from her partner. She also makes sweet-bread to sell in the district and works in the coffee farms in the area. When she works on the farms, which are a two kilometre walk from her village, one of her children stays behind to take care of the business in their spare time. 

She will use the loan to buy school materials such as books, pencils, paper etc. for the mini-bookstore and ingredients for her sweet-bread selling business such as sugar and butter etc. This will allow her to meet demand, as there are some items that people come looking for that she doesn't have. This will allow her to generate more income and improve her family's quality of life.

Rosario dreams of expanding her business and seeing her children become professionals one day. She will achieve this dream with the help of the this loan as she will earn more money to expand her business and accomplish her goals.

loans.use: to buy school materials such as books, pencils, paper etc. for her mini-bookstore and to buy ingredients for her sweet-bread selling business like sugar, butter, etc

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoa is 55 years old and she is married. She lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
 
Hoa's family lives in a low-income household in a village, moreover the market need is low in this region. She has had a retail business selling dried food for more than ten years.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns Hoa is that their lartrine is not hygienic. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

This is Hoa's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance institution.
