With her business profit, Hoa hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build toilet.

loans.name: Against Poverty-N1Nngạn3 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hoa is 61 years old and married. For more than 10 years, she has had a retail business selling dry food, onion, garlic, ginger, fish sauce, etc. Hoa lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village. Moreover, the market need is low in this region. 

She has no collateral and, therefore, can't get a loan from other banks or credit institutions. The main hardship that Hoa faces is lack of capital. She is a reputable person in the community. Although this is Hoa's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution, every member of her group agreed for her to be the leader of "Against poverty-N1NNgạn3" group. She is requesting a loan to purchase more dry food, onion, garlic, ginger, fish sauce, etc. for resale. 

With her business profit, Hoa hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase more dry food, onion, garlic, ginger, fish sauce, etc.

loans.name: Faten

texts.en:
Faten, 37 years old, is a divorced mother of two children and is responsible for a family of four members. Faten has been producing handmade crafts and accessories for a living for the past 10 years. She is also a tattoo artist, and she learned this skill at a beauty clinic. Even though Faten is ambitious and would like to expand her business, she lacks the financial means to do so.

Faten needs a facial cleansing machine that will make her work easier and more developed. In order to buy the machine, she needs a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to buy the machine and develop her work more. This will help Faten support her family, as she is a working mom and the breadwinner at her house.

This is Faten’s second loan cycle at Al Majmoua; her previous loan was invested in buying her current tattoo machine.

loans.use: to buy a facial cleansing machine that will make her work easier and more developed.

loans.name: 3 Grandmothers Go To Get Loans-N2Qtrung1Đvệ Group

texts.en:
Mrs Lan is 62 years old. She is old, but she need to raise income to improve her children's quality of life and let her grandchildren go to school.Lan lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. She has had a service business repairing bicycles for five years.

Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. She has no collateral so can't get a loan from other banks or credit institutions. The main hardship that Lan faces is lack of capital.

She is requesting a loan to purchase supplies to maintain the bicycle repair shop.

This is Lan's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

Lan hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to maintain her bicycle repair shop.

loans.name: Wambua

texts.en:
Wambua is a married man. He has eight children.

He operates a farm where he keeps goats and cows. His business is located in an area with potential. He describes his biggest business challenge to be drought.

He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more goats and cows.

His business goal is to be a supplier within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more goats and cows.

loans.name: Billa

texts.en:
Billa is 32 years old from Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She has a life partner and has children. She has been employed in a garment factory in Cavite for three years now through the help of the CCT Covenant Community Service Cooperative.*

Billa's main job as Quality Controller is to monitor operations to ensure they meet production standards, inspect and test materials and monitors the quality of the product through the various stages of production. In the Phils. factory workers earn only the minimum wage which is not adequate to raise a family so this led Billa to borrow from lenders who charge very high interest rates.

Therefore Billa is humbly asking for your assistance to lend her an amount of Php 8000 to pay off her current loans and save her from paying the excessively high interest. She will appreciate much your positive response to her request and is thanking for the much needed help.

Billa meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work.  CCT staff and volunteers conduct weekly fellowship meetings for the factory workers before their work routine to do Bible readings, prayer and discipleship sessions to encourage and inspire them to do their best in life.

 *The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, quality for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program.

loans.use: To pay off her other personal loans which she used for her family's needs.

loans.name: Richy Ville

texts.en:
Richy Ville is a 38 years old, married and has two children. He does vegetable gardening for a living. He wants to give his family a good life, like other families and to achieve this he must increase his income. 

So he needs to harvest plenty of vegetables, so that he can sell more vegetable in the market. He decided to take a loan to buy fertilizer for his vegetable garden, so that he can produce a good quality of vegetables and can deliver more vegetables to the market.

Richy Ville plan for the future to save money from his business income to sustain the needs of his family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his vegetable garden.

loans.name: Brigida

texts.en:
Brigida is a 65-year-old married woman and has seven children. Fishing is their primary source of income in Bien Unido, Bohol. She used to help her husband in doing this business for almost 26 years. They only earn about PHP1572 per month enough for their daily consumption. 

With that, she is asking a loan of PHP6000 to buy new fishing nets, a sack of rice and fertilizer for their crop. Since their children are old enough, Brigida and her husband wish to have a better means of living.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, a sack of rice and fertilizer

loans.name: Naphovat Group

texts.en:
Somsark is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan. Somsark and his group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies. Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years.

The water filter Somsark and his group purchased is guaranteed for two years but is known to function for up to five years.

Somsarkand his group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne diseases. And after totaling up the costs, Somsark and his group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 34-year-old married father of two. He is employed in a special maintenance company since 2007, and is working hard to develop his career and overcome his special needs situation. He is well known in his region with his good reputation and hard work he shows to improve his talents.

Ahmad has a limited monthly salary, but still he finds himself responsible for financially supporting his mother. Thus, for this reason, he is acquiring a Damej (Special Al Majmuoa people with special needs loan) loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to support his mother's clothes selling business so that she can increase her merchandise with a newly released summer collection.

He hopes that in the future he can open his own business and expand throughout the region.

loans.use: To support his mother's clothes selling business, so that she can increase her merchandise with a newly released summer collection

loans.name: Workaholic-N1Qtrung3Ntrạo Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Bình is 56 years old and she is married. Bình lives in Thanh Hoa City, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
 
Bình has had a service business, shipping goods for the past three years.

Bình's family is in a low-income household in her village; moreover her job is unstable. She has no collateral because she can't get loans from other banks or credit institutions.

The main hardship that Bình faces is a lack of capital. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to maintain the bus to continue her shipping goods business.

This is Bình's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance institution.

With her business profit, Bình hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to maintain her bus for her service business, shipping goods

loans.name: Smiles-N1Qtrung1Đvệ Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hải is 49 years old and she is married. She wants to work hard to provide good conditions for her child in university.  She has had a retail business selling coal for more than 10 years.  Hải lives in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. 

The main hardship that Hải faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more coal to resell.  This is Hải first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
With her business profit, Hải hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase more coal to resell

loans.name: Melida Celina

texts.es: Melida, tiene 38 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos y reside en Villanueva, Cortes. Hace 11 años que Melida tiene su propio negocio de venta de mercadería variada como ser perfumes, lociones, carteras para damas, blusas, jeans para caballeros nuevos y cosméticos. Ella vende de manera ambulante y por pedidos. Esta solicitando el segundo préstamo a la institución por 30,000 Lempiras con el fin de comprar ropa y zapatos nuevos para vender y hacer una reparación del cerco de su casa. Su propósito es mejorar su inventario de mercadería para vender variedad de productos y aumentar sus ganancias. Tiene como meta establecer un local para el negocio y ayudar a sus hijos con los estudios.
texts.en:
Melida, age 38, is a single mother of 4 children and lives in Villanueva, Cortes. For the last 11 years Melida has had her own business selling different products, like perfumes, lotions, women’s purses, shirts, new jeans for gentlemen and cosmetics. 

She sells her products as a street vendor and also by specific requests of her clients. She is requesting a second loan from the institution for 30,000 lempiras with the purpose of buying new clothing and shoes to sell, and also to repair the fence of her house. 

Her objective is to improve her inventory to offer a wider variety of products and improve her earnings. Her goals are to establish a shop for her business and to support her children with their studies.

loans.use: to buy new clothing and shoes to sell, and to repair the fence of her house.

loans.name: Dume

texts.en:
Dume is a married man. He has two children. He operates a retail business where he sells palm wine. He has been involved in this business for six years. His primary customers are regular.

He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to build a business premise.

His business goal is to have a bigger business within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to build a business premise

loans.name: Carey

texts.en:
Carey is a single woman and has 3 children. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. 

She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to be a major supplier within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Love Kids - N4T7Đ.anh Group

texts.en:
Mrs Nguyệt has a shop providing electric devices service. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.

She is requesting a loan to purchase supplies to maintain her electric devices service.

Nguyệt is 45 years old and she is married with two children. She is the group leader of the "Love Kids - N4T7Đ.Anh" solidarity group, which consists of three members.

In 2013, Nguyệt joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Nguyệt has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

The main harship that Nguyệt faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Nguyệt hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to maintain her electric devices service

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a married man, and he has six children. 

George operates a food stall, and he has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in an area with potential. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

George will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stocks of ingredients for preparing food. 

This is George's third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Siraje

texts.en:
Siraje is a married man, aged 35 years, living in town with his family of four children.

He deals in a butcher business. He has an additional income from agriculture/farming, where he grows crops such as bananas, maize, and beans. He works 12 hours per day, and he is applying for this loan to buy cows for slaughter and trade. This will boost his sales and profit.

He has hopes of expanding into a large business and also venturing into other profitable businesses. The challenges he faces are bad debts from customers who take the meat on credit and fail to pay.

He describes himself as an honest and hardworking man. He appreciates lenders for the services rendered to him. He looks forward to a continued financial boost and support.

loans.use: to buy cows for slaughter and sale.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a married woman, aged 35 years, lives in Kyotera town with her family of two children and a husband. She has one dependent.
She is a small-scale farmer who grows food crops for feeding her family and also grows coffee to sell. She operates a retail shop to get additional income.

She works eight hours per day. Her agriculture is facing challenges of the scorching sun, she thinks that if she mulched the coffee garden, she will prevent loss of moisture and have the coffee yielding well.   She has hopes of increased yields from the coffee and of expanding into a large business which can supply all the people around. Her clients are coffee traders.

The challenges she faces are bad debtors and lack of sufficient capital. She describes herself as being a trustworthy woman.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers

loans.name: Sanounxaytai Group

texts.en:
Khiam’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.

Khiam and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable. Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits.

Khiam and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for two years; within this two years, filter users, like Khiam’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Nakhang Group

texts.en:
Boua understands the difference the water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families.  Boua knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Boua purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.    

Boua is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Lae Group

texts.en:
Bounpheang is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan. Bounpheang and his group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies. Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years.

The water filter Bounpheang and his group purchased is guaranteed for two years but is known to function for up to five years. Bounpheang and his group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne diseases. And after totaling up the costs, Bounpheang and his group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 64, with 5 adult children from San Miguel, Bohol and owns a sari-sari store. She has been in this business for three years.  She works hard for the future. 

She is asking a loan of PHP10000 to buy additional grocery items such as soft drinks, chips, biscuits, candles, noodles, canned goods, coffee, powdered milk, powdered juice, toiletries, kitchen wares and school materials. Rosario's only hope is to expand her business and have better earnings in the future.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, chips, biscuits, candles, noodles, canned goods, coffee, powdered milk, powdered juice, toiletries, kitchen wares and school materials

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a 34-year-old married woman from San Miguel, Bohol. She and her husband have been engaged in the rice farming business for ten years. They work hard for their family. They have four children to nurture, ages 16, 14, 8, and 2 years old.

Nenita is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy fertilizer and to pay laborers on their farm. In the future, she wishes to increase her earnings by doing other business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay laborers on their farm.

loans.name: Gift

texts.en:
Gift is a single man and he operates a retail business where he sells sugar, bread, flour, soap and other items. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in an area with potential and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low stock. 

He will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, rice and other items. His business goal is to have a supermarket within 5 years. This is his fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, flour, rice and other items

loans.name: Tobias

texts.en:
Tobias is a married man and has 8 children. He operates a retail business where he sells palm wine. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His primary customers are regular. 

He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of palm wine. His business goal is to have a bigger business within 5 years. 

This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of palm wine

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman with 3 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. Her primary customers are locals. 

She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah is a married man, and he has four children. He describes himself to be flexible. 

Jeremiah operates a poultry farm where he keeps chickens. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in a productive area and his primary customers are hotels. He describes his biggest business challenge to be poultry feed. 

Jeremiah will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy poultry feed. He hopes that in the future, he will be a supplier of eggs and chickens to big towns. 

This is Jeremiah's sixth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy poultry feed

loans.name: Nadee Group

texts.en:
Bounoieng understands the difference the water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families.  Bounoieng knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Bounoieng purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.    

Bounoieng is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Maylie

texts.en:
In a nutshell, Maylie is a mother, lover, dreamer and a doer of a goal.

44 years of age and at home in one of the dirty shanties in Malabon City, Maylie is situated to earn bread for her family through selling an assortment of low-cost biscuits in her neighborhood. Earning a little, it seems so hard for her to dig in with the realization of her dream to have a better life. However, she continued working even in the wee hours of the day.

In 2009 she found CCT to light her way. CCT enabled her to unleash her full potential in entrepreneurship and introduced her to the living hope found in God's word. Since she joined the hub, she was inspired by the stories she hears from a weekly fellowship of her co-members who conquered poverty from the slums.

Now she knows that one day, she can be what she wants to be if she will just pursue and believe.

Trusting her wits in trade, she now has the guts to simultaneously operate a rug-making business, wallet-selling and operating a food stall as well in the market place in Potrero, Malabon.

Now she comes to you because she wants to have additional capital for these trades she's managing. She will use the loan for buying biscuits, merchandise products, wallets and additional cloths to recycle as rugs.

Your small drop can fill the PHP 15,000 loan that Maylie needs. She hopes that you would also share with her what you are blessed with.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, merchandise products, wallets and additional cloths to recycle as rugs.

loans.name: Phaynamern Group

texts.en:
Somvanhsee’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.

Somvanhsee and her group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable. Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits.

Somvanhsee and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for two years; within this two years filter users, like Somvanhsee’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Phathang Group

texts.en:
Phommaiit understands the difference the water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families. Phommaiit knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption, and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.

The water filter Phommaiit purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.

Phommaiit is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule, and the filter is guaranteed for two years – so he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so he can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Kissanga Group

texts.en:
Isaka, who is in his mid 20s, is married with one small child.  He has been running a general store for four years now.  He works from 08am to 09pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Isaka's 6th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to increase on the shop inventory and has paid back all his loan success.  He is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support.  He used the profit to take care of his family, to repay loan and covered household expenses.  He reams of owning a big and wholesale shop. 

Isaka will share this loan with his loan group  Kissanga which consists of five members who will hold each other accountable for paying bank the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out of stock items in the shop inventory.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a married woman. She has seven children. She describes herself to be honest.

She operates a food stall where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for one year.

She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy stock of ingredients for preparing food. She will use the anticipated profits to open another business.

loans.use: to buy stock of ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Rékifatou

texts.fr: Mère d’un enfant, Rékifatou est une veuve âgée de 47 ans. Rékifatou habite à Adidogomé et est une commerçante d’oignons et de gingembres. Rékifatou achète ses provisions au marché trois fois par mois et les revendent de porte en porte dans son quartier. Avec le gain qui en résultera, Rékifatou désire ce prêt pour commander des oignons et gingembres afin   de soutenir l’éducation scolaire de son enfant.
texts.en:
Rékifatou, age 47, is a widow with one child. She lives in Adidogomé and she is a reseller of onions and ginger. She buys her stock at the market three times per month, and she conducts her sales as an itinerant vendor around her neighborhood. 

Rékifatou will use this loan to stock up on onions and ginger, and she plans to use her profits to support her child’s academic education.

loans.use: to buy one bag of onions and 2 bags of ginger.

loans.name: Seynabou

texts.fr:
Ce  membre fait partie du banc villageois qui a été crée le 28 mai 2011. Il regroupe des femmes du même quartier qui ont de bonnes relations qui s'activent dans le commerce.
SEYNABOU  sur  la photo est âgée de 69 ans. Elle est veuve et mère 1 enfant, elle en a aussi un autre en charge.
Avec le prêt reçu, elle va des draps et des pagnes pour les revendre. Elle achète 10 draps en basin pour 15 000 FCFA l'unité qu'elle revend à 17500 FCFA l'un. Elle achète aussi 10 draps tricotés à 7500 FCFA l'un et le cède à 10 000 FCFA. Elle achète également des pagnes en simple et en paire, pour les pagnes simples elle en achète 20 à 1500 FCFA l'un, et pour les pagnes en paire, elle achète 20 paires la paire à 2500 FCFA.Elle paye 10 000 FCFA pour le transport des marchandises. Avec le reste elle va encore se ravitailler en pagnes quand son stock sera épuisé.  
les bénéfices  serviront à entretenir sa famille notamment ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group member is a part of a "banc villageois" (village borrowing group) which was created on May 28, 2011. It unites women from the same district who have good relations and who work at small-scale retailing.

Seynabou, the woman in the photo, is 69 years old. She is a widow and the mother of one child. She is also responsible for another child. With the loan, she is going to buy sheets and lengths of African print cloth for resale. She will buy 10 sheets made of damask for 15,000 F CFA each to be resold at 17,500 CFA each. She will also buy 10 knit sheets for 7,500 F CFA each to be sold at 10,000 F CFA. She will also buy lengths of cloth, some plain and some paired. She plans to buy 20 plain ones at 1500 F CFA each, and she will also buy 20 paired ones at 2,500 F CFA each. She will pay 10,000 F CFA to transport this merchandise. With any remainder she plans to restock when her inventory of African cloth is all gone.

The profits will be used to support her family, especially the children.

loans.use: to buy sheets and brightly colored African print cloth for resale

loans.name: For A Better Life - N10T2Thvận Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Dung is 36 years old and married with two children. She has worked in agriculture, raising pigs for six years.

Dung lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in a village; moreover, the market need is low in this region. She has no collateral, so can't get a loan from other banks or credit institutions. The main hardship that Dung faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in the future.

This is Dung’s first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She is the group leader of the "For a Better Life - N10T2ThVận" group, which consists of four members.

With her business profit, Dung hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Nalor Group

texts.en:
Mia is excited the filter was available on an affordable payment plan. Mia and his group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies. Charcoal, firewood, and even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years.

The water filter Mia and his group purchased is guaranteed for two years, but is known to function for up to five years. Mia and his group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And, after totaling up the costs, Mia and his group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so he can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
In the Philippines, sari-sari stores are everywhere. Sari-sari (a term used for variety) stores sell different kinds of products such as biscuits, candies, canned goods, noodles, and products used for personal hygiene and the like, which are involved in every individual’s daily living. This is considered as one of the most common businesses built by ordinary people, since it provides commodities for people.

With this fact, Josephine was enticed to get in touch with this kind of craft. She is 52 years old, married to Benjamin, a foreman and a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. By now, they are working with determination to pursue the needs of their family. The income they get from the store helps them in their daily expenditures.

However, what profits they get from the business are sometimes insufficient. It is because at times, she finds it hard to maintain supplies of various products due to financial incapability. This is why she is requesting a PHP 35,000 loan that she will use to buy additional products for her inventory. With more products displayed in her store, she can ably have a greater increase in her income.

In due time, she hopes that she can grow in progress and that her business will have a boost in sales. Through this, she can earn and save money for a house someday if God will allow.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise products for her inventory.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr: Jeanne est une femme divorcée  âgée de 25 ans. Jeanne est une revendeuse de maïs et de charbon de bois habitant à Adidogomé. Jeanne est une grossiste qui achète ses marchandises au marché  et les livrent à ses clientes. En vue de réaliser un maximum de bénéfice, Jeanne sollicite ce micro finance pour commander des sacs de charbons de bois afin de répondre aux besoins de ses clients
texts.en:
Jeanne is a divorced woman aged 25. She buys and resells maize and charcoal, and she lives in Adidogomé. Jeanne is a wholesaler who buys her merchandise at the market and delivers it to her clients.

So as to make the maximum profit, Jeanne is requesting this small loan to order some sacks of charcoal and meet the needs of her clients.

loans.use: to buy 15 sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Damaris Sabrina

texts.es:
Damaris, de 34 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, está acompañada y su pareja es empleado en una empresa como motorista, juntos tienen 2 hijas que son las únicas personas que dependen económicamente de ella.

Damaris, tiene una tienda desde hace 2 años y decidió dedicarse a este negocio para ayudarle a su pareja con los gastos del hogar, también realiza ventas de antojitos y vende pupusas por las tardes después de salir de trabajar en las fincas de café, mientras ella está trabajando sus hijas le ayudan con el negocio.

El préstamo sera utilizado para comprar artículos para la tienda como granos básicos, lácteos, bebidas, etc. esto le permitirá mejorar su negocio y así obtener mejores ganancias para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Damaris, sueña con hacer crecer su negocio y ver a sus hijas convertidas en profesionales algún día, este sueño lo lograra con el préstamo ya que obtendrá mas ganancias para ampliar su negocio y cumplir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Damaris is 34 years old and studied up to Grade 3. She is in a realtionship and her partner is employed by a company as a driver. Together they have two children who are the only people who are economically dependent on them.

Damaris has had a store for two years and decided to work in this business to help her partner with the household expenses. She also sells snacks and sells pupusas in the afternoons when people get out of work from the coffee farms. While she is working her children help her with the business.

The loan will be used to buy items for her store like basic grains, dairy products, drinks, etc. This will allow her to improve her business and thus obtain greater profits to improve the family's quality of living.

Damaris dreams of expanding her business and seeing her children become professionals some day. She can achieve this dream with this loan as she will obtain more profits to expand her business and fulfill her dreams.

loans.use: to buy items for her store like basic grains, dairy products, drinks, etc.

loans.name: See

texts.en: See’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling. See is excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable. Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits. See and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for two years. Within this two-year period, filter users like See’s family identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Namhom Group

texts.en:
Bountong understands the difference the water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families. Bountong knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.

The water filter Bountong purchased will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.

Bountong is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for two years – so she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Love My Angels - N5T4Thvận Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thu is 37 years old and she is married with two children. Thu lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

She has had a retail business selling metals for four years.Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. Her income is low, so her family is drinking unsanitary water. She has no collateral so she can't get a loan from other banks or credit institutions.

The main hardship that Thu faces is a lack of capital. In 2010, Thu joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Thu has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

She is requesting a loan to purchase waste materials to sell (to factories that can reproduce).

She is the group leader of the "Love my angels - N5T4ThVận", which consists of four members.
Thu hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more waste materials to sell.

loans.name: Thêu

texts.en:
Mrs Thêu is 33 years old and she is married. She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for five years. Thêu lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is her family does not have a latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

This is Thêu's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

With her business profit, Thêu hopes to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business. She also hopes for her business to do well and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Tujitume Group

texts.en:
Sickystus, who is in his early 40s, is married with two children, one of whom is in school with the other still a small child.  

Sickystus has been selling charcoal for three years now.  He works from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Sickystus' second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loan to increase his charcoal stock and has paid back his loan successfully.  He used the profits to pay for his child's school fees as well as his loan payments and household expenses.  

He will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal to resell.  He dreams of making his business big and of building his own house.  

Sickystus will share this loan with his loan group Tujitume, which has four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Hồng

texts.en:
Hồng is 40 years old, and she is married.  She has worked in agriculture, raising poultry, for 7 years, and she lives in the Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in the Thanh Hoa province.  Her family is a low-income household in the village (moreover, the market need is low in this region). 

Her family has a two-hole latrine, and she is concerned that the latrine is not hygienic.  She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet.

This is Hồng's first loan with the Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.  With her profits, Hồng hopes that her business does well, that her family is healthy and happy, and that she is able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Mùi

texts.en:
Mrs Mùi is 24 years old and she is married.
 
She has had a retail business selling porcelain products (bowls, plates, cups, etc.) for five years.
Mùi lives in Hau Loc district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover the market need is low in this region. 
One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipments to build toilet.
This is Mùi's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
With her business profit, Mùi hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipments to build a toilet.

loans.name: Ma. Petronila

texts.en: Ma. Petronila patiently sews different uniforms as a source of income. She is 55 years old and a a widower with five children. They live at Enrile. She used her skill in sewing office and school uniforms as income. She wants to continue offering good output and services which is why she is asking for additional capital of P10,000 to invest in improving her business. She will buy fabrics, thread and cloth use in sewing. She will save additional revenue for her family's emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread and cloth used in sewing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, biscuits and soft drinks to sell in her store.

loans.name: Nyevu

texts.en: Njeru is a Kiva borrower. She has 6 children. She describes herself to be energetic. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a market place and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the dry season, which affects the feed supply. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy a freezer for storing milk. She hopes that in the future, she will have better living conditions. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a freezer for storing milk

loans.name: Santa

texts.en: Santa is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be trustworthy. She operates a food stall where she cooks food to sell. Her business is located in a marketable place and her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food to sell. She hopes that in the future, she will have a bigger business.

loans.use: buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food to sell.

loans.name: Ovilla

texts.en:
Ovilla is thankful for the continuous loan she receives to finance her food stall business. She has faithfully paid her obligations. She owes to you her success and sustenance of her business.

She trust that she can still avail of a Php 19000 loan to buy several kilos of meat for her barbecue business and different kinds of fruits, milk, shaved ice to make her "halu-halo" to sell at her stall. Her food stall means a lot to her for this is her additional source of income to provide for the school needs of her children. She praises God for your good heart as you continue to support her livelihood. 

Ovilla's dream is to see all her children finish college and become professionals someday. She prays for their daily protection especially for her husband who is a jeepney driver. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for fresh meat (pork, chicken) in order to make and sell barbecue; and to buy sweetened fruits and beans to make and sell "halu-halo"

loans.name: Sumaya Girls School

texts.en: Greetings from Uganda! This is Yusuf. He is the head teacher of Sumaya Girls School, a girls school with 540 students in the rural area of Nsangi in Wakiso. Sumaya Girls School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistently clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Thus, installing a water filtration system will save the school money in the long-term, as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 liter tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. Sumaya Girls School will repay its loan from its school fees, which it collects each term. Yusuf ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases and increasing the number of students that come to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Bertha Luz

texts.es:
Bertha, de 28 años de edad, está acompañada, es madre de dos hijos, estudio hasta séptimo grado, su compañero de vida es propietario de una discomovil y sus pequeñas hijas están estudiando.
	
Bertha, vende papas fritas, licuados, entre otros alimentos y este trabajo lo realiza desde hace 5 años. 

El crédito lo utilizara para comprar tecles para montar la estructura de la discomovil.

Bertha, sueña con comprar un terreno para construir una vivienda digna para sus hijas y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Bertha is 28 years old. She is in a realtionship and the mother of two children. She studied up to Grade 7. Her life companion is the owner of a discomobile (mobile outdoor sound system) and her young daughters are studying.

Bertha sells french fries and blender drinks amongst other foods and she has been doing this for 5 years.

The loan will be used to buy winches to mount on the body of the discomobile. Bertha dreams of buying land to buy a dignified house for her daughters and improve their quality of living.

loans.use: to buy winches to mount on the body of the discomobile.

loans.name: Hùng

texts.en:
Mr Hùng is 46 years old and he is married. He lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. He has worked in agriculture raising poultry for 15 years. His family is a low-income household in the village, moreover the market need is low in this region. .

His family has a two-hole latrine. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns him is the lartrine is not hygienic.

He is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

This is Hùng's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

With his business profit, Hùng hopes to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for his business. He also hopes for his business to do well and for his family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Nhị

texts.en:
Nhị is 38 years old, and she is married. She has worked in agriculture, raising poultry, for 4 years. Nhị lives in the Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in the Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village (moreover, the market need is low in this region).
 
One of the most critical challenges that concerns her is that her latrine is not hygienic. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet.

In 2015, Nhị joined the Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business, and she has successfully repaid 3 loans. With her business profits, Nhị hopes that her business does well, that she makes enough money to provide for her kids, and that she is able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Thúy

texts.en:
Mrs Thúy is 31 years old and she is married.
 
She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for seven years.
Thúy lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover the market need is low in this region. .
One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is that her family does not have a latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipments to build toilet.
This is Thúy's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.
With her business profit, Thúy hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipments to build a toilet.

loans.name: Diệp

texts.en:
Mrs Diệp is 51 years old and she is married.
 
She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for more than 10 years.
Diệp lives in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover this job is unstable. 
Her family has a latrine but it is not hygienic.
One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is the latrine is not hygienic. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipments to build a toilet.
This is Diệp's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.
With her business profit, Diệp hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipments to build a toilet.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en: Kadzo is a married woman with nine children. She describes herself as trustworthy. Kadzo operates a retail business where she sells makuti (palm tree leaves for roof thatching). Her business is located in a marketable place, and her primary customers are regular customers. She cites insufficient capital as her biggest business challenge. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of makuti. She hopes that, in the future, she will have a bigger business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of makuti (palm tree leaves for roof thatching).

loans.name: Lita

texts.en: Lita is 58 years old, married and lives at Enrile with her family. She is involved in the food production business. She cooks and sells "bibingka"(rice cake). She had been in her business for over five years. She wants to continue cooking delicious bibingka so she can attract more customers. So she is asking for a loan of P28,000 to buy margarine, sugar, coconut and glutinous rice to cook and sell. Good packaging, friendly services and delicious food will help her generate more profits and achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to buy margarine, sugar, coconut and glutinous rice to cook and sell.

loans.name: Ronaldo

texts.en:
Ronaldo has successfully paid the previous loan which he used to pay for slightly used clothes for sale. Through his perseverance and hard work he has rolled his earnings from his "ukay-ukay" business to putting up his own line of RTW (ready-to-wear). He appears in his photo with his used clothes business.

He trusts that you could still lend him a Php 15,000 loan to pay for fabrics, thread, and other materials to make ready-to-wear clothes. He will be grateful for your positive response since this will help grow his new business. This additional business will indeed help meet the growing needs of his family especially now that he has one child who is already in the elementary Level. 

Ronaldo's dream is to grow his RTW business so he could send his children to college. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week and also to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God he studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabrics and other materials needed in his ready-to-wear business.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is an old man of 50 years old living with his children. 
He is involved in the cattle rearing/fattening from his home area, a business he had done since his early years.
He has been in the above activity for over 35 years and alongside that he is involved in the cattle trade which also majorly contributes to his sources of income.
He says his customers are basically people from his home area and traders.
According to him, his biggest challenge is lack of enough capital to boost his businesses and bad weather.
He is described as a hard working man who has been able to achieve everything from his strength. Finally he appeals to Ugafode to avail him with much more money to boost his businesses.
He will use the loan to buy cattle for trade.

loans.use: to boost his cattle fattening & trade business.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a married man living with his wife and four children,three of whom attend school.
He is involved in the produce trade, which he has done for five years.
Alongside the produce trade, he is also involved in farming, especially coffee and beans.
According to him through the above businesses he has been able to take care of his family and children. 
He has acquired a facility to boost his produce business by stocking larger stocks of beans and coffee, which are now in harvest season. He will use the loan to purchase more beans for resale.
According to him, his biggest challenge is unfavorable weather changes such as droughts and floods.
He is described as a hard working man.

loans.use: to buy more beans for resale

loans.name: Nansuse Bright School

texts.en: Greetings from Uganda! This is Justine. She is the Head teacher of Nansuse Bright School, a mixed school in the urban area of Gayaza in Kampala with 250 students. Nansuse Bright School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 liter tank and pump, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. Nansuse Bright  School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Justine ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Hà

texts.en:
Hà operates a food stall/restaurant selling vegetables. She is 36 years old and she is married with three children.
Hà lives in Bim Son town, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

She has been involved in this business for six years. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a toilet.

In 2015, Hà joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Hà has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

She wishes her family will be healthy and happy, her business running well and her children has a sanitary environment to grow up in.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipments to build a toilet.

loans.name: Khang

texts.en:
Mrs Khang is 45 years old and she is married. She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for more than 10 years. Khang lives in Nong Cong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover the market need is low in this region. 
 
One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipments to build a toilet.

In 2015, Khang joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Khang has successfully repaid seven loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

With her business profit, Khang hopes for her business to do well, to buy land of her own, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipments to build a toilet.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a married woman. She has three children. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are regular. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. Her business goal is to have a bigger business within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is glad that she was repeatedly granted loans to support her tailoring business. She is thankful for the loans, which helped continue her sewing and thus helped cover their daily household and personal needs.

She hopes that she can again avail of a loan of Php 35000 loan to buy more fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed in her business. She has to meet the orders of her regular clients, not only from schools and offices, but from individuals who prefer to wear made to order clothes. She praises God for your good heart in extending support for her livelihood.

Ruth hopes to acquire another sewing machine to increase her business. She prays for abundance in all areas of her life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, cloth, thread, needles and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Ilia

texts.en:
Ilia want to buy a milk cow with the loan he is requesting from you. 
Ilia is a 58 year-old villager and a married father of two, 18 and 15 years old. His family lives in the rural southeastern part of the country. For the past 25 years, his chosen activity to earn an income for his family has been agriculture/livestock; he’s been pursuing this with his wife. Another income for their family has been the $92 monthly retirement pension of his mother who lives with them. They are very poor and your financial help will be greatly appreciated by them, according to Ilia. Currently they have 8 sheep and 2 milk cows and they plant 8 dynym of land with wheat, 8 with corn and 8 with vetch.

loans.use: to add another dairy cow as rural activity is the only source of income for his family

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a married man aged 34 years and living with his four children, two of whom are attending school.
He mostly deals in the shoe trade and has a big store of shoes within the town center. Alongside the above mentioned businesses he earns some income from agriculture and rentals, This helps to sustain his business and also meets his family financial obligations. 
He has been in the above activities since 2006. He started because it is profitable and he has acquired this loan facility in order to boost his shoe trade business by buying more stocks of shoes to resell.
He supplies both retailers and whole sale buyers.
He is described as a hard working man who has been able to achieve everything through hard work.

loans.use: To buy stocks of used shoes to resell

loans.name: Sanan

texts.en:
Sanan is 34 years old and married. His wife doesn’t work. He has two children. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his family in the Bilasuvar region. 

Sanan cannot get a higher education because his family's income is low. He had chosen to become a merchant to support his family. Over the years Senan improved himself in his job and it has been more than 28 years since he started working. He is a very diligent, disciplined and organized person. 

Senan needs to earn a good income due to the family's needs. Besides this, he is planning to expand his business and improve his family's life conditions. In order to expand his business, he will buy new inventory and have more variety of clothings in his shop.

Therefore we need Kiva lenders to support Sanan.

loans.use: to buy new inventory and have more variety of clothings in his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer and merchandise like shampoo, noodles, bath soap, detergent, candies, insect repellent, canned goods and beverages

loans.name: Maria Nelza

texts.es:
María tiene 35 años de edad, madre con tres hijos vive en una zona rural del distrito de Santo tomás que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

MAría se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio; además de contar con una has. de maíz la cual cultiva y también optime ingresos . Cuenta con 10 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de lechones para su engorde y posterior venta así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto María espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
María is 35 years old and the mother of three children. She lives in a rural part of the district of Santo Tomás which is located in the province of Cutervo, Cajamarca region, in the North Andes of Peru. The inhabitants of this district work mainly in agriculture, raising livestock and commerce.

María works raising and selling pigs amongst others. Her business is located at her house. She also has one hectare of corn under cultivation and she gets premium prices. She has 10 years of experience in the business and has very good personal and work references in the area.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy a greater number of piglets to fatten and later sell as well as buying balanced feed for them. Doing this María hopes to offer a better product to her clients which would allow her to generate greater income and in the end improve her quality of living and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a greater number of piglets to fatten and later sell as well as buying balanced feed for them.

loans.name: Marzia

texts.en:
Marzia is 62 years old hard-working woman, from Marneuli district. She has husband, mother-in-law and daughter, who is employed and gets fixed salary 350 GEL. 

Marzia and her husband are engaged in poultry farming, in cultivation of potatoes, cucumbers and greens. They sell agricultural products at the local market and has great desire to make their business more profitable. 

Marzia requested a Credo loan for expanding of an agricultural business. Her loan request was approved in the frames of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions for the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

Marzia will buy a second-hand car and will trade with harvested products through the region, with the help of her husband and will get the chance to generate more income. 
As a result of the new business initiative, implemented with the assistance of Kiva, the income of the family will increase significantly. Marzia and her husband will be able to create better living conditions for their family.

loans.use: To purchase a car and expand their vegetable selling business

loans.name: Ludis María

texts.es: Ludis reside en compañía de sus hijos y su cónyuge en la ciudad de Cartagena de Indias y desde la comodidad de su hogar ofrece a sus vecinos helados y bolis de frutas, esta idea de negocio surge al querer aportar ingresos para su familia y poder continuar con sus quehaceres en el hogar.  Ella ha tenido éxito, diariamente llegan hasta su vivienda a solicitarle paletas, chococonos, galletas de helado, helados preparados con frutas y bolis de frutas, los cuales vende de contado a buenos precios.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en nuevas marcas de helados y así poder abastecer la demanda. Su meta a largo plazo es tener más congeladores para ofertar nuevos sabores y marcas de helados.
texts.en:
Ludis lives with her children and husband in the city of Cartagena de Indias. From the comfort of her home, she offers ice cream and fruit popsicles to her neighbors. The idea for this business came about because she wanted to earn income to support her family, yet still continue to manage her household duties. Ludis has been successful. Every day people come to her home and ask for popsicles, chocolate-covered ice cream cones, ice cream sandwiches, ice cream prepared with fruit, and fruit pops. She sells these products at a good price on a cash basis.

Ludis is currently applying for a Kiva loan, her first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will invest in new brands of ice cream products so that she can keep up with the demand. Her long-term goal is to have more freezers so that she can offer new flavors and brands of ice cream.

loans.use: to buy new brands of ice cream products in order to keep up with demand.

loans.name: Mi's Group

texts.en:
Mi’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Mi makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as teacher to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Napor Group

texts.en:
Liu’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Liu and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits.  

Liu and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like Liu’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 27 years old, married, and self-employed. He has a truck that he uses for cargo transportation in the village.

In order to increase his work and income, Mohammad needs to buy a water tank that will help him expand his business and increase his income through selling water to his villagers and nearby villages as an additional income business. He needs a YOUTH loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua in order to buy the tank and increase his work.

Support given to Mohammad will allow him to develop his work.

loans.use: to buy a water tank that will help him expand his business and increase his income through selling water to his villagers and nearby villages as an additional income business.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
La socia Patricia pertenece al banco comunal “Patrón de San Sebastián” de la ciudad del Cusco.
La socia Patricia sigue dedicándose a realizar diseños publicitarios, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia también sigue dedicándose a elaboración de tortas, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de azúcar, harina entre otros.
texts.en:
Patricia is a member of the Communal Bank “Patrón de San Sebastián”, which is in the city of Cusco. She continues to produce advertising designs. Patricia is grateful for the loan that has been issued and promises to complete her payments according to the established terms. She is a responsible and diligent individual.

Patricia also continues to make cakes. By working in this manner, she is able to help her family get ahead. She is requesting a loan in order to buy sugar, flour, and other supplies.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, and other supplies.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie is 48 years old, married and has 1 child to provide for. To earn a living and be able to help her husband, a driver, in providing for her family she engaged in banana production. She plants bananas and sells them to the market. She aims to increase her income because of the increasing price of our commodities nowadays. So she decided to borrowed funds to purchase fertilizer for the banana farm. In that way she can produce good quality bananas and can deliver more bananas to the market and that in turn will generate more income.

Jessie\s plan for the future is to save money from her business income to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for the banana farm.

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima is indeed grateful that she has repeatedly availed and repaid her loans, which helped sustain her transportation and food business. Although life has not been easy for her, she maintains a positive attitude and her faith in God drives her to persevere and be joyful in life. Her family has been her source of inspiration to continue to work and see her grandchildren grow.

She trusts that she can again access a 15000 Php loan to purchase several kilos of fruits and vegetables to sell. Zosima's only difficulty is to bear the scorching sun during summer and rains during rainy season as she peddles her fruits and veggies to different places. She continues to be patient to be able to serve the food needs of her community. 

Zosima hopes to acquire a vehicle to easily transport her fruits and veggies in her community. She prays that God will bless her and her family with abundance in all areas of their lives. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for bananas to sell as banana-cue and vegetables and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Bảy

texts.en:
Bảy is 50 years old, and she is married. She has worked in agriculture, raising poultry, for more than 10 years. Bảy lives in the Nong Cong district, a rural area in the Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village (moreover, the market need is low in this region). 
 
One of the most critical challenges that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet.

In 2015, Bảy joined the Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business, and she has successfully repaid 7 loans. With her business profits, Bảy hopes that her business does well, that she is able to buy land of her own, and that her family is healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Lack Of Capital - N11Thiệnna Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hoa is 44 years old and she is married. Hoa lives in Nong Cong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
 
She has worked in agriculture raising pigs for 4 years. Her job is hard and low-income because lack of capital to invest a larger model. Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover this job is unstable. 
 
In 2012, Hoa joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Hoa has repaid 4 loans successfully from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She is a reputable person in the community. 

Hoa and 3 other women establish the loan group "Lack of capital - N11ThiệnNa" to get loan and share experience to do business for a better life. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in future.
With her business profit, Hoa hopes for her business to do well, to maintain  a successful business, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in future

loans.name: St. Lucia Preparatory School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Charles. He is the head teacher of St. Lucia Preparatory School, a mixed school in the rural area of Mubende with 300 students.

St. Lucia Preparatory School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water, and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term, as the cost of firewood will be reduced.

The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450-litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. St. Lucia Preparatory School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term.

Charles hopes that having access to safe drinking water will ultimately improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases, as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos is 27 years old and has two young sons, who depend on him economically. He lives in his parents' house with his children. 
He works in a street market selling species, he owns the stand of the market in which he sells.  He inherited from his parents and has been working it 15 years

He is asking for a loan to buy and resell merchandise and if its possible to buy another stand.
He has repaid two previous loans and payed for both of them on time.

loans.use: to invest in new merchandise for his stall, to help support his sons

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Abahuje  Sub Group A

texts.en:
Abahuje A is a group led by Liberatha, who is 45 years old. The group name means “the same mission” in English. She is married with 5 children aged between 12 and 23 years.

Liberatha owns a shop and has been doing a business for the past 11 years. The group members sell different items and they have the same idea for changing their lives.

With the loan, Liberatha would like to buy more books, files and pens for selling. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standard of living and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more books, files and pens for selling

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina has been married for over 15 years. She and her husband have their own house but the house is made of adobe (a fragile material). 

Catalina makes cheese practically since she was a child and she is assisted by her husband.  She needs a loan to buy a milking cow because she needs to give some rest to her animals, as she wants them to produce good milk to make an excellent cheese.

She hopes you can help her as she and her husband work hard

loans.use: to buy a milking cow to be able to make more cheese

loans.name: Rafik

texts.en:
