Rafik, 41 years old, is a sales person at a grocery store. The store belongs to his father, and he has been working there for three years. Since he is a person with special needs, it is hard for him to find a job somewhere else.

Rafik needs to register his special needs designed car, and in order to do that, he needs a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua. This will also help him in facilitating his transportation so as to further develop his work so that he can search for more markets, increase his father’s business merchandise and start a partnership with him.

loans.use: to register his special needs designed car

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy assorted mats

loans.name: Abahuje Sub Group B

texts.en:
Abuhuje is a group led by Jeanne, who is 27 years old. The group name means “same mission” in English.

Jeanne is married with three children aged between 3 and 9 years. She sells foodstuffs and has been doing a business for the past five years.

The group members sell different items, and they have the same idea for changing their lives. With the loan, Jeanne would like to buy more cassava, bananas, and sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standard of living and pay for medical insurance.

loans.use: to buy more cassava, bananas, and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy boubous (wide robes), pants, dresses, shoes, undershirts, etc.

loans.name: Alketa

texts.en:
Alketa is 41 and has two children ages 15 and 13, and they live in a village in the southeastern part of the country. They are very poor.

Currently, she does not have any animals, thus her children lack the nutrition from dairy most of the time. " We have no money to buy milk. Our children eat no dairy products and I feel responsible for this. Up until two years ago, we were in a worse financial situation. We came to the same institution requesting a loan, but we had no income at all. There were some foreign charities that, thank God, gave us a hand to start our rural things. Now, we are a bit better, of course. We plant in six dynyms (one dynym is 1/10th of a hectare) of agricultural land potatoes, beans and wheat, and we sell these products to wholesale buyers. Starting a livestock activity would be detrimental to our living," said Alketa to the branch assistant who interviewed her.

Her husband works in a gas station for a monthly income of $200.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Purity

texts.en: Purity is a  Kiva borrower. She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables. She describes her challenge to be lack of water facilities. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy a water tank to store water for her home. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a water tank

loans.name: Joaquina

texts.en:
Joaquina took a loan with Kubofinanciero and payed for it on time.

Now she is asking for a new one in order to buy new merchandise and grow her business

loans.use: to stock up her business and attract more clients

loans.name: Nathongkhamor Group

texts.en:
Khammai understands the difference the water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families.  Khammai knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Khammai purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  

The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.    Khammai is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Nakang Group

texts.en:
Khamkeo’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Khamkeo and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits.  

Khamkeo and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like Khamkeo’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Lady Irene Junior School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Edith. She is the head teacher of Lady Irene Junior School, a mixed school in the rural area of Luwero with 500 students. Lady Irene Junior School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistently clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. 

The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank and pump, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. Lady Irene Junior School will repay the loan from its school fees, which are collected each term. Edith ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Comprar cerdos para la cría.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith is a married woman. She has 3 children. She operates a farm where she keeps cows. She describes her challenge to be lack of a storage facility. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy a water tank to store water for domestic use. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy a water tank to store water for domestic use

loans.name: Samson

texts.en: Samson is a married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself as determined. He operates a retail business where he sells cattle. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a busy place. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more cattle. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more cattle

loans.name: Willis

texts.en: Willis is married and has one child. He describes himself to be determined. Willis operates a farm where he grows vegetables. He will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy water pipes for irrigation. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy water pipes for irrigation

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is married and has two children. She describes herself to be honest. For the past 5 years, Caroline has operated a retail business selling fish. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. Caroline will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of fish. Her business goal is to have a big hotel within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish

loans.name: Jesca

texts.en: Jesca is a widowed woman with  4 children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a farm where she grows vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 10 years and her business is located in a busy area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy farm inputs. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy farm inputs

loans.name: Icyerekezo Sub Group

texts.en:
Icyerekezo is a group led by Assumpta, who is 37 years old. The group name means “Focus” in English.

Assumpta is married with five children aged between 7 and 19 years. She sells foodstuffs and has been doing this in a business for the past 6 years. The group members sell different items and they have the same idea for changing their lives.

With the loan, Assumpta would like to buy more cassava, banana and Irish potatoes for selling. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standard of living and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more cassava, banana and Irish potatoes for selling

loans.name: Clara Del Carmen

texts.es:
Clara siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una mujer activa y entusiasta; ella soñaba con tener un negocio propio que le generará buenos ingresos pero que no la apartara de su familia. Por ello, cuando se casó le propuso a su esposo iniciar una pulpería para aportar más dinero en su hogar; idea que su esposo secundo casi automáticamente y desde entonces ambos luchan por ampliarla poco a poco, incluso, en la actualidad es una pulpería muy sólida y rentable.   

Por esta razón, Clara solicita un financiamiento que le permita comprar granos básicos, frutas, verduras, golosinas, gaseosas, pan y demás productos que acostumbra vender en su pulpería. Cabe destacar, que ella planea anexar un espacio en su local para vender comida y asi generar jugosas ganancias.
texts.en:
Clara has always been known for being an active and enthusiastic woman. She dreamed of having her business in order to generate a good income, but she didn’t want to be away from her family. When she got married, Clara made a proposal to her husband that she open a store so that she could earn more money at home. Her husband agreed with the idea almost immediately. Since then, both of them have strived to expand the business a little bit at a time. At the moment, the store is very stable and profitable.

For this reason, Clara is requesting a loan so that she can buy basic grains, fruit, vegetables, snack foods, sodas, bread, and other products that are normally sold in her store. It should be noted that she plans to add more space to her shop so that she can sell food as a way of generating larger profits.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, fruit, vegetables, snack foods, sodas, bread, and other products.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 43 years old and lives in Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She has one child who is in elementary school. Erlinda is employed as a sewer in a garment factory in Cavite through the help of the CCT Covenant Community Service Cooperative.* 

As a sewer, Erlinda designs, makes, pieces together or adjusts and repairs clothes for customers, working as a member of the assembly line in a factory. Her primary duty is to cut, trim and stitch clothes or pieces of clothes together. She has been a dedicated and loyal worker in her twenty-one years in the garment factory. 

It has long been Erlinda's  dream to have her own house for her and her child's future. It is now only half completed and needs funds to fully finish it.  She is seeking your help to buy construction materials and completely build her house.  She thanks you in advance for your positive response to her request. Her child's welfare and safety is her top priority.

Erlinda meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work. CCT staff and volunteers conduct weekly fellowship meetings for the factory workers before their work routine to do Bible readings, prayer and discipleship sessions to encourage and inspire them to do their best in life. 

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, quality for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

loans.use: To pay for the construction of her house.

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
Pov’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Pov makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. 

Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: New Africa School

texts.en: Greetings from Uganda! This is James. He is the Head teacher of New Africa School, a mixed school in the rural area of Luwero with 500 students. New Africa School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 1000 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. New Africa School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. James ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students

loans.name: Ion

texts.en:
Ion is a farmer from Untesti village, Ungheni Region in Moldova. He is married and his wife Iulia, invalid helps him to develop their farm.

Ion raises pigs, cows, chickens, rabbits and cereals. He has about 2 hectares of land.
Very important for farm is a well because local water is not suitable for drinking and is very expensive.
Ion will use the loan to build a well. Thanks to this well,  he will grow vegetables at the house land and use the water for farm and family needs.

loans.use: to build a well to supply water to his farm

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.en:
Gulbahor is an honest woman. She was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1964 and is living in small town with her family. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a constructor and she works at the secondary school, as a supply manager. She already works two years there. But she has 32 years of experience of work. She is one of the trustee clients of IMON. 

She appealed to IMON one more time to get a loan to treat her son at a medical clinic. She hopes to be understood and supported.

loans.use: to treat her son at medical clinic

loans.name: Mengoi

texts.en:
Mengoi is a joyful woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1954. She is living far from city with her family. She is married and has four children. Her husband works at secondary school, where he is an accountant. She is a teacher and has 32 years of practice there. She is well known among friends and teachers. She also likes her job and students. 

She wants to get treatment at hospital and appealed to IMON asking financial support. She hopes to be supported and awaits Kiva lenders kindness.

loans.use: to get treatment at hospital

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 26 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica al cultivo de maiz y maicillo, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 5 años, comercializa sus prodcutos en los alrededores de la zona donde ella reside, la joven vive en casa propia con su madre, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y si seguir con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
The young adult whose face is pixelated in the photo because she 26 years old and lives in a high-risk area, works in the cultivation of corn and sorghum. She has been working in this activity for 5 years, and sells her products in the outskirts of the area where she lives. She lives in her own home along with her mother.

She is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, manure, pest control, etc., to continue with her work which brings her good profits.

loans.use: for the purchase of seeds, fertilizers, manure, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Aniceta

texts.en:
"I want to save enough for my child's medication," said Aniceta. Nanay (mother) Aniceta is 70 years old, residing in one of the busiest places in the Metro, Pasay City. She graduated from high school but unfortunately didn't get a degree because of the lesser opportunity to continue her studies during her time. She's not with her husband anymore and it's saddening to know that her child is currently sick. Faced with life's trials, she didn't drown herself with despair and hopelessness; instead, she found ways to re-establish herself from the ground up. 

One scheme Aniceta thought of to make money was through the house rental business. Proud to say, she has been handling this for almost 12 years and it has paved the way for her to meet CCT and became a member in 2002. Through her membership, she has become equipped to devise her full potential as a micro-entrepreneur. Now, she also operates an e-load business which gives her additional income and support. 

Since the house rental business is her main source of income, Aniceta has come to KIVA to ask for help to maintain her rental rooms. She needs PHP 15,000 to renovate and beautify the rooms to attract more lodgers. 

Steered with faith, Aniceta looks at the other side of the spectrum. She believes that, even though she was quite incapable of meeting the medication needs of her child, he will get well soon through the grace of the Almighty. Thank God her colleagues help her to improve this remained faith in their weekly meetings and fellowships, where they try to inspire each other through good news. 

Aniceta is hopeful that someday she will also have the chance to build more businesses. Aiming high, soaring high, yet footsteps remain on the ground - this is Aniceta, willing to change her life to also change lives.

loans.use: to renovate and beautify the rooms of her house rental business.

loans.name: Cinthia

texts.es: La señora Cinthia vive en Entre Ríos, Cochabamba, al igual que muchos de los habitantes de la zona ella migro hacia el trópico del valle Cochabambino, buscando un mejor futuro y por ello desde entonces trabajo de todo lo que pudo, inicialmente trabajo como empleada de hogar, luego como jornalera y otras labores similares dinero y comprar su propio lote agrícola donde actualmente vive y trabaja dedicándose a la producción de piña (ananá), en principio el manejo no requería de  mucha mano de obra y así mismo se realizaba un manejo más ecológico pero con el paso del tiempo los terrenos de la zona se fueron desgastando y cada vez requieren de mayor esfuerzo, por lo que la señora Cinthia solicita un préstamo en que permita mejorar los rendimientos de su producción lo cual mejorara sus ingresos y su condición de vida y en el futuro poder construir una casita más estable donde pueda vivir con mayor seguridad
texts.en:
Cinthia lives in Entre Ríos, Cochabamba. Like many inhabitants of the area, she migrated to the tropics of the Cochabamba Valley, in search of a better future. For that reason, since then she has been working all that she can. She first worked as a domestic employee, later as a laborer and in other similar work. She earned money to buy her own agricultural land, where she currently lives and works in pineapple production. 

In the beginning, this work didn't require a lot of labor, and on her own she achieved a more ecologically sound management. However, over time the land in the area was spent, and increasingly needed more labor to manage. For this reason, Cinthia is requesting a loan that will allow her to improve the efficiency of her production, which will improve her income and her living conditions. In the future, she will be able to build a more stable house where she can live with more security.

loans.use: for the purchase of supplies and the improvement of her production, which can be used to generate income to help with her quality of life.

loans.name: Nathalang Group

texts.en:
Phonthong is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.  Phonthong and his group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.  

The water filter Phonthong and his group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years.  Phonthong and his group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Phonthong and his group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en:
The Nyomo baa fee group will begin its 12th loan cycle with ID-Ghana as part of ID-Ghana loan system. It is made up of five members, and is been represented by Grace who is a member of this group. The members of the group run a variety of businesses, some of which include selling: bags of rice, oil, tin tomatoes, foodstuff, ornaments and bags.

The loan they take out will benefit small micro-businesses, where Grace is a member. She says that she joined ID-Ghana by the invitation of her aunt, who is a client of the institution. Currently, she has a business selling bags of rice, gallons oil and boxes of tinned tomatoes. She wants others to know that she learned this business from her mother 18 years ago.

The loan Grace will take out now is for increasing capital to purchase wholesale items, which she will acquire from the market in the city of Accra. Later, once completed, she will supply to her customers in Osu. This form of work allows Grace to generate resources to put back into her business.

When asked what she likes about ID-Ghana, Grace says she likes the health facilities and the training that the institution offers. 
They need a total amount of GHS 12,800 to inverts into their businesses to improve their family life and businesses

loans.use: To purchase wholesale 30 bags of rice, 17 gallons oil and 20 boxes of tined tomatoes, which she will acquire from the market in the city of Accra.

loans.name: Vann's Group

texts.en:
Vann’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Vann makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. 

Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Vean's Group

texts.en:
Vean’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Vean makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farmer to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Nadine

texts.en:
Nadine is a twenty two years old single lady, who has been working as a tutor since 2010 to make her living.
She is a hardworking lady, who puts so much effort to improve her living and provide the best education to her students.

Nadine is expanding her working zone, thus for this reason she is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, in order to  pay for her driving license and car registration fees, so that she will expand her tutoring services in nearby villages.

This loan will help her success in providing education where requested in an easy way.

loans.use: to pay for her driving license and car registration fees so that she will expand her tutoring services in nearby villages

loans.name: Poor Women Learn To Do Business -N2T5Đ.anh Group

texts.en:
Ms Ninh works in agriculture raising livestock . She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby livestock to raise and sell in future.

Ninh is 57 years old and she has 2 children. She is the group leader of the "Poor women learn to do business -N2T5Đ.Anh" solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. 

In 2012, Ninh joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Ninh has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.  She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Ninh faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Ninh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase more baby livestock to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with 2 children. She operates a retail business where she sells soap, flour, sugar and other items. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 15,000 loan to buy more stock of flour, sugar, soap and other items. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of flour, sugar, soap and other items

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a married woman with 6 children. She describes herself to be trustworthy. She operates a retail business where she sells soap, flour, sugar and other items. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be competition. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of flour, sugar, soap and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale shop within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of flour, sugar, soap and other items

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to restock the out of stock items in her mamalishe store.

loans.name: Lief

texts.en:
"It is hard for me when the washing machine malfunctions. I don't know how to wrap up when more clothes are needed to be washed. It's tongue-tying," says Lief. 

For the past 4 years, Lief has owned and operated a laundry shop in Araneta, Quezon City. Through the support of her husband, Noel, who is an overseas Filpino worker, she ably operates this business and provides for their two children's education. Surprisingly, with her abilities and skills, she has been able to expand and amplify her resources. Now, she already has three helpers who work with her in the shop. 

The laundry business has indeed helped Lief's family to cover their daily expenses. Every now and then, customers come to Lief to deliver bulk dirty clothes for washing and dry cleaning. Most of the time, customers go to laundry shops because they find no time for their own clothes due to heavy schedules and dragging deadlines. Since they can pay, it's an advantage and an opportunity, of course, to Lief. 

Having this business in her life is really a milestone for Lief. However, it becomes a rough road when situations like she mentioned above happen, which is why she has come to KIVA. Lief wants to acquire additional materials and equipment for the maintenance of the washing machines. She humbly requests a PHP 50,000 loan and hopes that you will consider this. Lief dreams to someday have more branches and prays that her children will finish their studies and have a good future ahead. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to maintain the washing machines for her laundry business.

loans.name: Khoonngern Group

texts.en:
Khamfong understands the difference the water filter can make for his family and for his group’s families.  Khamfong knows that local water sources require boiling before consumption and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources.  The water filter Khamfong purchased will increase his family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal or decreasing the time and cost foraging for firewood.  

The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.    Khamfong is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule and the filter is guaranteed for 2 years – so he and his group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.  Children in the photo are the children of parents or guardians that purchaed water filters.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Phakhong Group

texts.en:
Khamdeng is excited the filter was available on an affordable, payment plan.  Khamdeng and his group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over 2 years.  

The water filter Khamdeng and his group purchased is guaranteed for 2 years but is known to function for up to 5 years.  Khamdeng and his group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Khamdeng and his group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Rana

texts.en:
Rana is a 30-year-old married mother of three children. Five years ago, she started working as tailor from her house to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their children. She is a hard worker and ambitious lady who has professional skills in this domain and is well known among her region. 
Rana is working hard to develop her business and improve her family's living conditions. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay her children's school tuition fees. 
Rana hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and stay capable of providing her children with better life.

loans.use: to pay her children's school tuition fees

loans.name: Blancaazucena Regina

texts.es:
Blancaazucena tiene 23 años de edad, es soltera, vive con sus padres en una zona rural del distrito de Cayaltí que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como pollos, gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Cuenta con 2 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como gallinas, patos, pavos, pollos, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto Blancaazucena espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Blancaazucena is 23 years old and single. She lives with her parents in a rural area of the Cayaltí district, which is located in the Lambayeque region of the Chiclayo province, in the northern coastal area of Peru. The residents of this district primarily work in agriculture, livestock, and commerce.

She works in the breeding and sale of small animals such as chickens, hens, ducks, and turkeys, among others. Her business is located in her own home. She now has 2 years of experience in this business, and has many good personal and work references in the area.

The loan that she is requesting will be used for the purchase of a larger quantity of animals such as hens, ducks, turkeys, and chickens, among others, as well as purchase feed for them. With this, Blancaazucena hopes to offer a better product for her customers, which will allow her to generate more income and therefore increase the quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy more animals and also to buy feed for them.

loans.name: Jenny Margarita

texts.es: Jenny de 32 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de refrescos, aguas, gaseosas, jugos, antojitos, etc. se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 10 años y su negocio esta ubicado en la cancha municipal, ya que es un lugar muy concurrido por personas tiene muchos clientes, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas mercaderia, tambien mesas y sillas para poder tener un mejor lugar para sus clientes y asi obtener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Jenny is 32 years old and lives with her husband in a house of their own, she makes a living selling refreshments, water, sodas, juices, snacks, etc. She has been doing this for the past 10 years and her business is located near the municipal sports field. Due to the fact that this is a crowded place, she has a lot of clients. She is requesting a loan to purchase more merchandise as well as tables and chairs to be able to provide a better place for her clients and by doing so obtain better incomes.

loans.use: purchase more merchandise (refreshments, water, sodas, juices, snacks, etc.), as well as tables and chairs

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Ukay-ukay". That's what you call used clothes in the Philippines, which are still sold at a cheap price.

Elizabeth lives at Quezon City, Philippines. Today, she focuses on managing her "ukay-ukay" business. At times, it's hard for her to sustain her income through this trade, since customers barely come to buy second hand clothes, or if they buy, the income is still not as high as the price of brand new clothes. But she's really hopeful that she'll be successful with this.

Today, she asks for your helping hands for the continuation of her inventory. She would like to avail a loan worth PHP 28,000 that she will use in buying greater quantities of used clothes to sell. If she gains such, it would be an advantage, since people are more attracted when there are more displayed than the usual.

She really hopes that you can help her with this. She is doing this for her children's education and and for saving money to renovate their house. Her remaining hope now relies in you.

As of today, she's active in attending a weekly fellowship that enables her to draw strength and inspiration to push towards the goal through the word of God that she studies with her colleagues.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy quality used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Abizeranye Sub Group B

texts.en:
Alphonse is a group leader; aged 50 years.She is married with 5 children 7 and 23 years. The group is called ABIZERANYE means “THE TRUSTED” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for changing their better future. She sells Vegetables and has been running in a business for 1 year. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more ground nuts and cabbages for sale. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standards of living and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more cabbages and ground nuts for sale.

loans.name: Duterimbere Group

texts.en:
This group is called DUTERIMBERE, which means “develop themselves” in English. The members sell different products and wish to expand their businesses to improve their futures. 

Josepha, aged 38, is the group leader. She is married and has 4 children aged between 4 and 16 years. For the past 18 years, Josepha has been selling fish. She would like to use her portion of the loan to buy more fish to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and to make savings for a better future.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Ana Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia, de 37 años de edad, estudio hasta séptimo grado, está acompañada, es una mujer emprendedora, madre de tres hijos, junto a su compañero de vida luchan día a día por sacarlos adelantes.

Silvia, junto a su pareja administran el cafetin de una escuela, el cual les da una factible rentabilidad y les proporciona buenos ingresos, para poder sustentar su familia.

Silvia, necesita el crédito para comprar mercadería para el negocio golosinas, churros, gaseosas, entre otros productos muy solicitados por sus clientes.

Sus planes a futuro son poder seguir ayudando a sus hijos para que estudien, también sueña con tener una casa propia y tener una calidad de vida favorable para su familia.
texts.en:
Silvia, 37 years old, studied up to 7th grade and is in a relationship. She is a business woman and a mother of three. Together with her partner, they fight every day to get by.

Silvia and her partner administer a small snack shop at a school, which provides them with a viable profit and a good income in order to support their family.

Silvia needs this loan to buy merchandise for the business such as candy, churros, soda and other products that are popular among clients.

Her plans for the future are to continue helping her children so that they can study. She also dreams of having her own house and a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for the business such as sweets, churros, soda, among other products.

loans.name: Sreynea's Group

texts.en:
Sreynea’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Sreynea makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. 

Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Bhag

texts.en:
Bhag is 34 years old; she is a married woman. She has a business selling animals. She buys baby goats and calves at low prices, raises them and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate extra income. 

Bhag needs to improve her business to meet her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase more animals to increase her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and raise her income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales

loans.name: Manza

texts.en:
Manza , is 60 years old, married woman, runs a small boutique at home to provide for her family. She purchases cloth from the market at low prices, sews it and then is selling it to the people of her locality.  She always has a great product selection to offer, and she earns a good income that contributes to her family's well-being. 

For the improvement of her business, Manza  has requested a loan of 60000 PKR  to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors to meet customers’ demand consistently, to increase her net income for improving their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth and spools of thread in various colors to meet customers’ demand consistently to increase her net income for improving their standard of living

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is an artisan from Ghana who specializes in hand-carved wood masks. He would like to invest in a purchase of raw materials, including wood, beads, and metal plates.

Ali has been selling through NOVICA since 2012. This is his story:

"It is my curiosity that has guided me in learning this art and honing my skills. I got interested in wood carving when I was a child, when I used to visit my brother Salihu's workshop. I would go to his workshop when I returned from school and try my hands at sanding masks. When I completed junior high school, my parents could not further my education and so I joined Salihu at his workshop. I got paid for the work I did, which I saved to be able to buy my own tools. After 12 years of working with my brother I started to work on my own. I have taught other carvers, and currently have four carvers working with me. I love the art of mixing colors and fixing aluminum plates to design an item. My hope is to become successful and be able to assist several people who cannot further their education due to financial constraint."

"I thank you for helping to fund this microcredit, as it will allow me to prepare more carvings in time for the busy season. May Allah bless you all."

Use the link below to view Ali's hand-carved wood masks on the NOVICA site:
<a href="http://www.novica.com/kiva/8473">http://www.novica.com/kiva/8473

loans.use: to invest in a purchase of raw materials, including wood, beads, and metal plates

loans.name: Tum's Group

texts.en:
Tum’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Tum makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. 

Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Tulikotoka Group

texts.fr: Dans le temps passé, Hondwa cultivait le manioc, les arachides et le maïs. Persuadé par ses amis, il s'est converti en riziculteur depuis 2007. Avec ses huit ans d'expérience, cette activité constitue le poumon économique de sa famille. L'insuffisance de fonds limite ses actions. Si son étendue cultural s'agrandissait (2 ou 5 hectares), il pourra réaliser un gain important qui améliorerait et stabiliserait ses conditions de vie. Il constitue le groupe TULIKOTOKA avec sa mère Fitina.
texts.en:
In the past, Hondwa grew manioc, peanuts, and maize. He was persuaded by his friends to become a rice farmer in 2007. With his eight years of experience, this activity has become the economic wellspring of his family.

Insufficient funds limits his work. If the plot he cultivates grew (by two or five hectares) he would be able to make a big gain which would improve and stabilize his living conditions. He and his mother Fitina are part of the group called Tulikotoka.

loans.use: to do weeding and buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.en: Shahlo is a careful mother. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1989. She is living happily with her family in a small village near the lake. She is married and has a child. She is a tailor. She sews traditional beautiful dresses for women. She has regular clients every day. She rents a place to work and teaches students how to sew. She wants to open a fabric store for sewing. She is in the way of prosperous and development of her business. Her child is ill. She is devoted to her child and wishes to have a healthy one.  She is asking for financial support from KIva lenders to pay for her child’s treatment at a medical clinic. She awaits your compassion.

loans.use: to pay for her child’s treatment at a medical clinic.

loans.name: Sayhuna

texts.en:
Sayhuna is a cheerful girl and was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1994. She is living in a beautiful and ancient place with her family. She is single and lives with parents. She is third year student at university. She is getting higher education degree of foreign languages specialist. She likes her major and wishes to graduate with excellence. 

She wants to be a teacher of English. She appealed to IMON to get a loan to pay her tuition fee of studies. She wishes to be supported and awaits KIVA lenders compassion.

loans.use: to pay her third year tuition fees for her studies in English

loans.name: Gulmurod

texts.en:
Gulmurod is a talented man. He was born in the northern part of Tajikistan into a family of workers. He lives happily in a big, beautiful town with his family. He is married and has one child. For more than five years he has kept and sold livestock. He is a farmer. He earns enough money to support his family. 

Gulmurod's son has become sick. He is a careful father and wants to have him treated at a medical clinic. He appealed to IMON and asked for a loan to pay for the treatment of his child at a medical clinic. He wishes to be understood and supported.

loans.use: to treat his child at a medical clinic

loans.name: Rini

texts.en:
Hello lenders! This is Rini, one of Ruma’s agents. She lives in Kediri, an Indonesian city located near the Brantas River in the province of East Java on the island of Java. She is happily married, and she and her husband have one cute child.

As a main source of income, together with her husband, Rini owns and manages a small stall that sells mobile airtime credits. Right now, she is trying another business opportunity: being an agent for 'Mapan,' Ruma's e-commerce product designed for lower income communities. 

By supporting this loan, you will be providing extra working capital for Rini as a 'Mapan' agent. Mapan enables customers to save up for major asset purchases little by little, by depositing change with agents like Rini. Their accumulated savings allow customers to purchase housewares, appliances, and/or school supplies for their children.

As a Mapan agent, Rini is responsible for processing deposits from customers into their Mapan accounts as well as receiving orders from customers who want to buy products listed in Ruma's Mapan catalog. When a customer orders, Rini will submit the order via SMS and, within 5-10 days, the product will be delivered to the customer. With Mapan, Rini believes that her community will be able to have access to higher quality products with lower prices. 

Rini is shown in the photo. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to help community members purchasing products through Ruma's e-commerce for lower income communities, called Mapan.

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en:
Shameem is 38 years old; she is a married woman and a mother of six children. She works hard to fulfill their needs, including food, healthcare, clothing, and education. With her husband (also shown in the photo) she has done agricultural work for some years. They grow different vegetables and fruits and sell them in the local market. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. 

In order to purchase packs of insecticides and pesticides and different types of seeds, Shameem is currently applying for a loan of 50,000 PKR. This will help her to grow more crops, which ultimately will help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase insecticides, pesticides and different types of seeds.

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma agents, Nina. Nina lives in Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She is happily married. She sells mobile airtime credits for her community. She decided to join Ruma because she wants to help her husband increasing their income, as well as give more contribution to her community. Nina feels happy because since she joined Ruma, she can get a lot of knowledge about how to become an entrepreneur.

As the business grows, Nina is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Nina improves her business and accordingly, her community who needs access to such services. Nina's goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve an e-commerce business to her community, Ruma's latest product called 'Mapan', so her community can have better products with lower prices. Nina is the one who is seen in the photo. She thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases for members of her local community.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, diapers, laundry soap, toiletries, fishing net and fishing rod.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fishing net and fishing rod

loans.name: Manzoor

texts.en:
Manzoor  is 45 years old, married woman. She has been doing a business of animal sale and purchase for many years. Manzoor is motivated to provide her family with the better standard of living. 

 Now, she has requested for a loan of 60000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount  to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. She desires of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz  is 42 years old, married woman and a mother of 3 children.  She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing services of tailoring in her community. She is doing it for many years. She is very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she requested for a loan of 40000 PKR  to buy stitching material such as spools of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons etc to sew more dresses on time. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy stitching material such as spools of threads in different colors and packs of zippers and buttons etc to sew more dresses on time

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is 35 years old, married woman. She is a vigorous lady, and for the past many years, has been running a cloth purchase and sale business. She buys cloth in various fabrics, in different colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

Now, she has requested for a loan of 35000 PKR  to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. Asia  expects a boost in her earnings with the loan and she plans to spend the part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business

loans.name: Vijana Ni Kazi Group

texts.fr: Depuis son bas-age, Shobo observait ses parents pratiquaient la culture du riz. Un constat positif est que cette activité leur a permis d'être scolarisé. Il a fait aussi autant devenu adulte. Il est soucieux d'améliorer sa production qui impactera sûrement et davantage à la vie sociale et économique de sa famille. Chef de file du groupe VIJANA NI KAZI, Shobo est distinctif sur photo par un arrosoir et un carnet rose qu'il tient dans chacune de main.
texts.en:
Since he was a boy, Shobo observed his parents growing rice. A positive observation is that this work permitted them to pay school fees. Once he was grown, Shobo did likewise.

He is careful to improve his production, which will surely have an impact on the socio-economic life of his family. As the leader of the group called Vijana Ni Kazi, Shobo is the one in the picture who is holding a watering can and a pink booklet in his other hand.

loans.use: to cover costs of weeding and phytosanitary products, buy fertilizer, and pay for labor at harvest time.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 33 years old and lives in Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. Married and has two children. She is employed as a sewer helper in a garment factory in Cavite for three years now through the help of the CCT Covenant Community Service Cooperative.* 

As a sewer helper she installs zippers, makes bias tapes, hems and makes pockets and bound buttonholes. She assist the main sewer as the need arises. Factory workers in the Phils.earn only minimum wage and most of the time their salaries are not enough to cover their daily needs. Low-income families in the developing world sadly do not have proper comfort rooms in their houses.

Analyn is humbly asking assistance to improve and fix their toilet for the health, sanitation and hygiene of her family. She is thanking you in advance for your positive response to her request. Her family is her top priority and would like to give her children dignity. 

Analyn meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work. CCT staff and volunteers conduct weekly fellowship meetings for the factory workers before their work routine to do Bible readings, prayer and discipleship sessions to encourage and inspire them to do their best in life. 

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, quality for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

loans.use: To improve her family's toilet.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Every second brings a fresh beginning. Every hour holds a new promise. Every night, dreams are brought with hope and every day is what a man chooses to make.

This is what inspires Nenita, a resident of Araneta, Quezon City, married to Roquilo and blessed with two children. From nothing, Nenita (or "Nits") now owns a sari-sari store and also regulates a house-rental business. But before she stood where she is right now, it took her a long road of sweat, tears, pressure, faith and persistence. But ceasing never occurred in Nenita's vocabulary, instead, without hesitation, she chose to continue pressing forward.

Year 1999. She started entering the trading field, purchasing and distributing commodities to people. Later on, she was personally established until doors opened her to CCT. It was in 2003 when she got her membership. Gradually, she learned techniques in business handling through the mentoring and fellowships done every Thursday. She also had the chance to know and get inspired by studying God's word.

Together with her husband, Nenita can barely earn more or less 20,000 PHP a month, not quite enough to sustain a family and keep their businesses running. Though really at some point it was hard to be always on the ball, due to delayed payments of customers who take credit and the inevitable huge expenses in sending a college student to school, the couple sees it eye to eye that they are willingly providing for their household needs.

Nits comes to KIva with a purpose. She had this idea of further expanding her sari-sari store business since she subtracts here most of their financial needs. She would like to access PHP 40,000 to buy additional grocery items to sell in her store. It would be an ample response if you allow her this chance.

You can help Nits walk closer to her dream to success.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Gabriel De Jesus

texts.es: Gabriel de 31 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre, el se dedica al cultivo de maiz desde hace varios, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, y mejorar el terreno para poder continuar con sus siembras y tener una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
Gabriel, 31 years old, lives in his own home with his mother. He has made a living from cultivating corn for many years. He sells his products in the areas surrounding the area where he lives. With what he makes from his sales, he manages to pay some of his home expenses. 

He is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest control, and to improve the land to be able to continue cultivating his land and to have a good harvest.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest control, and to improve the land.

loans.name: Arpik

texts.en:
Arpik already repaid her first Kiva loan, and she is very thankful for the support. She hopes for one more deal. This time she needs money for her son’s education costs. 

Arpik is a widow and lives in Vanadzor city of Lori region with her son. Her two daughters are already married, and they live with their families. Arpik works at a private workshop as a tailor. She also works at her home, taking orders to sew men's and women's clothes. She works hard to manage all of it, in order to provide her children with good living conditions. 

She is especially worried about expenses for her son, since he studies at the paid division of Vanadzor State Architectural University. In the future, he will be an architect. His education is very important, but the cost is difficult for Arpik. She asks for this loan in order to pay her son’s tuition fee for the coming semester. She will also use a small part of the loan for the purchase of some materials for her sewing activities at her house.

loans.use: to pay her son’s tuition and to purchase materials for sewing

loans.name: Abizeranye  Sub Group A

texts.en:
Lenia is a group leader; aged 50 years.She is married with 4 children aged between 12 and 24 years. The group is called ABIZERANYE means “THE TRUSTED” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for changing their better future. 

She sells foodstuffs and has been running in a business for 8 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sorghum for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Alina

texts.en:
Alina is 44 years old and she lives with her husband and son in Spitak city of Lori region. Alina has vocational education and a specialty in accounting. For many years she has worked as an accountant in a private company. Her family is engaged in farming and only after her work, which is very stressful, as she describes, she manages to help her husband and son about their farm.

Alina mentioned that she does her best to help her husband with her work income; however, farming brings in most of their livelihood. In the farm they have a cow, bulls, calves and a lot of chickens. So the sale of their farm products (milk, cheese, meat and eggs) makes up the biggest part of their family income.

Alina wants to surprise her husband and with this Kiva loan she wants, unexpectedly for her husband, to buy fodder for their farm cattle and also she will give this money to him for organizing hay mowing activities in their hay-field. She says she knows for sure that her husband will be nicely surprised and greatly satisfied with this financial support.

loans.use: to buy fodder for their farm cattle and also pay for organizing hay mowing activities in their hay-field.

loans.name: Houy's Group

texts.en:
Houy’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Houy makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. 

Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Doung's Group

texts.en:
Doung’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Doung makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as seller to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. 

Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 56-year-old married woman. The man shown in the photo is her son, who is a taxi driver by trade. He drives in the main city and makes enough income to cover all the expenses of his family.

Rukhsana's son wants to change the taxi's engine, as it is causing a lot of pollution and is consuming too much oil for its work. That is why Rukhsana has availed herself of a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR so her son can buy a new engine for the taxi to provide better service to his customers.

Rukhsana is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her son and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for the taxi so her son can provide better service to his customers.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
El grupo Divino Niño Jesús está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, luchando por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Eladia, quien es una persona humilde y sacrificada, que con mucho esfuerzo está saliendo adelante, y ayuda a su familia y a sus seres queridos. Se dedica al humilde trabajo de venta de gallinas y cerdos.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar gallinas y cerdos para la venta, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo, luchando por poder mejorar su vida y la de sus seres queridos. Agradece por la ayuda que recibe de poder crecer y mejorar.
texts.en:
The Divino Nino Jesus group is in their first cycle of the women’s committee, the members are in the poverty elimination program, fighting to improve their life conditions.
One of the members is Eladia.  She is a humble and sacrificed woman that with much effort is getting ahead, she helps her family and loved ones.  She works selling chickens and pigs.
She requests a loan to buy chickens and pigs, this way she can continue with her sales and improve her life and the life of her loved ones. She is grateful for the help she receives to be able to grow and improve.

loans.use: to buy chickens and pigs for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay a child's university registration fee

loans.name: Teresa Victoria

texts.es:
Teresa tiene 52 años, sin hijos a su cargo, vive en casa propia, en el distrito de Laguna, que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú, es una comunidad dedicada a la pesca, agricultura, ganaderia.

Teresa se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida como ceviche, papa rellena, humitas, refrescos etc, se dedica a este rubro hace 3 años, con muy buenas referencia laborales y personales, solicita el crédito para la compra de implementos e insumos para la prepación de los alimentos que vende, esto le generará mayor volumen de ventas, y por ende podrá mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Teresa is 52 years old, with no children to support. She lives in her own home in the district of Lagunas, which belongs to the province of Chiclayo, in the region of Lambayeque on the northern coast of Peru. Her community makes a living through fishing, agriculture, and livestock.
Teresa has made her living through the preparation and sale of food like ceviche, stuffed potatoes, humitas (a type of tamale), sodas, etc. for three years. She has very good work and personal references, and is applying for a loan in order to buy tools and supplies for the preparation of the foods she sells. This will increase sales volume, and thus her quality of life.

loans.use: purchase tools and supplies for the preparation of the foods she sells.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es:
Mario tiene 34 años de edad, vive con su menor hija de 14 años, en el distrito de Pucará que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente al comercio y crianza de ganado menor.

Mario se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de pasajeros en su vehículo (mototaxi), actividad que realiza desde hace más de 10 años, cuenta con experiencia en el sector y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo será utilizado para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado, con esto Mario espera ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le generará mayores ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Mario is 34 years old. He lives with his youngest daughter, who is 14 years old, in the Pucara District, which is situated in the Jaen Province, in the Cajamarca Region, in the northern mountains of Peru. Life in the community is peaceful. The inhabitants mainly make a living from commerce and raising small-animal livestock.

Mario makes a living from providing passenger transportation services in his vehicle (motorcycle taxi), an activity that he has carried out for more than 10 years. He has experience in the area and very good personal and work references in the zone. 

The loan will be used for repairs and maintenance of his vehicle since it is currently in a bad state. With this, Mario hopes to offer better service to his customers, which will generate a higher income for him and, as an end, he will improve his and his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for his vehicle's repairs and maintenance.

loans.name: Romila

texts.en:
Romila owns a laundry shop at Almanza Uno, Las Pinas City. With Romualdo on her side, she ably operates this business and provides for their four children. The laundry business has indeed helped Romila's family to cover their daily expenses.

Every now and then, customers come to her to deliver loads of dirty clothes for washing and dry cleaning. Most of the time, customers use laundry shops because they find no time to do their own laundry. Due to heavy schedules and dragging deadlines, it's justifiable to them to pay to have their laundry done instead of doing it themselves. Providing this time-saving convenience to her customers enables Romila to make a living. 

Romila opened this micro-business four years ago, and surprisingly, with her abilities and skills, she was able to quite expand and amplify her resources. Now, the laundry shop has become an ample relief in covering their daily expenses. 

She wants to further increase her profit, and this is her reason for coming to Kiva. She wants to acquire additional materials and equipment for the maintenance of their washing machines. She humbly requests a PHP 50,000 loan for this. She hopes that you would consider her request.

Her dream is to someday have more branches, and she prays for a sound and harmonious relationship with her family at all conditions. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to acquire additional materials and equipment for the maintenance of her washing machines.

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en:
Perveen  is a 36-year-old married woman with 4 children, whose  husband is shown in the photo.  They have sold fruit for many years. 

He tries to fulfill their basic necessities through his business. Perveen contacted Kashf Foundation and  Murabaha for 35,000 PKR  to purchase sacks of apples, mangoes, and guavas to increase her husband's sales, enlarge the business,  and improve profits.

loans.use: to purchase apples, mangoes, and guavas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new tires and spare parts.

loans.name: Umi

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Meet one of Ruma's agents, Umi. She lives in Rembang, a regency in the northeastern part of Central Java. She sells mobile airtime credits for her community. She decided to join Ruma because she wanted to try to become an entrepreneur, as well as give more contribution to her community. She feels happy because since she joined Ruma, she understands more about how to manage a business.

As the business grows, Umi needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva lenders. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her village community. Umi's goal in the near future is to serve an e-commerce business for lower communities, Ruma's latest product called 'Mapan', so later, her community can have access to better products with lower prices. Umi is the one who is seen in the photo. She is thankful for your kind support

loans.use: To purchase additional prepaid airtime credit for helping community members who need access to connect with their loved ones.

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela is 45 years old, married, and a mother of six children. She is a hardworking mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. She has been doing this for many years. She knows very well the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns enough to lead a decent life. 

To help her continue operating her business, she requested a Murabaha loan of 25,000 PKR to buy stitching materials, such as spools of thread in different colors, packs of zippers and buttons, etc. These materials will help her to sew more dresses on time. In addition to repaying the loan, she will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses. 

She is shown in the photo with her husband.

loans.use: to buy stitching materials, such as spools of thread in different colors, packs of zippers and buttons, etc.

loans.name: Juana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Juana, está casada y madre de hijos varones.

Juana, junto a su esposo se han dedicado a la agricultura, cuidado 20 cabezas de ganado, crían aves y cerdos para poder venderlos después.

Juana, solicita el crédito para preparar la tierra para la siembra de maíz especificamente comprara insumos agrícolas, como abono, pesticidas y herbicidas.

Juana, sueña con ayudar a sus hijos para que estudien, además desea obtener buenas cosechas y tener más ganado.
texts.en:
Juana is married and the mother of sons.

Juana and her husband have been raising 20 heads of livestock, birds, and pigs to sell later.

Juana is asking for a loan to prepare the land to plant corn and will buy farming supplies such as fertilizer, pesticides, and herbicides.

Juana dreams of helping her children who attend school and also wants to have a good harvest and have more livestock.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Suratna

texts.en:
Suratna is a Ruma agent who lives in Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She is happily married and has 1 cute child. She owns a stall that sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits for her community. She decided to join Ruma to try another business and contribute to her community. Suratna is pleased  since joining Ruma because she has leaned how to manage a business. 

She will use the loan to provide more mobile airtime credits to her customers. The loan will help Suratna to improve her business and provide customers with access to  services. Suratna plans to serve an e-commerce business to her customers.

Suratna  thanks you for your kind support

loans.use: to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community.

loans.name: Sokern's Group

texts.en:
Sokern’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Sokern makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as seller to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. 

Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is a 51-year-old married woman from the village of Maghlaki. She has a son, daughter-in-law, and husband.  Her husband is a driver. 

Nana breeds cows and  grows maize and vegetables. Nana wants to expand her agribusiness in order to meet the daily costs of her family. A loan of 6,000 GEL will be a great support to this hard-working woman and her family.  She will  purchase equipment and build a greenhouse. Nana will start planting greens and vegetables to sell at the local open market.

Nana and her family rely on the goodwill of the lenders and appreciate their support.  Nana will get the chance to make her work more productive and profitable.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse and expand her agribusiness.

loans.name: Andres Alfonso

texts.es:
Andres tiene 42 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su cónyuge e hijos en el distrito de Zaña que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. La vida en la comunidad es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente al comercio y crianza de ganado menor.

Andres se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de pasajeros en su vehículo (CAMIONETA STATION WAGON), actividad que realiza desde hace más de 4 años, cuenta con experiencia en el sector y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo será utilizado para realizar reparaciones y mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado, con esto Andres espera ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le generará mayores ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Andres is 42 years old. He is single but has a partner. He lives with his partner and children in the Zaña district in Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on Peru's northern coast. Life in this community is quiet. The locals mainly work in trade and raising small animals.

Andres makes a living providing transport services in his vehicle (a station wagon). He has been doing this work for more than four years, and has experience and very good personal and professional references.

Andres will use this loan to carry out repairs and maintenance on his vehicle, which is currently in bad condition. Andres hopes to offer better service to his customers, allowing him to earn a higher income and thus improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to carry out repairs and maintenance on his vehicle.

loans.name: Rotha's Group

texts.en:
Rotha’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Rotha makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.

 Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana  is a 46-year-old working woman who felt that she should support her husband to improve their financial situation. She started a business to sell  cloth. She believes she can earn  respect, make a better world for her children, and educate them. 

Farzana  is famous among her neighbors for her collections and has a good client base. She needs 35,000 PKR  to purchase good-quality cloth of different colors.  This will enable her to earn substantial profit and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality fabric.

loans.name: Candida Azucena

texts.es:
Azucena, estudio hasta noveno grado, es madre soltera y tiene un hijo de 6 años de edad, que está estudiando, con ella vive su mamá y su hijo.

Azucena, se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras (sandilla, plátanos, guineo, pipianes, tomates, entre otros.), ella se dedica a este negocio desde hace 9 años, este negocio lo aprendió de su mamá, debido a que ella siempre se dedico a este negocio y desde que estaba muy pequeña le ayudaba a vender; para llegar a donde está su negocio tiene que caminar aproximadamente 100 metros y trabaja un promedio de 8 horas diarias. 

Azucena, utilizara el préstamo para ampliar más su negocio, comprara más frutas y verduras como sandia, plátanos, guineo y pipianes; con esto abastecerá su negocio y tendrá satisfechos a sus clientes.

Azucena, sueña con tener su casa propia y brindarle apoyo a sus hijos para que estudien, para que en el futuro sea un hombre de bien, con valores morales y profesional.
texts.en:
Azucena has a ninth-grade education. She is a single mother and has one six-year-old son who is in school. Azucena lives with her mother and her son.
