Azucena makes a living selling fruits and vegetables (watermelon, plantains, chili, tomatoes, bananas and more). She has had this business for nine years. She learned the trade from her mother who always did this kind of work. From a young age Azucena helped her mother to sell her products.

Azucena has to walk 100 metres to arrive at her work. She works an average of eight hours per day.

Azucena will use this loan to expand her business; she will buy more fruits and vegetables, such as watermelon, plantains, bananas and chili. She will use these products to stock up her business and thus her customers will be satisfied.

Azucena dreams of owning her own house and of supporting her son so that he studies and, in the future, becomes a good person with professional and moral values.

loans.use: to expand her business; she will buy more fruits and vegetables, such as watermelon, plantains, bananas and chili.

loans.name: Gulraftor

texts.en:
Gulraftor is a generous woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan into a family of workers. She is a widow and has one child. She has 18 years of experience working at an international company. She is a janitor. She is one of the trustee clients at IMON.

Gulraftor is a kind, communicative, joyful and good person. For the last few years, she has been sick. Her blood sugar is higher than normal. She needs to get permanent treatment at a hospital.

She appealed to IMON, asking for financial support to pay a medical service for the permanent treatment. She wishes to be supported and awaits Kiva lenders' kindness.

loans.use: to pay a medical service for the permanent treatment she needs

loans.name: Klarissa Group

texts.en:
Hadia is the featured borrower for Klarissa Group. The group members  have always been neighbors and friends who work hard to develop their businesses and living.

Hadia is a 60-year-old widow with one child. She started an embroidery business  twenty years ago and makes beautiful items. She is very creative and has professional skills and a good reputation. She will use the loan to buy embroidery tools to facilitate her work and allow her to make special and unique items. 

Hadia is the first lady on the left, Rima is  sitting in the middle, and Remi is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to develop her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to restock the out of stock items in mamalishe store.

loans.name: Erick Jerson

texts.es:
Erick continúa con su negocio de joyería.  El préstamo que obtuvo lo invirtió en la compra de metales finos y algunas piedras preciosas. El pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque no tuvo ningún inconveniente. Su siguiente meta es abrir una tienda para la venta de joyas. Actualmente el continúa con su trabajo de joyería, en su taller ubicado en su casa, las joyas las vende su mamá de forma ambulante, “deseo abrir una tienda, ya no quiero que mi mama salga a la calle a vender…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las joyas son de buena calidad y se venden a ben precio, la desventaja es la falta de una máquina pulidora para mejorar la calidad del finalizado. Su sueño es abrir una joyería, el desea realizar la compra de una máquina pulidora para finalizar los trabajos con mayor calidad. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 12 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Erick solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina pulidora para abrir una joyería y que su madre deje de vender de vender ambulante mente.
texts.en:
Erick continues with his jewelry business. The loan that he received he invested in the purchase of fine metals and some precious stones. His payments were punctual because he had no inconveniences. His next goal is to open a store to sell the jewelry. 

Currently, he continues with his jewelry work in his workshop located in his home. His mother sells his jewelry on foot. “I want to open a store, I don’t want my mother to go out on the street to make sales...” he comments. The advantage of his business is that the jewelry is of good quality and it sells at a good price. The disadvantage is the lack of a polishing machine to improve the quality of the end product. 

His dream is to open a jewelry store. He hopes to be able to purchase a polishing machine to finish the jobs with better quality. This is the second sequence of loans with the institution in the 12 years that he has made a living from this activity.

It is because of these motives that Erick is requesting a loan for the purchase of a polishing machine to open a jewelry store so that his mother can stop selling on foot.

loans.use: to purchase a polishing machine to open a jewelry store so that his mother can stop selling on foot.

loans.name: Hameeda

texts.en:
Hameeda  is a 41-year-old divorced woman with  4 children. She is an energetic woman and has sold fabric for many years. She buys cloth in various fabrics, colors, and designs from the market at wholesale rates. She then sells them to her varied customer base.  She is able to earn enough through her business. 

She requests 35,000 PKR  to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. Hameeda  expects a boost in her earnings and she plans to improve the family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of fabric.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana  is a 38-year-old married woman with 3 children. She and her husband have raised animals for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life.

She is very motivated to provide her children with  a beautiful life, good education, food, and clothing. She has requested 30,000 PKR to purchase goats and calves to cater to her customers. 

She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase goats and calves.

loans.name: Efleda

texts.en:
Efleda owns and has run her variety store for two years. She is separated, but her situation pushes her to strive harder to earn a living.

She is determined to keep her business progressive and profitable. That's the reason why she's requesting additional capital of PHP 10,000. She will use this loan amount in purchasing coffee, detergent, soap, noodles, beverages and chips to sell.

Elfeda hopes and prays to keep her variety store profitable and to maintain her good customer service. She's hoping for approval of her requested loan.

loans.use: to purchase coffee, detergent, soap, noodles, beverages and chips to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Jad 7 Group

texts.en:
Amani is the featured borrower for jad 7 Group. She got joined with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Amani is a 30-year-old married mother of two children. She started working as a teacher to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their children. She is a hard worker and sacrificing mother who is trying her best to improve her family's living conditions. 

Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to renovate her house furniture to make it a healthier place for her children. Amani is the first lady on the right.  Ruhaifa is the second lady on the right, Jamila is the second lady on the left, and Maya is the first lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to renovate her house furniture to make it a healthier place for her children

loans.name: Juan Angel

texts.es: Don juan de 64 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hija, el se dedica al cultivo de cereales (maiz y frijol) y cafe desde hace mas de 20 años, vende sus prodcutos en los pueblos aledaños ya tiene clientes establecidos, gracias a su trabajo es como puede salir adelante, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, pesticidas, y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografia y asi poder continuar con su trabajo para tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Juan is 64, he lives in his own house with his wife and daughter. He farms grains like corn, beans and coffee. He has done this for more than 20 years. Juan sells his products in the nearby villages and has an established clientele.  With his farm work is how he is able to get ahead.  He is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, plague control products, pesticides and improve the land shown in the photo. This way he will be able to continue with his work and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, plague control products, pesticides and improve the land he farms.

loans.name: Manzura

texts.en:
Manzura is a capable woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1965. She is living in village with her family and is married and has one child. She is a farmer, who buys and sells livestock. Also she has land where plants agricultural products. She likes her activity and well knows her duty how to take care about livestock and plants. 

She wants to recover and requested from IMON and KIVA lenders a loan to treatment in the sanatorium. She needs to be healthy to continue her job. She wishes to be understood and supported.

loans.use: to have treatment in the sanatorium

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 33 years old and lives in Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. Married and has one child. He is employed as a sewer in a garment factory in Cavite for three years now through the help of the CCT Covenant Community Service Cooperative.* 

As a sewer he designs, makes, piece together or adjust and repair clothes for customers, he works as a member of the assembly line in a factory. His primary duty is to cut, trim and stitch clothes or pieces of clothes together. Filipino culture, families are closely knit and highly value education since its a means to improve their quality of life. Even if they have their own families they still help their siblings.

Richard would like to help one of his siblings who is still a student. Education in the Philippines is a great equalizer among the rich and the poor. In this regard Richard would like to request for a Php 10000 loan to assist in the tuition fee of his sibling. He trust your good heart for a positive response. 

Richard meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work. CCT staff and volunteers conduct weekly fellowship meetings for the factory workers before their work routine to do Bible readings, prayer and discipleship sessions to encourage and inspire them to do their best in life. 

* The Covenant Community Service Cooperative works to provide local communities with a labor force trained and equipped with the skills required for deployment in construction and site development projects. The cooperative prepares its members to acquire these skills, quality for jobs, cultivate savings consciousness, and provide decent shelter, food, and education for their families. Its core programs are the following: Professional Staff Services Program, Workers Guild Development Program, Enterprise Development Program, and Consultancy Services.

loans.use: To assist a sibling with tuition fees.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a 30-year-old married woman from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has two children and the oldest child is four years old while the youngest child two years old. Her partner is a fisherman while is engaged in sari-sari store business. Aside from sari-sari store, Analyn has another source of income. She also has a hog raising business. 

Analyn is requesting a loan to buy assorted goods such as mosquito repellent, toiletries, laundry soap, chips, biscuits, candies, powdered milk, coffee, sugar and powdered juice. Another part of her requested loan is to buy additional piglets (swine) and feeds. Analyn’s future plan is to expand her business in order to have a better earning for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy mosquito repellent, toiletries, laundry soap, chips, biscuits, candies, powdered milk, coffee, sugar, powdered juice, piglets (swine) and feeds.

loans.name: Maria Estela

texts.es:
Estela, logro estudiar hasta cuarto grado, está acompañada y su esposo es comerciante al igual que ella, tienen 3 hijos que viven con ellos y son menores de edad.

Estela, tiene un negocio de venta de leche desde hace 1 año, decidió dedicarse a esta actividad para ayudarle a su pareja con el ingreso del hogar, ya que anteriormente solo hacia los oficios domésticos de la casa; para esta actividad tienen que trasladarse 12 kilómetros y empezar de madrugada a recoger la leche para venderla por la mañana junto con su pareja.

El préstamo sera utilizado para comprar más leche y cinchos de madera para la elaboración de queso fresco, ya que tienen clientes que les han pedido este producto; esto mejorara sus ingresos y ayudara a mejorar un poco su calidad de vida.

Estela, sueña con hacer crecer su negocio y ayudar a que sus hijos terminen sus estudios para verlos convertidos en profesionales, esto lo podrá cumplir con las ganancias de su negocio, ya que estará ampliándolo y ayudando a que su familia pueda vivir mejor.
texts.en:
Estela, who studied up to the fourth grade, is married and her husband is a merchant just as she is. They have three children, all of whom are minors, and live with them.

Estela has had her business selling milk for a year now. She decided to dedicate herself to this activity in order to help her husband with the household income. Previously, she had only performed domestic chores in the house. For this milk business, she has to travel 12 kilometers and begin early in the morning collecting the milk to sell during that same morning with her husband.

This loan will be utilized to purchase more milk and wooden molds for making fresh cheese. They already have customers who have ordered their product. This will improve family income and also help improve somewhat their quality of life.

Estela dreams of making her business grow and helping their children complete their studies and seeing them become professionals. This they can achieve with the earnings of their business, since it is expanding and helping the family achieve a better life.

loans.use: buy more milk and wooden molds for making fresh cheese.

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Fozia is a 28 year old, married woman. Her husband(also shown in the photo) has been doing a business of selling fruits for many years. Through his work he manages to earn reasonable amount of money to support his family. She is a loving mother of 3 children. She is responsible for their food, health and clothing and is trying hard to fulfill their basic necessities. 

For the improvement for her husband's business she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of 45000 PKR  to purchase sacks of apples, mangoes and guavas to meet market demands consistently which ultimately enable them to cover their utility bills timely.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of apples, mangoes and guavas to meet market demands consistently which ultimately enable them to cover their utility bills timely.

loans.name: Saleema

texts.en:
Saleema  is a 53-year-old married woman who runs a small general store with her son. 

Her son has become popular in their community for providing good quality products and makes enough money to meet household expenses. She requests  30,000 PKR  to purchase grains, peas, flour, sugar, and tea to meet customers' needs and for generate additional income. She believes that  her son can earn more money in the future.

loans.use: to purchase grains, peas, flour, sugar, and tea.

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es:
Francisco es un hombre de 33 años de edad, soltero, un hombre pujante y perseverante que con sudor y compromiso monto un negocio de galpón de pollos para mantenerse a él y a los integrantes de su hogar.

Francisco a pesar de la competencia, de las perdidas por el clima, sigue adelante con el negocio que heredó de sus padres, es muy fiel a sus raíces y le gusta mucho desempeñar dicha actividad, en la cual ha rebuscado sus propios clientes, es activo y constante.

Ahora debido a los cambios climáticos tan repentinos y con la idea clara de expandirse, quiere solicitar un préstamo para comprar materiales para la construcción de 3 galpones y pollos para abastecerlos.

Este préstamo será un gran impulso para su actividad que espera llevarla a un nivel done pueda exportar a la ciudad.
texts.en:
Francisco is a 33-year-old man, single, a thriving and perseverant man who with sweat and commitment put together a chicken-coop business to support himself and the members of his household.

Despite competition and losses due to the climate, Francisco continues on with the business that he inherited from his parents. He is very loyal to his roots and he likes to perform this activity, for which he has searched for his own customers, is active and persevering. 

Now, owing to the climatic changes that are so sudden and with the clear idea of expanding, he wants to request a loan to purchase materials for the construction of three coops and chickens to fill them.

This loan will be a great boost for his activity, which he hopes to bring to a level where he is able to export to the city.

loans.use: to construct three chicken coops and chickens to fill them.

loans.name: Tha's Group

texts.en:
Tha’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Tha makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. 

Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Dor's Group

texts.en:
Dor’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Dor makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farmer to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. 

Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen  is a 41-year-old married woman who sells animals with the support of her husband.

She buys  goats and calves at low prices, raises them, and then sells them for  higher prices. She makes enough money  to contribute to the family's income. She also sells milk to generate additional income. She needs to improve her business to meet her household expenses. 

She contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for 20,000 PKR  to purchase more animals to increase her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. This loan will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase animals.

loans.name: Delma

texts.es: Delma tiene 26 años y vive en una comunidad de Copan, Honduras, tiene dos hijos y desde que su esposo emigro a otro país a buscar un mejor futuro para su familia, ella se dedica a los cultivos de café y maíz con la ayuda de su padre y su hermano, es una mujer muy emprendedora que lucha día a día por sacar adelante a sus hijos y brindarles las oportunidades que ella no ha tenido y que puedan llegar a  ser profesionales. Su mayor anhelo es poder construir una vivienda digna y con la ayuda de su esposo espera lograrlo muy pronto. Actualmente ella tiene muchas necesidades y una de estas  es que no cuenta con el servicio de energía eléctrica por lo cual está solicitando financiamiento a Soluz Honduras para la compra de un Sistema Solar que le permitirá brindar a sus hijos condiciones de vida más seguras y saludables.
texts.en:
Delma, 26, lives in a community in Copan, Honduras and she has two children. Since her husband emigrated to another country to seek a better future for their family, she has been working in coffee and corn crops with the help of her father and brother. She is a self-motivated woman who struggles each day to support her children and give them the opportunities that she never had, so they can be successful.

Her greatest wish is to build a decent home and with the help from her husband, she hopes to achieve it very soon.

She currently has many needs, one of which is that she does not have electricity. This is why she is requesting financing from Soluz Honduras to buy a solar system that will allow her to give her children a safer and more healthy life.

loans.use: to buy a solar system to improve her home.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit, with her husband and daughter, lives in Sevan city of Gegargunik region. She is a teacher with many years of work experience in this filed. She has higher pedagogical education and she is highly qualified specialist of the Armenian Language and Literature. 

Starting from 1982 till today she works at the school as a teacher of Armenian Language and Literature. Anahit also gives paid private courses for her pupils who are going to pass entrance exams. Anahit wants to make her private courses more informative and interesting and this is the reason that she asks a loan of 700.000 Armenia drams to buy a computer, accessories for it and also professional task books for her private courses.

loans.use: to buy computer, accessories for it and also professional task books for her private courses

loans.name: Dudi

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma agents, Dudi. Dudi lives in Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. He is happily married. He sells small drinks and mobile airtime credits for his community. He decided to join Ruma because he wants to try another business opportunity, as well as give more contribution to his community. Dudi feels happy because since he joined Ruma, he can get a lot of knowledge about how to manage a business. 

As the business grows, Dudi is hoping to get a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. Having known about the importance, your loan will be very useful to help Dudi improves his business and accordingly, his community who needs access to such services. Dudi's goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve an e-commerce business to his community, Ruma's latest product called 'Mapan', so his community can have better products with lower prices. 

Dudi is the one who is seen in the photo,standing in his small stall. He thanks you for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases and utility bill payments (like electricity, water, etc) for members of his local community.

loans.name: Msigani Group

texts.en:
Frida, who is in her early 30s, is married with two children: one is still in school and one is still small.  She has been a food vendor for two years now.  She works from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit. 

This will be Frida's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to increase on the food stock and has paid back her loan successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees, to repay the loan and cover household expenses.  She will use this loan to restock the out of stock items in the mamalishe (a local restaurant or cafe) store. She dreams of owning a hotel.

Frida will share this loan with her loan group Msigani, which has four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out of stock items in mamalishe store

loans.name: Anush

texts.en:
Anush is 46 years old and she lives in Sevan city of Gegharkunik region. She lives here with her son. Her husband is in the Russian Federation for work. So mainly alone and sometimes with the help of her son (he works as a builder) Anush takes care of her farm and cattle in it. Here she has cows, calves, sheep and lambs and she perfectly organizes of her farm’s milk, cheese, curd and meat. Anush has never done any work except farming, so she is great master in this occupation and she is happy to cover the main part of her family needs thanks to her farming. 

Now with this loan she wants to enlarge the numbers of her farm cattle; she wants to buy one more cow and also fodder for all her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy one more cow and also fodder for all her farm cattle

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 36 years old, married woman and a mother of 8 children. She is doing business of tailoring for many years to support her husband. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of household with the educational needs of children. That is why she started tailoring at home to support her family well. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. 

At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. Now she has requested for a loan of 30000 PKR  to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons, ribbons and laces for meeting the orders on time. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Rukhsana hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons, ribbons and laces for meeting the orders on time

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 42-year-old married mother of 6 children. 

Parveen deals in the business of selling animals with her son, who is also shown in the photo. She makes a good amount of income through her work. 

Now, Parveen has requested a Murabaha-type loan of 25,000 PKR in order to purchase more cattle to resell at the market. 

Parveen desires to improve her standard of living through all of her efforts.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle to resell at the market

loans.name: Mungu Nipe Group

texts.fr: Grâce au coaching d'un coordinateur agricole, Morine a appris avec les autres la culture du riz. cette activité lui permet de prendre en charge ses enfants quoique très souvent les plantes sont frappées par des maladies incurables. Elle espère de mieux en mieux améliorer ses conditions de vie et celle de ses enfants à partir d'une bonne récolte et d'un espace cultural plus étendu. Elle est accompagné de son fils sur photo, membre du groupe MUNGU NIPE.
texts.en:
Morine is a member of the group MUNGU NIPE. With the coaching of a farming coordinator, she and others learned to grow rice. This activity allows her to provide for her children, although she often has to deal with her crops suffering deadly diseases. 

She hopes to continue to improve her family’s living conditions through good harvests and the expansion of her farmable land. 

In the photo she is seen with her son, also a member of MUNGU NIPE.

loans.use: to cover the cost of maintenance, and to buy fertilizers and phytosanitary products.

loans.name: Al Rawad Group

texts.en:
Faten is the featured borrower for Al Rawad Group. She joined with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Faten is a 36-year-old married mother of one child. She started five years ago selling accessories and cosmetics to help her husband in covering the expenses and needs of their family. She is a hard worker who is well known in her area. She succeeded throughout the years to gain her loyal customers.

 Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with a new collection of cosmetics and accessories for the summer season to satisfy her customers' needs. Faten is the second lady on the right, Mayssam is the first lady on the right, Rasha is the second lady on the left, and Rajaa is the first lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with new collections of cosmetics and accessories

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is 41 years old. She is from the capital of Georgia, Tbilisi city. She lives with her husband, who works in security services and gets a fixed salary. Nino was unable to find a stable job, and she started work as a helpmeet in a family. She gets a small income but has a great desire to better the living condition of her family. 

Nino requested a loan from local financial institutions several times to start a trading business but had no success. Her loan request was rejected each time because the creditors did not find the existing family income to be sufficient to approve the loan. Nino requested a loan from Credo, and her loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative by Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides credit with soft conditions for the country's rural poor who, regarded as high-risk borrowers because of their low income, do not have access to credit products. 

With this loan, Nino will purchase stock of various kinds of clothing and will start selling in her community at increased prices. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the family's income, and the family members will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to start a clothing trading business

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein, 24 years old, is the breadwinner for his family of 6 members. 

Hussein rented a shop last year where he sells fruits and vegetables for a living. He is an ambitious young man who needs to expand his inventory so he can support his family. 

In order for Hussein to buy more products to resell, he needs a YOUTH loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua. The support given to Hussein will allow him to develop his business and work.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Khroch's Group

texts.en:
Khroch’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Khroch makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. 

Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Zevaroi

texts.en:
Zevaroi is a generous woman who was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in the family of workers. She is married and has three children. She has 16 years of experience of working as a cleaning woman. It is her third time getting a loan from our organization. She is trustee client at IMON and each time makes repayments at time. 

She wants to be treated at a hospital. She wishes to be supported and awaits KIVA lenders kindness.

loans.use: to be treated at a hospital

loans.name: Mehsneh

texts.en: Mehsneh, 58 years old and the mother of 5 children, has a shop where she sells vegetables and fruits. Due to her need to expand her business, Mehsneh needs to buy more seasonal fruits and vegetables. In order to do so, she needs a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua. She will then be able to expand her shop, as well as add more products. She aims to develop her work even further.

loans.use: To buy more seasonal fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Fadia

texts.en:
Fadia is 35 years old and a mother of 2 children. She is a skilled laborer in the crafts domain, and she has been working in that field since 2011. She aspires to develop her work and expand it by buying more materials and machines. 

Fadia also hopes to open a market for fruits and vegetables. In order to do so, she needs a loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua so as to start her new business and expand her work.

loans.use: to open a market for fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Askhob

texts.en:
Askhob is a bright young man. He was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1992 and is living in a big beautiful place with his parents. He is single and has a dream to be a teacher, so he studied with excellence at school. 

He successfully entered the university to get a higher education and is a freshman student. He says that classes are interesting and interactive and he likes his specialty. 

He is asking financial support to pay his higher education costs. He wants to to graduate with excellence and work to help his parents. He is informed about Kiva and hopes to be financed.

loans.use: to pay his higher education costs

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Fifty-six-year old Vilma engages in fishing. She sells fresh fish to earn a living. She also engages in buying and selling additional fish and squid. 

Vilma is a married woman with five grown children. She hails in the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. She needs funds to support her fishing livelihood.

She is asking for a loan to purchase fishing materials, like nylon and weights, and materials for her boat, like paint and plywood. These will boost her fishing yield and improve her income. This would enable Vilma to pay her obligation and balance her finances. Thus, she could start to expand her business and possibly venture into other business opportunities.

Vilma is determined to handle both of her sources of income to become productive and sustainable.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials, like nylon and weights, and materials for her boat, like paint and plywood

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is a married woman and has five young children to nurture. She is from Bien Unido, Bohol and is engaged in the fishing business. Aside from fishing, Maricel also buys and sells squid. Maricel’s husband is also a fisherman, and they work hard for their family. 

She is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy materials for fishing such as a fishing net and a fishing rod. She will also buy more squid to sell. Maricel's greatest dream is to send all her children to school to get a degree.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net, a fishing rod, and squid

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is 59 years old and she is rather active and laborious woman who likes her farm its care and all the work connected with it, which she manages with pleasure.   She lives in Ddmashen village of Gegharkunik region. On her farm she has cows, calves, pigs, sheep and chickens. With the help of her husband Natalya sells her farm’s milk, meat and eggs. She usually manages to have great orders of meat sales, since city butchers like her farm’s meat since it is always fresh and of very high quality. Natalya also cultivates potato and peppers on her plot of land which she sells to re-sellers at the city’s wholesale market. 

This loan Natalya asks she wants to buy one more cow for her farm and also fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy one more cow for her farm and also fodder for her farm cattle

loans.name: Twitezimbere Group

texts.en:
Twitezimbere Group is led by Velonise who is 42 years old. The group name means “develop each other” in English. 

Velonise is married with 3 children aged between 7 and 20 years. She sells food stuffs and has been doing this business for the past 15 years. 

The group members sell different items, though they all have the same idea for changing their lives. 

With her loan portion, Velonise would like to buy more bananas and sorghum to resell. The profits from her business will be used to improve her standard of living and pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more bananas and sorghum to resell.

loans.name: Rhiza

texts.en:
Rhiza is 27 years old, married and has three children to provide for. To earn a living she is involved in banana production. This business really helps the family meet its daily needs. As a mother, Rhiza has always wanted to give her children a better living. So she decided to borrow a loan to buy fertilizer for the banana farm so that she can produce good-quality bananas and deliver more bananas to the market and make more income.

Rhiza's plan for the future is to save money from her business income to improve her family house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her banana farm.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice to sell.
